Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to party and go crazy”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here go almost a week and oil lost count of all of the crazy things happen around and within the hotel. It is located right infront of the convention center and 5th ave. In the heart of downtown San Diego and close to any bar you want. Restaurants are all over the place and food is great. If your to lazy to walk just take the elevator downstairs to the hotels bar. So many great things to go and see

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Nancy M
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock was unique and fun. All of the staff was young but very professional, there was a real nightlife occurring in the hotel every night of the week, but security was great and I was never worried about being bothered by the bar clientele when I needed a good night's rest. In fact, I couldn't hear any noise from the clubs whatsoever when we were there. The room was very comfortable and the shower was great. I wouldn't think this is a place that would be enjoyed by people with young kids or by older adults. Definitely unique. It would be fun to go there on a weekend get-away with a loved one. I attended a conference though, and it was great because this hotel is directly across the street from the convention center. VERY convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Good Deep Cleaning”
Reviews.Author: StefaniKing
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock San Diego April 1-4 for a convention. The hotel lobby is beautiful and modern - seemed clean and check in was great. I was staying on the 8th floor - got off the elevator and immediately could smell vomit. Also on the way to my room I passed a utility room and when I passed this room there was a sewer odor / stench. That same odor / stench came from the bathroom in my hotel room. There must be a sewer or water issue. That sewer stench and vomit smell were there through my entire stay. The carpets in the hallway and in my room needed a good deep clean. Hotel is starting to show some wear and tear and smell. I work at a casino and there are cleaners for the vomit smell and how hard is it to deep clean the carpets??? I paid $499 per night for a standard double queen room and was disappointed about the cleanliness of this place. Also my mini bar was never restocked throughout my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for the family”
Reviews.Author: Apfrench74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my wife and our 3 year old daughter in a Queen suite. We had a great time. Location is fantastic, so much to see nearby. Went to a Padres game one night. Could see the entrance to the ball park from our balcony. The pool area is very cool. My daughter loves to swim and we had no problems with it being more suited to adults as some other reviewers have commented. The Hard Rock staff were all super friendly and professional. From valet, check in, room service, bar staff and check out, everyone we dealt with each day was fantastic. They made a real effort to speak to us, my daughter especially, and always remembered our names. When we go back o San Diego we'll certainly stay at the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Place to Experience!”
Reviews.Author: ChristyJ123
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The location is fabulous, the memorabilia was great, the room was nice, and we even took advantage of the free (with deposit) rental of a Telecaster Custom guitar!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: LaryssaR
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed at the Hard Rock in San Diego just for one night. The service was unreal, the room was impeccably decorated (we stayed in a King Suite) and the nightclubs had a lot of entertainment value. The only downside was that some of the waitresses at the clubs were rude.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: mikeperez92
Reviews.Content: overall a great experience. the staff was very friendly and did everything in their power to ensure nothing short of a perfect stay. i'm definitely looking forward to our next stay at the hard rock.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool downtown Rocl-n-Roll Property”
Reviews.Author: A3Queen
Reviews.Content: I was greated as "Rock Royalty" and allowed to check in at the "Greenroom". Very nice touch! Cool swanky rock-n-roll hotel. Rooms and suites are all so different (independently owned i believe) so really check around to see what you like best. amazing views, great service, and GREAT location right across from convention center and entire Gaslamp District. Really surprised me how much I dug it.

Reviews.Title: “Most Unique Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: NewOrleans95
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the most unique flavor or atmosphere. In addition the property architecture was in keeping with the unique atmosphere. I'm a 30 plus year facility professional and I was empressed with the upkeep of the property down to the smallest detail. An even more powerful part of the experience was the attitude of the associates especially non-managerial staff. They were empowered to be creative and apparently took great pride in their work. General Manager Robert Cartwright has assembled a most spectacular team of professionals. Good show Robert. I'm now a loyal Hard Rock customer.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st Trip To San Diego”
Reviews.Author: JJQ1986
Reviews.Content: My brother and I recently stayed at the Hard Rock San Diego. We had a great time. The hotel was extremely busy with the night club and the pool party. The hotel is very unique and totally Hard Rock. The room was large and had the best bathroom. The shower had the rain shower system which was great. Our room was on the 11th floor with a view of the Petco Stadium where the San Diego Padres play. The location is right in the entrance of the Gaslamp District with great places to dine and shop. Visit the San Diego Zoo, Old Town, and US Midway navy ship. You also have to do the Old Town ghost tour...its a must! Be sure to eat in Old Town.... Fiesta de Reyes and The Cosmopolitan were great authentic Mexican restaurants. San Diego is a great place to visit and Hard Rock is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: SJFigueroa
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing stay this past weekend at the Hard Rock. Stayed in a Rock Star Silver Suite and it was everything and more I expected. The room was absolutely gorgeous and we were lucky enough to check in a little early. Floor to ceiling windows in the room were awesome and the view blew us away!! The staff at the hotel were all extremely nice and accomadated us with any little extras we needed. Breakfast at Mary Janes was delish! The pool area was a nice area to lounge around while having some drinks. Would absolutely recommend this hotel..gorgeous hotel, great staff and great location to walk to all of the great places in the Gaslamp. Will be going back for many future stays!

Reviews.Title: “Best Service, Most Amazing Experience at any hotel in the Gaslamp!”
Reviews.Author: Travelreviewmister
Reviews.Content: Our Experience: I came to the Gaslamp for a business conference, and brought my girlfriend along to celebrate our two year anniversary. The Guest Services manager at the Hard Rock worked with me from the beginning, providing top-notch excellent service the likes of which you cannot find outside of Vegas. We arrived and were treated as royalty, given complimentary drinks, set up in a fantastic modern and trendy suite with fantastic views of the Gaslamp district. The concierge team had set up special items in our room for our anniversary, and had my girlfriend's favorite music playing as we walked in! All of the staff we encountered, whether we had questions, small problems, or were just walking by, were incredibly energetic, nice, professional and fun. We did everything: Took advantage of the concierge, Massages at Rock Spa, dining at the in-hotel restaurants, drinks at FLOAT, room service. When we found the hotel hot tub was closed for some renovations, the staff took care of us and got us into the Omni hotel's hot tub next door. Pros: Service: If you like being treated fantastically, feeling special, and having a qualified staff truly making your day, stay here! Location: This hotel is literally steps away from the convention center, Petco ballpark, and is a major destination itself within San Diego's Gaslamp district. Unbelievable bars, restaurants, shopping and site-seeing around every corner. Value: This hotel is only a few dollars more than neighboring hotels, but offers many times the service, excitement and buzz than they do. Best value in town! The Rock Star Life: If you like the scene, clubbing, hanging out with friends and listening to great music...this is the place for you. On Saturday nights, the Hard Rock becomes a buzzing hive of activity. It felt like Vegas in the main lobby. Cons: Um, sure...let me think of something. The breakfast food at Mary Jane's was less than stellar. It's a good thing so many other eating choices are within a few blocks. There is no refrigerator in the guest room. Details: We each enjoyed a massage at the Rock Spa, which had very nice staff and luxurious spa rooms with robes, sandals, and complimentary tea, flavored water and amenities for all guests. The Hard Rock staff not only clean your room once a day, they also do a turn-down service at night. We enjoyed the complimentary waters, and flavored rock candy stir-sticks. The suites are amazing! There are rain-fall dual head showers big enough for two (or three!) and very comfortable beds and seating. There is no outside alcohol allowed in the hotel, so plan accordingly. If you've got the money, in-room or poolside bottle service is available most of the day. This hotel is for the party-rocking crowd. If you like a quiet lobby and sedate surroundings, stay elsewhere (and maybe avoid the Gaslamp altogether). If you're like me and love to people watch and let loose and mingle, this is your kind of place. I've enjoyed the Gaslamp many times, and have stayed at Solamar, the Sofia, the Hilton, and now the Hard Rock, and when I come back, I'll be staying at the Hard Rock Hotel every time. Best.Business.Trip.Ever.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelorette Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Ashley M
Reviews.Content: We had a near perfect stay at the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego. The atmosphere at the hotel is great for a party weekend in San Diego. It is walking distance to tons of bars and restaurants. Mary Jane's bar/restaurant in the hotel has good food for decent prices, and is open late. The standard rooms with 2 queens are a little on the small side, and the room rates seemed a little high for April. The hotel staff were all very nice and friendly. Our only disapoinment was that we requested extra glasses and ice buckets twice and never recieved them. If you are willing to pay for the party atmosphere, it is worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel really rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Pierchen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel one week ago. All I can say is: this Hotel really is the place to be. Great rooms, state of the art installations, clean, all for a reasonable price. The bars are all great, although the rooftop bar (Float) is defintely the best one. The pool is a bit too small though. However, given the fact that it is on the roof, it's acceptable. The staff is very nice and helpful. Overall, I can only recommend the hotel. Will defintely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Scott R
Reviews.Content: Just a quick stay in SD and finally at the HR. It was an awesome trip with a great stay at the hotel. Hopefully longer next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: firecoopsd23
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Hard Rock Hotel San Diego for a staycation. I live in the north county and routinely come down to stay at the HRH because of their wonderful accommodations. They always greet me with superior customer service beginning with the valets and continuing to the front desk and on through my entire stay. They have great restaurants and fun bars clubs to go to. I look forward to my next stay in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the definition of great customer service!!! I've stayed at several hotels in several different cities and have never had such a great experience. From the moment we were greeted by valet upon arrival til the moment we left there was exceptional service at every encounter! They go far beyond taking the extra step to make sure you are comfortable and have everything you need no matter how little or big!

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back for more!”
Reviews.Author: Rob Z
Reviews.Content: This hotel prides itself on treating it's guests like "Rock Stars", and the Hard Rock Hotel San Diego certainly delivers. I've stayed here on a few occasions since my initial review in August of 2011, and every stay has been exceptional. Everything about the Hard Rock screams "cool", from the giant LED wall behind reception, to the vintage memorabilia installations scattered throughout the hotel, to the rooms themselves, if you're looking for "hip", you've found it here. What separates this property from others, is that they match their style with substance. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly. You can tell that quality of service is a top level priority to the management and staff here. Case in point? The lobby diner, Maryjane's, has both Aunt Jemima AND Mrs. Butterworth's syrup for my pancakes. Believe me, its the details that count most to me, and that's why I'll continue to stay at the Hard Rock whenever my travel schedule allows me.

Reviews.Title: “Fun time, great deal”
Reviews.Author: odieflem
Reviews.Content: We stayed for opening weekend of Padres with a great special of $99. We had a beautiful view of the Coronado bridge and bay. Danced at the 207 lobby bar and had a fabulous breakfast at MaryJanes.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris760
Reviews.Content: First time stay, and it was great. I felt very welcomed and it was just so close to the stadium .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but just so expensive”
Reviews.Author: QueenKat_9
Reviews.Content: Great location, fantastic rooms (all suites), cool vibe. You really can't fault any of it. Almost certainly the best hotel I've stayed in CA. Except when you get the bill. Very expensive at $360 for a room in April. You'll enjoy staying here as long as money is no issue.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars”
Reviews.Author: sim c
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the better hotels in all of CA. Great staff, tasty food, great bar. Don´t miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Fun but expensive”
Reviews.Author: kittykat8831
Reviews.Content: Had a nice time. Concierge was super helpful to assist my husband to entertain my 5 year old with places to go even in the rain while I worked. Thanks Robbie. Was right across from the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location, party central...”
Reviews.Author: SKilroy
Reviews.Content: Our room was a suite and it had everything the website shows on line (comfy bed, awesome shower, bar, 2 TV's, etc.). I went with my son and it was extremely convenient to everything (we never needed our car); save the $37 a day valet fee and walk or take a taxi to where you need to go. There was a roof top pool that was very nice but as expected drinks were a bit pricey. I was really surprised to see families with small children at the hotel. This is a hotel that caters to the young crowd and that was obvious at night because you could hear all the partiers coming home at all hours. If you are looking for peace and quiet, this isn't the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “"Location, service, vibe"”
Reviews.Author: Johnson T
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is amazing, right in the heart of the Gaslamp quarter. Walking distance to restaurants and clubs. The staff was friendly and they upgraded me to a suite because it was my anniversary. The hotel parties at the pool and lobby area are cracking, vegas-style. The front lobby on weekends are like a club scene with a fun crowd. If you want to have a good time and u like to party, go to the Hard Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, outstanding property”
Reviews.Author: Beebosdad
Reviews.Content: Great location right in Gas Lamp. Nobu is a fantastic dinner spot with incredible service and food. The room as nice as I've stayed in my many nights on business trips. Staff was friendly and helpful, and as you'd expect, upbeat attitudes.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location...”
Reviews.Author: italiansharks
Reviews.Content: Good property with nice style. Best location of all for visiting what downtown SD has to offer and great proximity to the convention center or ball park.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for young people”
Reviews.Author: Ivy418
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and located at a great location. When you open the room your favorite music will play in the room! This is a major plus for me cause I love music! Bars and restaurants are also great. The only thing is it could get loud at night so if you are staying there make sure you are in party mode!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, clean & great location”
Reviews.Author: Bitsylou
Reviews.Content: Got a special offer from Snique away so, it gave us an excuse to fly down to San Diego for a short vacation. Had a great time at Hard Rock Hotel! .... Really cool. We brought along our 14 year old and 2- 24 year olds , they had a blast. The staff were top notch in customer service. The Hotel really gives you an inside look at the rock n roll world and tries to make you feel like you are a rock star with little details in your hotel room. Even the coffee shop in the hotel had great food ( Breakfasts rock! so to speak )and people were nice. Situated right there in the Gas Lamp district , across from the trolly and the convention center.. you don't need much more. Thanks Hard Rock for making our trip to fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great customized visit”
Reviews.Author: julie b
Reviews.Content: We live locally and decided to stay downtown so we didn't have to drive home after my fiance's 40th birthday celebration. We chose Hard Rock because of it's reputation and proximity to the bars. When I made my reservation online I indicated the reason for our stay. We were SO impressed with the hotel's customized service for his Birthday! The staff for valet parking, check-in, etc. were super friendly and helpful. It felt like all the staff knew in advance and gave him their birthday wishes, and we even had a group of three employees come to our room after check in to sing happy birthday and deliver free beers, cake and snacks. It was fantastic. The reason I didn't give five stars was because of the suite we were in. I paid extra for the "Float Suite", which I was under the impression walked right out onto the pool patio/bar area. We were disappointed in that we couldn't even see the pool (there was a big eyesore of a tent right outside our patio door) and the patio furniture that was outside our room had cigarette burns in it and looked like it was the bar's old furniture just placed outside our room so it looked like we had our own set-up.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: TimHistoryBuff
Reviews.Content: My first visit to the Hard Rock Hotel. The rooms were modern, clean and quiet, hence the above average review. I didn't hear any noise late at night. Good location within walking distance of the city centre. There's no parking garage but the valet service was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: Melissa M
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a night in the Hard Rock Hotel with my mother and daughter. We all had an extremely nice visit. I was initially impressed by the bellman who was personable and friendly without being pushy. He was natural and engaging with my daughter and she took to him right away. We found every staff member that we interacted with in the hotel to be friendly (again, in a genuine way). The room was modern and elegant without being overly cold. We also enjoyed room service that was hot, delicious, and prompt and two yummy breakfasts at the coffee shop, Mary Jane's. We also spent time in the pool and jacuzzi on the roof deck and were taken with the mood and scene on a beautiful California night. We will definitely stay at the Hard Rock next time we are in San Diego. Although it was a Friday night we were not disturbed by any of the festivities going on at the pool bar as the night progressed (though I was tempted to check out the scene).

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here with Kids!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Connie W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because our 14 year old loves everything Hard Rock! Worst decision we have ever made. We arrived at 1:30am and we couldn't even hear the person who was booking us in because of the loud music from the night club. Ridiculous location for the front desk. Once we got to our room we were up all night because they booked us right next to the party tent... lovely! The next night we were up all night because of the noise from the partiers all around us. I realize it's the Hard Rock Hotel but come on, if you are booking in a family, don't put them next to the party tent, put the 20 year old there! I spoke with the Manager before he left and he was apologetic but couldn't comp us a night because be book through Expedia... ridiculous! He offered to set us up really well for next time but there will NEVER be a next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Does It Again!”
Reviews.Author: Taylor M
Reviews.Content: We visited San Diego on a business trip for a convention held at the convention center. The Hard Rock is directly across the street from the convention center, a five minute walk with time to wait for the traffic lights to change. Driving from the airport to the hotel was an interesting challenge, if you are coming down harbor drive (in front of the convention center) you will have to circle the block because 5th Ave is one-way so you can pull in front of the hotel for valet parking. I will note, valet parking was ridiculously expensive! About $40 a day, plus tips, by far the most expensive valet parking I have ever had to pay anywhere. There is public parking which is $24 a day around the corner. The lobby was very modern, they were playing music when we first walked in, and behind the desk they have a wall sized LCD screen playing music videos. We got in on Saturday afternoon, the front desk quickly checked us in, and got us up to our room on the 11th floor to our room facing Petco Park. I will warn all of you, your key card is required to go anywhere in the elevator, so be sure to have it with you all the time. The hotel was very quiet, with the exception of Saturday night. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. The maids do not automatically come and clean the room. There is a door hanger that is two sided indicating if you are requesting a room cleaning, but the front desk explains all of this in detail upon arrival. The rooms are very clean and well set up. The mini bar and snack bar is filled with all sorts of interesting things; they had everything from red bull, vodka, reeses, to the first aid kits or a toothbrush. The bars downstairs were both very nice, but what really impressed me was the restaurant Mary Jane's downstairs. By far the best restaurant in the hotel! We only had a noise issue on Saturday night, due to all of the partying downstairs, I briefly visited downstairs and they had the elevator area roped off and were ID-ing guests coming in from the outside. The hotel is within walking of a ton of fabulous restaurants and Westerfield Plaza. The trolley stops right in front of the hotel. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bs_cb
Reviews.Content: I did not know what to expect since I have never stayed at a Hard Rock before. I really enjoyed my stay here and want to go back. It's located on the edge of the gas lamp district with so many places to walk to. The staff was great, I was treated like I was at a 5 star hotel. The room was awesome, big, well decorated and a cool shower with 2 shower heads. Not much more to say, it was a perfect stay. Love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelorette party weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie F
Reviews.Content: I called to book the rooms for a Bachelorette Party and from the first call to our VIP check in, the service was FANTASTIC! Someone even called the day before we arrived to ask if there was anything they could do or anything we may need prior to our arrival. Eli at VIP check in was so accomodating and helpful...even made us drinks! Jeff and Robbie in concierge totally took care of us and made reservations (which took so much stress off of me, because I was the planner for the weekend), they even had a beautiful dessert try and card sent to us at the restaurant we dined at (which was not in the hotel). and last but not least, both Alex and Bentley the bellhops were so great about our luggage and helping us get our car from valet! One of our girls even forgot a toothbrush and when I called downstairs to ask where I could get one, or if there was a place to buy one, Mike said he would just send one up. He sent 2 and a tube of toothpaste!! So awesome since we werent even out of bed yet and didnt want to get up and get dressed! The rooms were great! The beds were super comfortable and plenty of outlets for all of us to plug in our phones. We definitely felt like we got the "Rockstar" treatment! Thanks to all at San Diego Hard Rock for making our Bachelorette Party experience and stay so awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to celebrate my birthday!!”
Reviews.Author: Kirsten257
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Hard Rock for my birthday! The staff was very friendly and attentive! The room size was very spacious and I had a great view of downtown. The location is perfect--just a short block to great dining and dancing later. My only wish was that I could have stayed longer! I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “It was fabulous super fun !! Great vibe!”
Reviews.Author: Armeniamexico
Reviews.Content: Loved the hard rock!! the staff was wonderful helpful Attentive VIP status from the min you walk . The pool area float was superb fun!!!!!! Great vibe it was the best girls weekend ever thanks Hard Rock Family !!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday to Remember”
Reviews.Author: L_R32
Reviews.Content: I have been trying to get to San Diego for over a year now and decided that I would go for my birthday. I came down for one night and the check in process was so fast. I love how they walk around and greet you and work from Mac Book Desktops. I was given a complimentary upgrade which was so awesome and the staff there were so friendly. When I was given my key, the guy was right behind us with our bags. He was so amazing and cute too :). He asked why we came out here, told me happy birthday, gave us good ideas on places to go and to eat. After putting our bags in our room he went and got ice for us with out even asking. The room was great size. I had 10 of my friends who came out and the room was big enough to accomadate all of us. I love how you walked in and there was a den which included a lounge sofa and table and mini bar. In the front room was a cord that connected to the tv where would could play our music from our phone on the tv. I thought that was nice High Tech option. The bathroom and shower were on seperate sides of the room which i did like, however i did not like the shower because there was an extra step you had to take to get in it which didnt make since because it was all wet and some one could fall and hurt them self if they did not see it. The shower was nice on the other end because the water came from both the top and from an angle. Our room faced the side where baseball standium was and had an ipod ready hook up in there as well. the room had a curtain that seperated the room from the den which i thought was lovely because i could keep my personals left out with out any one going into the room and being worried about anything. Overall, this hotel rocked. I did not get a chance to get to the bars but i know they are twice as amazing. In the morning mary janes was really crowded so i would def. have to try that place when i come back to this side of town. the check out process was very fast and easy. San Diego was the best place to enjoy my birthday from the night life to the hotel everything was outstanding. I would come back to San Diego and stay here any time of the day, month or year. I love it. Thank you to the staff for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Graduation”
Reviews.Author: Sarah G
Reviews.Content: I flew down for my Masters Graduation ceremony in July 2008. The hotel was bard new at the time so I paid top dollar for two rooms. I had various family members staying each night so I had counted on my rooms being cleaned. WRONG! I had to beg management to have my rooms serviced. He went and checked the rooms and indicated that one appeared clean. I told him I cleaned that room with the cleaning products left behind when I checked in. Did i mention I almost drank used mouth wash as well! Anyways, our room service was never picked up even when the rooms were finally serviced, so I dumped everything in the hallway where it stayed until we checked out. Upon checkout the manager comped my room service bill which was a nice touch. I realize it was a busy weekend but the trip was a disaster. I completed a survey and was eventually emailed a free night. I broke out in the worst case of hives from the detergent from their sheets that I never used it. I can't say I will ever stay her again. I did enjoy Nobu and the club entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: sprinter41
Reviews.Content: Week long stay at Hard Rock San Diego for Convention. The hotel is very nice, the staff was exceptional. Had a King Studio, by far the smallest 270.00 room I have ever stayed in, including NYC. No coffee maker in the room, had to go to lobby for coffee. Who wants to see my ugly mug in the beautiful lobby before getting costume on ! Hint to HR put coffee makers in rooms. Went to lobby bar for cocktail, over 20.00 for a drink and a beer ! ! Never stepped foot in there again ! ! I will no doubt NOT choose the Hard Rock again when I attend the convention next year. Other hotels in the same area offer much better in room amenities for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected.”
Reviews.Author: Lindstravels
Reviews.Content: On arrival my partner and I had to wait some time to check in. We were unaware that it is normal in the USA to have a 4pm check in (most UK hotels are 2pm). Unfortunately this was not communicated to us very well by check in staff. If the receptionist had advised us that our room would not be ready until 4pm we would have probably done some sight seeing. Instead we were told that the room should be ready soon so we decided to wait around in the bar. The room wasn't ready until 4pm, meaning that we had been waiting for two hours. Whilst I wouldn't expect that a room would be ready before check in, it would have preferable that we were told that it would be ready for 4pm rather than leading us to believe it may be ready sooner. This wasn't helped by how irritable we were from travelling. (We had been awake since 2am). After we were let in to our room and we had unpacked it was late on in the day and we were only staying for 2 nights and so we were looking forward to using the pool the next day (our only full day in the resort). The room was clean and nicely decorated. The next day, we went out in the morning and came back just after lunch to use the pool. Unfortunately we were advised on arrival that it had been hired out to a private party along with the poolside bar for the remainder of the day. This was extremely disappointing as I think hotel guests should really have priority use of the facilities. We decided to go back out for the remainder of the afternoon and came back early evening and decided to go for drink in the downstairs bar. I was extremely annoyed to find out that this had also been hired out for the evening. When checking out we were told that we had to pay a resort fee (this was a new term to me) and when I asked what it covered, the receptionist told me it covered the use of facilities. Given the limited access that we had to these, I think that the resort fee should not have been charged. I didn't have the energy to argue. I was disappointed with my stay at the Hard Rock Hotel and I doubt I will be returning. The only saving grace was the valet staff, who were fantastically friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaTravelbug123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Gaslamp District in the downtown area and is just a block from Petco Park. There are 2 clubs and an adjacent restaurant, as well as a gift shop. The parking is expensive so we chose to park a block away in a parking garage, and it seemed to be safe. There are tons of shops and restaurants in walking distance. San Diego Zoo was just a short drive away. Corondo Island is also nearby and has great cityscapes views. The hotel itself is very clean and probably one of the most interesting hotels that I have stayed in. The decor is very rock and roll, of course and the staff was friendly. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again on my next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Rocks Hard”
Reviews.Author: SSAASSHHAA
Reviews.Content: Wanna Party? Then this place is for you. This place scores high (probably best in San Diego) on Location, Style, Fun, Convenience, Coolness. Obviously if you're looking for a solid night's sleep and peaceful contemplation - you're barking up the wrong tree. It's more a place for micro-skirts and super-cars, bad tattoos and good music... You know, fun! Think Bachelor/Bachelorette party. Think night on the town. Think living like a Rock Star craziness. All that said, I still slept well even with a 5th Ave. facing room. Another top mark is for the service. Everybody was super nice and helpful. No snootiness sometimes associated with 'cool' hotels. It's a party Hotel, and it does that well. So if you're in the mood to party anywhere between LA and Mexico - you can't do any better.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation to remember!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Richie B
Reviews.Content: First and foremost the HARD ROCK SAN DIEGO is one of the most unique hotels ive stayed in.. Beautiful property with awesome nightclubs(indoor and outdoor).. The staff was excellent!! Very courteous and always willing to fulfill the guest needs!! The rooms were great, I wasnt expecting much because it was a basic room. To my surprise it was much nicer and roomier than many other hotel room upgrades.. All in all excellent time, definately made the vacation that much better... Again the staff from A to Z was excellent!! Also great place to stay if you're on a budget.. Great ammenities for the money!!! Dont waste your time taking a chance else where and take it from me... You wont be unsatisfied!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place In San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Jessica S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock for my husbands birthday. Our check in was a fast and friendly. Our room was Awesome and we had a "Birthday Gift" sent to our room, which my husband loved! We had a Great time at Float drinks were perfect and the dancing was a blast. We will always go to the Hard Rock for our Celebration needs!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Party Hotel”
Reviews.Author: queenjansson
Reviews.Content: This was a weekend for my husband and I to relax and let loose and this was the perfect hotel to do so. We stayed in a Float suite which was awesome!!! The bed was sooo comfotable. The bars were awesome as well as the whole staff itself. Your within walking distance to everything in Gaslamp District which is awesome. We will definatly come back many more times!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not your average hotel”
Reviews.Author: foghog333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock for six nights with the majority of them in conjunction with a national conference. During the week days things were great with few issues. On Friday evening with several events going on the noise levels on our floor were nuts! It started at 8:00 PM and didn't stop until well after midnight. As we had to get up early for our return flight back east on Saturday morning that last night was not pleasant. We can appreciate that folks stay here to have a good time, however if you want to raise hell in the hallways go find a frat house, not an expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fave in SD so far”
Reviews.Author: gretchstars
Reviews.Content: This is my fave in SD so far. Took my BFF for her bachelorette party last year and loved it. Got a rollaway bed for our big party. Bathroom is small though and door is not very private. Would have loved a view of the pool, but had small deck with view of the street. There is so much to do here though, and the location is great. Young crowd - 20s-40s. Saw a friend's BEP suite one summer, and it was huge, with a great view of the skyline and pool. The club downstairs is fun and lively.. Mary Jane's was awesome for a 2am grilled cheese, the pool is small and weird, but if its not too hot, you can lounge in the couches - but they aren't by the pool. Rooftop club was pretty fun too. You can walk anywhere in downtown from here - oh and NOBU is amazing for sushi. Good times!

Reviews.Title: “Rockin Birthday Experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: msintelligent1
Reviews.Content: I had an awesome experience!! I celebrated my 40th birthday & I felt like royalty!.. Natalie @ vip check-in ROCKS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Even better the second time around!”
Reviews.Author: Sp1014
Reviews.Content: I've already reviewed Hard Rock once, but I feel obligated to write more than my small review from the first time. I live in San Diego and hardly ever stay at hotels in the area, but I've had the luxury of staying at Hard Rock twice now. The service is phenomenal and I can't rave enough about how comfortable the bed is. This hotel is so unique compared to anything else around because where else can you see an outfit of Janis Joplin's, a sketch of Jerry Garcia's, or a telegram of Elvis' on the way to your room?! It's a MUST for any fan of music.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: RachandLil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful week at this hotel. We stayed in a RockStar suite - which was located on the Petco Park side. Whilst some street noise was heard during early hours of the morning, for us it just added to the excitement of living at the entrance of the Gaslamp Quarter. The suite was spacious, modern and very clean. The room service and Mary Janes Cafe had a wide variety of delicious food and drinks which we really enjoyed. Mini bar had a large range to choose from, however it was not replenished for our entire stay! This was disappointing but instead we tried several of the bars on 5th Ave. The staff were all really friendly and accommodating which was great to experience. Unfortunately we didn't have time to try the rooftop pool bar as we ran out of time. My overall experience was awesome, we would definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Avoid Weekends Unless You're There to Party”
Reviews.Author: KL-XVIII
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights recently for a company conference held at the hotel. I checked in on a Saturday and was astonished at the mass of people in the place - almost zoo-like. I was also annoyed that guests have to pay a cover charge just to get in the overcrowded hotel bars on the weekend. Our company spent well into 6 figures for a meeting here, but there are no benefits given for doing that, like access to the hotel bar. The place caters to the public and not to guests on weekends. I wasn't there on a Friday to see what that's like, but forget trying to sleep on a Saturday night. There were people going in and out of rooms and screaming in the hallways all night long, finally quieting down at 6 am. I thought this was going to be a long week at the place. Rating the hotel 2 stars at this point. What a difference a day makes. By Sunday afternoon, spring break at Ft. Lauderdale was over and the loud drunk 20-somethings were gone and the place was more normal. The Club 207 bar on the ground floor was a disappointment repeatedly. On a couple of nights almost immediately after pouring our group many drinks, bouncers drove everyone out of the place in a not very cool way at what seemed to be random times, once just after 12:30. I guess take the money and treat people poorly is the business strategy here. Rooms at the place are nice and the housekeeping quality is good. Good shower with rain head. The meeting facilities were one of the highlights of the property. Everything was well organized and the catering was good, with the exception of the lunches being held in tents in an area nearby the pool where the temperature was uncomfortably cold for most people. For business travel in the Gaslamp area, I prefer the Solamar which is a quieter place.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: Jocelyn35
Reviews.Content: Our group was here for a three day work conference. The first night we were told that their were no standard rooms available but they could put us in a suite. Wonderful I thought. However...we were asked to checkout of the suite the next day when a standard room became available. Instead of transferring our bill and moving our luggage for us...We had to miss a good 1/2 hour of the conference go get out bags, bring them down to the desk, check out and recheck in! Oh and btw..."your new room isn't available till 4:00pm." VIP passes to 207? What a joke! So before 10pm we stood in line to get in at 207 showed our room card but that wasn't good enough. He then directed us to the front desk to yet stand in line again for them fill out a ticket. Again...stood in line to then present this ticket to the door dude at 207. I asked "why were these 207 tickets not given at check in?" I got the answer of "I don't know?". The leather chairs in the rooms are worn and dirty. Showers were nice when you had hot water. If you want to sleep early bring ear plugs as 207 plays until 2:30am. But the front desk will give you pair if requested. Honestly...not a great overall experience. I was waiting for the "how was your stay" question when we checked out but was never asked. Poor customer service!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: dentaldivaLPH
Reviews.Content: We were in SanDiego for a business meeting which was being held at this hotel, and it was a fun experience, with good food and nightlife there and nearby. Rooms were nice, modern and quiet, even tho there was live music in one of the main floor rooms and music in the club, 207. Great memorabilia everywhere. Improved lighting in the rooms and a coffee maker would improve the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Epitome of the Rock n Roll Lifestyle”
Reviews.Author: B P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock February 7-12, 2012 for a conference on Coronado and some R&R. I was overall very pleased with the experience. Here are some details: Check-in: I got the VIP check-in since I booked the trip on Expedia.com where I am an elite member. Basically, this consists of being taken to the "Green Room" where they will give you a drink of your choice during check-in, as well as a free room upgrade. This last part didn't happen because they were full. They told me to check on Friday to see if another room is available, but I never did. I requested a quiet room and got room 705, with pool-view. I didn't realize the first night that my window was open a few inches, letting in the train whistle sound at 3 am. After I closed this, the room was quiet enough. They ask what type of music you prefer at check-in. I requested a free in-room guitar for my stay. You get to pick 3 guitars from a menu and they bring you one of them. For me, none of my 3 choices were available, so they sent me a Fender Telecaster. Being a guitarist, this was a cool perk. I did have to wait about 15 minutes for my room to be ready, although I checked in right at 3pm. Room: They have your favorite style of music playing in the room on your arrival, which is very cool. The room is laid out with rock art work/imagery, lots of alcohol in and out of the fridge, guitar pick sticker on toilet paper roll, etc. I enjoyed all this minus the alcohol, because of the crazy mark-up on alcohol. There is no microwave in the room. We had 2 queen beds, flat screen tv with supposedly HD, but the picture was not in HD. I didn't order any in-room movies. The dual head shower was good and bad--good if you like/need both heads, bad because if you happen to turn one shower head off and turn it back on, it will disperse cold water first. I just left it on one shower head after a brief trial of both. Hard Rock bath scrubber was a nice touch. Gym: I used the gym 3 times during my 6 day stay. It had good upper/lower body machines, treadmills, free weights, etc. There's a flat-screen tv playing rock music videos. I especially liked "Closer to the Heart" by Rush that was played during one of my workouts. There are free towels and water available. The gym is located right next to the Rock Spa, where you could get facials/massages if you wanted to pay for them ($85-several hundred). Room service: not used 207 Club: VIP access before 10 pm, busy on Fridays/Saturdays. Pretty hip place, loud music as expected in a dance club. Overpriced drinks as expected. Mary Jane's, Nobu: not used Valet service: $37 per day, typical for Gaslamp Quarter hotels. I used it for the 3 days of my conference since my work reimburses, then used the much cheaper garage (with 24 hour access) behind the hotel. Location: excellent, right on 5th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: Natalka7101
Reviews.Content: Cheap looking hotel. The hotel has very late check-in 4pm. My husband and I arrived at 3:58 pm and was told our room wasn't ready and we must wait about 15-20 min. We were beyond mad, we were up since 4 am east cost time and had to wait to take a shower!? Rooms are small, very dark, have horrible decor , and you can hear everything! Good for drunk and drugged out rock stars, not people who would like to relax. Be aware of room charges fees that don’t make any sense and $10 for a cup of coffee, not to mention very rude personnel. We checked out the very next day and went to Grand Hyatt on the water.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke Detector Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: questo
Reviews.Content: My party and i checked into the hotel early afternoon. Check in was quick and easy and the staff accommodated my request to be placed in the quiet part of the hotel. We tried to use the hot tub at 8pm and was told that it was closed...at 8 pm??? We thought that was a little unusual. We did use the fitness center which was equipped with treadmills and elliptical machines. There was a decent amount of weight lifting machines and equipment. The hotel itself is located at the base of the Gaslamp district. We were able to shop and had a very nice dinner without having to drive anywhere. Parking at the hotel is quite expensive...$37! There is a parking garage right across the street where we were able to park for $19. The hotel has a business center which I used to print out my boarding ticket the next day. Evidently it is part of the "resort fee" that I had to pay. The fee also included use of their computers in the center as well as wireless in the room. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable, however at 3:30 in the morning the smoke detector started beeping and continued beeping every 30 seconds until 8:30 AM! Needless to say, we had a terrible night sleep. I did advise the staff of the situation upon check-out as I wanted to have their maintenance staff either repair or replace the smoke detector. I didn't get much response other than "I'm sorry". Not sure if I would stay here again as it is quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “For Business....Things to Know”
Reviews.Author: Trippingman
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for almost a week. I was there for a conference at the Convention Center. The Hard Rock is located directly across the street from it. It could not have been more convenient. The hotel is in excellent shape. The maintenance crew does an excellent job of keeping up with things. Check in was a breeze. *****However, make sure you understand their resort fee policy (apprx. $17 per day). Apparently this fee is added to your room charges depending upon which method/portal that is used to make your reservation. My understanding is that the fee covers your internet and local calls. If you need to use a computer, the Business Center in the hotel has 4 available for use for no additional fee. There is also a printer available. Rooms: I stayed in single queen bed layout. It was a decent sized room with a huge bathroom. The bed was comfortable but nothing extraordinary. The pillows were okay too. The shower has a rain head spray fixture and a wall spray fixture. You can control the flow to them as you prefer. The water pressure was great and the water hot. I LOVED THE SHOWER!!! I did not want to get out. Room Location: There are some complaints about noise posted by some reviewers. ****Things to know: The quieter rooms are located along the outside perimeter of the hotel along 6th and K streets. The rooms that are even numbered are located along those streets. THE EXCEPTION - rooms that are even numbered starting with 00 -22 (I think} are located along the street for the front lobby and nightclub. Those are definitely louder ( friends stayed in those rooms and related this to me} The odd number rooms face the pool area and 5th street. They tend to be louder. Staff: I can say without exception that every staff member I encountered was friendly and professional. All seemed to be young and interested in making sure my stay was an enjoyable one. Food: I ate several meals Mary Jane's. Most were for breakfast, with one Happy Hour visit. The service was quick and the food was not your typical food service dreck. Quality ingredients, fresh squeezed orange juice and Star Bucks coffee. MY ONE complaint: they did not have Light Cream for the coffee, which I prefer. I settled for the half and half. Overall: I feel the hotel is geared to a younger progressive clientele. That being said, there people of all ages staying there. Please don't go there thinking it will be a Ritz/Hilton vibe. There is no Muzak on the elevators. There is a steady stream of rock music played through out the hotel. The Hard Rock reminded me of a W Hotel only better. Please feel free to contact me with specific questions....Happy Travels to You All

Reviews.Title: “Great, modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NundC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was outstanding! Modern and chic interior and great location right at the Gaslamp district. We would always recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: lmirabella
Reviews.Content: Great Staff, Great Design, Great Location. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “YES, It rocks!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaEsMuy
Reviews.Content: I love this place. The San Diego Hard Rock has the best crew around! They make everything easy and are always helpful. They go out of their way to make you feel like a rock star---they really want you to feel special from the minute you arrive until the minute you leave...the valet parking dude even asked us if we needed directions as he handed over our car as we were leaving. Nothing beats a late breakfast at Mary Jane's with Bloody Marys and a $5 can of whipped cream...it's become a tradition with me and my peeps. They really do try to make everything fun.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: leidown
Reviews.Content: Above and Beyond, that is how my stay was at the Hard Rock Hotel San Diego. I was there for New Years Eve 2012, and again the greatest hotel in San Diego by far. From the day I arrived till the day I left, nothing but down to earth staff, helpful all the way around. And of course, the NYE party thrown by Hard Rock, no one can touch it... Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “When the phrase VIP pops into my mind, HRH SD is now locked in favorites list.”
Reviews.Author: Nellsxl
Reviews.Content: Great people! Great! I really can't emphasize this point enough. Didn't get a chance to party, I was there for business. I hit a lot of awesome hotels, Gansevoort, W, Ian Schager Hotels list goes on and can say with ease that one of my best experiences in service happened in this Hotel. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy not so much for business traveller, though a good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Yehiel_p
Reviews.Content: Was recommended by my Travelling agent for its good location, for a conference I am visiting. To my opinion the hotel is great for "party animals" and less for business travelers who will seek for a quiet place to rest. Room Devore is very nice and neat. For some reason no prices for the mini bar items (maybe it is all for free...). I think there are other near by hotels for similar or lower prices for business traveller. Or the hotel will offer quieter rooms for such guests. My general rank to them is 3.5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great rock'n'roll and party hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sanslos
Reviews.Content: Hard rock hotel in San Diego is convenient close to city and to San Diego convention center. Very loud and party hotel, you need to stay close to the reception desk to hear info about your roo. The roomas are fantastic, big, modern, designed and we had two big flat screens and of course a good sound system. Unfortunate no balcony. Nice pool that however was closed due to the parties at the pool place...

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: dyldal
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about our experience at this hotel. The location was amazing. The staff was great. The rooms were clean. The mango daquiri's were AMAZING!!! I cannot WAIT to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gas Lamp Launch Pad”
Reviews.Author: chamoorita
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel is the perfect place to stay if you are looking for easy access to the gas lamp and all it has to offer. The rooms are comfortable, the staff friendly and accomodating and the location is within walking distance to the gas lamp or the trolley for more San Diego exploring.

Reviews.Title: “”
Reviews.Author: Jwarner109
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near everything staff very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Very Unique Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: TimShank
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The hotel themes and vibe are extremely unique. Wouldn't say it's a great kid atmosphere but for adults looking to let loose a little bit there is no better place. Rooms were gorgeous along with the views. Amenities were outstanding. Bar, restaurants were also amazing. A really high class place with a unique feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great decor, terrible noise”
Reviews.Author: mcsquirrel
Reviews.Content: Of course, this is the Hard Rock Hotel, so it looks good and has a cool vibe. My room was clean and I really liked the decor, especially the bathroom. I was in town for a convention and the location of this hotel can't be beat. The convention center is about a 5 minute walk, door-to-door. The problem was the noise. I was on the east side of the hotel on the 9th floor, but I kept waking up to people leaving the bar on the ground level, crossing the street and yelling. All the way from the 9th floor - I couldn't believe it. Also - there are train/trolley tracks nearby, and the dinging bell kept waking me up, too. Of course, the worst part was the "Wintervention" party on Sunday night. There were wayyyy tooooo many drunks stomping and yelling through the hallways. I have never been in a hotel of this caliber with such thin walls. I know this is probably considered by most people to be a "party hotel," which is cool, but the rooms could definitely use some quality interior and exterior sound-proofing. Super frustrating! I was essentially paying for a place to sleep, but I couldn't even do that. To me, the cool decor just didn't make up for it, so I rated my room "poor." Just know that, if you plan to sleep here, you may need earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Oozing personality!”
Reviews.Author: lucas193
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock San Diego is absolutely the coolest, funkiest, and most friendly hotels I've ever stayed at! If you're staying in San Diego, the Hard Rock is a must, with it's themed hallways, great restaurants, and close proximity to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design less service..”
Reviews.Author: Ysnan
Reviews.Content: We went here for part of our honeymoon in october this year. Included the fact of the honeymoon in the reservation.. but nothing about that during our stay (not even a card or comment when checking in). I also reserved a quiet room (and checked this at checkin) because of our jetlag and.. we got one next to the elevator.. Combine that with a party and loud partypeople coming by... The hotel and the rooms have a great design and nice shower and beds. Also the location is great (at the beginning of the mainstreet of the gaslamp). If you don't really like to sleep/ if you are a real rockstar this hotel is great!

Reviews.Title: “Always the best at the HRH SD”
Reviews.Author: Sted
Reviews.Content: This is my third time staying at the HRH SD and it was, once again, a great experience. The location of the hotel is ideal; across from the Convention Center and right next to the entrance to the Gaslamp District. It's a modern hotel with a very modern, "cool" vibe. The services and amenities are perfect...either for business or pleasure. Hard to be 207 on the weekend for drinks and as a jumping off point for the Gaslamp district. Mary Jane's has great grub any time of the day. The weekends can get a little crazy here, but that's b/c it's such a perfect social hotel venue. I would not recommend for families...especially on the weekends, but it's the ideal hotel for young professionals, singles, and party-goers. I'll never stay anywhere else in SD!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Business Meetings”
Reviews.Author: calvinfrank
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a two day stay here. I got to say it was a great place. The rooms were clean and refreshing. The bathroom was exceptionally clean. The double shower head was the best by far any hotel I have ever stayed at. The business meeting rooms were really nice as well. The staff really worked with us well to make sure everything was ok. The snacks and drinks for the meeting were perfect for the meetings. I think the best part of the whole hotel was the people that worked there. No matter who we approached for information they helped us out. Everyone knew the answer or where to get the answer. I could tell the Hard Rock invested in customer relations. They all knew what to do and say. It was just an all around great experience. All rock memorabilia was really cool too. If you need a place for a business trip or for some meetings, then this is the place. I heard everyone saying something about the train but I must not of been on that side because I never heard the train my entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hard Rock Hotel i've ever been to!”
Reviews.Author: greg c
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at my share of Hard Rock Hotels around the country but this one is state of the art! The lobby is really modern and the rock n roll memorabilia hanging up was great to look at too. The rooms were really modern as well but unbelievably comfortable. I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Worried it was going to be another "W" type of hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChristineL0cke
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock on business that I had across the way at the Convention Center, and ONLY picked the Hard Rock because of its great location. I was worried that this was going to be another one of those "boutique" hotels that trip over themselves in their attempt to be cool. Not the Hard Rock . . . it really IS that cool. It's clean, the staff is super friendly, the background music in the common areas is terrific, and the rooms . . . oh, my room. Great to have my own music to greet me upon arrival at my room. The bathroom was super clean, and the linens were delightful. I had a room on the 12th floor, so I was worried that there might be roof noise, but luckily there wasn't. WiFi was fine, check out was swift, and breakfast at MaryJane's was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Clean, Comfortable, Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoCharley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference taking place in the hotel. Room was fantastic although my one big complaint is the amount of alcohol that is set-up in the room upon arrival. I realize the "rock star life" type of theme they have going on (drugs and alcohol theme runs strong even in the titles of food items on the menus...) is part of the hotel's marketing, obviously, but I think a little more respect to the customers is in order. Hotel should at least provide a heads-up or a choice to have the mass amounts of alcohol in your room or not. Please be advised if you or someone you are booking hotel with has any issues with or is in recovery of alcohol or drugs...it's entrenched in this hotel. Depending on your family's style and if you are traveling with kids/teens, this hotel may or may not be your scene. Other than that, it's a great hotel. Fun atmosphere and fantastic location!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location - No need for a car!!”
Reviews.Author: KatJames
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights mid-week in a Hard Rock King Suite and absolutely loved the hotel. The room was spacious and it was nice after staying at many hotels on our trip that we were able to open the balcony doors and get some fresh air. The room was clean and modern and it had everything a young couple need. We were on the 7th floor and found it extremely quiet. Valet staff were fantastic!! Helpful and friendly. My only criticism was that at check in the lady was quite pushy, eager to get us to upgrade and lacked the friendliness needed for that type of role. During check out the same lady was at the desk and ignored me whilst I waited for 5 minutes for service. The location is fantastic. Close to Petco Park, restaurants and bars. It only took about 10minutes to walk to the mall and the tram stop is just outside if you would prefer. We ate at Nobu one night and it was AMAZING! The service was spot on and it was probably the best sushi that we ate on our US trip. I would also suggest getting the scallop jalapeño dish. On our other night we ate at Cafe Sevilla which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We arrived at 5:45pm and the restaurant was almost full (good sign). Great authentic Spanish food. Get the paella. As we ate early during happy hour the bill was extremely affordable. May be wise to book a table. For breakfast both mornings we ate at Zanzibar Cafe on G Street. Great menu with loads to choose from (good healthy options).

Reviews.Title: “rock star place”
Reviews.Author: Sandra911
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 night ending dec 31st in room 710, absolutely perfect, did not here nothing from the other rooms, i little bit of talking in the hallway but to me this is normal. We are not party people and we go to bed early, so if this place would loud and noisy we would notice, there was a pre-new years party for 2 nights if would not read about it we would't know. From the staff to restaurant everything is rock star perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-BUT can hear everything from other rooms”
Reviews.Author: kimtravelgirl1974
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the good, great location. I could walk to wonderful restaurant near and I liked being in the Gas Lamp Quarter. The staff was nice that I encountered. The bad now, when I spend a significant amount of money I like to be able to sleep at night. The walls are super thin and I could hear my neighbors on both sides. I was supposed to stay 4 nights but due to lack of sleep I checked out and moved in with my friend who was staying near by at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but noisy”
Reviews.Author: whouwhoami
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the gas lamp district and close to shopping, a mall and resturants. It is also a short drive to the zoo and other attractions. The staff was helpful and available to help. There is valet parking which was a bit pricy at $35.00 a night. There is however a parking garage directly across the street and cheaper. We valet parked one night and self parked the other nights. The hotel is very modern and nicely done. Loved the room amenities in both the room and in the bathroom. Make sure you have a look at the snack price list before digging into the goodies. Could be an expensive snack. Loved the double shower (rain and wall) after a long day of sight seeing. We were unfortunate to have a room facing the train station. The noise from the coming and goings of trains day and into the night was horrid. Nothing like a train whistle in the wee hours of the morning as a not so nice wakeup call. The resturant (cafe) was just ok and a bit pricy for breakfast and snack type meals. One would be better off to visit other resturants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “best time ever!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda K
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hard Rock for 5 days over Christmas 2011. The staff was incredible. From the valet to the front desk and everyone inbetween we were made to feel special. Highly recommend staying here you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Very Loud and Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: CraigSCC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and has a cool vibe. However, the walls are very thin and we could hear hear the folks in the hallways and the rooms next door partying all night. They charge $30 for a rollaway bed and $35 for parking. Much better values and quality elsewhere in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a rock star @ San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: oronr
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I ever stayed in!!! Girls @ reception - 10! Room - 10! Food - 10! Room Service - 10! Everything was great - can't even think about one little thing that went wrong. Can't wait to visit this amazing hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: soy888
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends on the same trip that we were at the Andaz (which I would take over the Hard Rock). The music schtick is just that, a gimmick (preferred my iPod to what they had playing). Versus the Andaz: the rooms are smaller, the service level less personal, and the layout of the hotel (and individual rooms) less logical. Okay, maybe the guaranteed admission to some of the onsite clubs is worth it (don't know myself) but otherwise, you can do better or just as good in the Gaslamp without paying the premium for the HR name.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: travelnman19
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Hard Rock San Diego and I was truly impressed. From the check in to the spa and all the way through. The staff was attentive and Robbie at the concierge was a "Rock Star". The Rock Spa was fantastic, Louie the spa attendant could not have been any nicer and made sure everything was perfect. Both my friend and I got massages and the masseuses they had on staff gave us the best massages we had ever had (I wish I booked the 80 min!). The staff was really top notch there and I highly recommend booking a treatment there. The room was clean and slick and the showers are great (rain and a regular shower in one). They offered lots of great TV options so I was able to watch all the games on and a few movie channels too. They also offered a very useful app for the hotel called Tour Manager and that it was. I was able to communicate with the staff on and off property as well as order room service from it. I ordered breakfast from bed Sunday morning it was perfect. With it so close to all of the night life and things to do in the San Diego area this hotel was really a lot of fun and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service.”
Reviews.Author: sdsouthie
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit for my husband and I. His company had their Christmas ball here last year (2010) and we were excited to have a weekend to ourselves. There were discounted rooms available, but we opted for a more special experience as we did last year and booked one of the Rock star suites. We incidentally had the exact same room last year so we knew what to expect. The room was $300 more per night than the company discounted rooms. We of course expect there to be some noise as we were above the club and things did quiet down around the expected closing time. Although I am trying convey some positive aspects, I feel compelled to tell the public what terrible customer service we received when we complained about a basic necessity. We stayed for two nights. The first night, our speakers and Tv remotes weren't working so we had a technician attempt to fix things, which he did, but never came back with the remote. When they did bring one back, it was the wrong one. We had lukewarm water that only became lukewarm after running for over twenty minutes, including the bathtub. But the worst part was that for the remainder of our stay we had no hot water (freezing cold only) despite having service technicians in the room while we were trying to get ready, and then being told it was fixed when it clearly was not. We were offered a new room at 11:30 pm Saturday night and were checking out the next am. When we very politely complained about the hot water, we were offered a comp at breakfast before checkout. In addition, there was a large party on the balcony room below us....loud, but expected. However, we had to call security to have them stop a fight with someone attempting to jump from the balcony. The bottom line is that we were more than willing to give you our money for a more "rock star" experience, but were given a small deduction from our total bill, that a true rock star would have never tolerated. If the company party is here next year, unfortunately I will tell everyone I know to stay at neighboring hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Packer stew in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Magnum55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock with my wife on a short getaway the first weekend in Nov which happened to coincide with the Green Bay Packers visiting the San Diego Chargers that Sunday. Note to self: check the NFL schedule next time as most of Green Bay made the trip. I stayed in a suite and the room was quite large. Lost of room to spread your stuff out, two flat screens, IPod docks just as advertised. One of our suitcases didn't make our connection to SD and the hotel was very helpful with the entire process. Toothbrushes and tooth paste was sent up and the front desk kept us posted on the status our suitcase's arrival. The walls are decorated with rock n' roll memorabilia and lyrics so if you're a fan there will be lots to look at. The pool area is quite nice but unfortunately it wasn't swimming weather so I didn't get a chance to use it. Some people have commented that the hotel is a little loud. I would have to agree that the hotel is quite boisterous so if you're looking for a quiet hotel then look elsewhere. If you're looking for a party then you've found your place! There is a bar on the main level and a nightclub on the pool level so there are a lot of people constantly circulating around the lobby area. In the evening the hotel tightens up security and guests have to show their room cards to get to the elevator banks leading to the guest rooms. Despite all of the action going on around us our room was very quiet and we slept very well. Hotel guests get free passes to the nightclub. My wife and I went one night and had a great time. There were quite a few military events going on in the hotel at the time and combined with the NFL fans the city and the hotel were quite busy. Despite the cool weather we had a great time at this hotel and would definitely recommend it. Overall the rooms and premises were very clean, the staff was helpful and... INTERNET WAS FREE!!! .If you don't want to valet park there are are plenty of parking lots within a few blocks of the hotel. Two thumbs up to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Partyhotel”
Reviews.Author: Olja65
Reviews.Content: Wir hatten das Hard Rock Hotel aufgrund seiner Lage und Ausstattung gebucht. Der Empfang war sehr schön, Valet Service unbedingt in Anspruch nehmen. Hier einen Parkplatz selber suchen macht keinen Sinn. Insbesondere wenn man an einem Samstag eincheckt wie wir. Die Zimmer sind schön eingerichtet, wir hatten eines auf dem Pooldeck. Leider haben wir nicht beachtet, dass wir ja in einem Hard Rock Hotel sind. Es war Samstag und ich glaube dass das Hotel der Ort ist an dem man an einem Samstag Abend sein sollte wenn man Party machen will. Wir wollten allerdings chillen, das ging leider gar nicht. Die Zimmer auf dem Pooldeck liegen so nah am geschehen, dass man hier Musik bis spät in die Nacht im Zimmer laut hört. Aus dem Partyalter sind wir schon etwas raus, in so fern war es nicht ganz so toll. Aber für alle die ein tolles Hotel für die Party suchen - this is the place to be

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bec B
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect night at Hard Rock in San Diego. Such a funky hotel, but with 5 star trimmings and service. And the location couldn't be more central. I would not consider any other hotel if i'm in San Diego again in future. In fact, i will make sure i'm in San Diego in future just to stay here, preferably when an event is on!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock for 4 nights while we were attending at Conference. The conference centre is located directly across the road from the hotel and couldnt be more convenient. When we were not attending the conference we shopped and dined in the Gaslamp Quarter. So many places to shop and eat the choices were endless and everything within walking distance. We order room service everyday sometimes multiple times a day.. starting with breakfast each morning it was quick and convenient while your getting ready for your day. With 15,000 people exiting the conference centre all at one time for a lunch break you can imagine how quickly the restaurants fill up and how long the wait times are, we simply went up to our room ordered room service had our meal within 20 minutes and enjoyed it on our balcony. Every staff member rocked and and made our stay amazing! We had a couple of very minor problems which were attended to quickly and efficiently. We would stay again when we are back in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Great fun place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: H N
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night as a quick get-away in San Diego. The room we stayed in was a two room suite with 2 queen beds + a balcony. Plenty of space to hang out in the living room, and when it's time to tucker out for the night there's even a stylish curtain you can draw between the two rooms. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: 244play
Reviews.Content: Quality staff & facilities, exceptional operation.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock San Diego...Best hotel I've stayed at in a long time!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for work, this was my first time in San Diego. I chose the Hard Rock Hotel because the website looked great and I'm glad I did. The service was the best I've ever had; very helpful and courteous and very knowledgeable of area attractions and dining. Room was very clean and comfortable. Price was comparable to other hotels around the area. I will definitely recommend this hotel to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Urban Vacation at the Hard Rock Suite”
Reviews.Author: Water_Lily-Girl
Reviews.Content: I was one of the people who supposedly won up for the Black Friday promo and booked from Dec 2-4. There was a glitch in the system and apparently Im not one of those who receieved the 1st ten. However the manager Luke was kind enough to give me a great deal and upgrade my room to a Hard Rock Suite. And another manager/director Michelle went above and beyond in helping me with all of my needs. I had to say I was very upset at first because I already planned a huge reservation and was dissapointed with the sudden change of rate but they did everything in their power to compensate. I was planning a small get together for me and my friends and the small private lounge area at the room was perfect. They even tried to find me another room with a balcony however they were fully booked for the weekend During check in Courtney was very helpful in my booking, she tried to book me with a room w/ a balcony but later moved me at my request to another floor since the balcony had no view ( all wall) and gave me one with a spectacular view. Jeff and Ronnie helped with my VIP list for 207 and Float for the 2 nights which impressed my friends. I really felt like a rockstar complete with my entourage. The Rock Spa was amazing!!! Dolusa got all the kinks that has been bothering me for weeks and will highly recommend her. I love my room even the mini bar and the private bar that I have though I could not use them due to it being overpriced for me The Cons: As expected being a Hard Rock hotel in the middle of Gaslamp the #1 issue I had was the noise from other hard partying groups and the drunken patrons at the lobby area. being a girl who sometimes need to come down at Mary Janes or Nobu to grab a bite. Its difficult not to get bothered by a few drunk males or so, even at the elevator. My room was booked right next to a suite that had security called throughout their stay due to noise issues There was a snaffu with my inhouse credit as 2 other front desk agents needed to make sure/verify I had one as they nearly charged me an extra $50 at my final bill. After some show of proof from my confirmation emails that was all settled but did caused me to worry a bit There were some channels that were all "paid programming" and the Travel channel was just looping forever with Direct TV instructions. Not all windows are tinted so people from the other street can actually see you. And you seing them as one guy from an ajacent condo lasered us. The showers were amazing at the room but I think a shower curtain would be great as the angle of the shower head hits the dry area and tend to flood it with water Club 207 was great but i think they need to expand that club more as it was overly crowded in such small area space The Pros: Right snak in the heart of Gaslamp, we werent far from other eateries like pizza and ice cream which I can easily walk to, and the trolley could take us striaght to Old Town and Little Italy The curtain dividers was genius as it gave thisw sense of privace from the lounge area (Hard Rock Suite) I had one of the guitars sent out to my room and that was a riot to my friends to have one of the Fenders to be brought up for no cost at all. Massage at the Spa was AWSOME and wished the open the steam room earlier than 9:00am as I would love to use it after a 7 am workout The minibar and view were definate bragging rights to my friends and you have no idea all the compliments I got.
