And envy looks. The staff especially the security was awesome. Even some of the bouncers were nice I was treated like a rockstar by the people there. Though it would be nice a complimentary breakfast would be included in some of the packages Overall I would Give the Hard Rock a 3.5-4 out of 5 stars. I am definately returning next year for an event and will try the Hard Rock Suites this time. Thank you for the experience

Reviews.Title: “This Hard Rock did not rock!”
Reviews.Author: JaeCon
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in had a nice view and bathroom. The hotel itself had the typical eccentric modern style most Hard Rock establishments exude but it is still not a hotel I would stay in again. If you want to stay at a hotel where you walk down the hall and there's young kids partying and it smells like vomit, then this is definitely the place for you. The staff at the pool needs training on customer service and the pool scene itself is small and cramped. We were all excited to stay here, with the Las Vegas Hard Rock in mind, but we were quite disapppointed with our entire experience. Though I will mention that the hotel is in a good location and close to the ball park.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Kandice B
Reviews.Content: Got a suite here in november, loved it great spot excellent customer service form a nice girl named Erin D who i believe worked in catering she showed us around when we were lost and gave us directions! Thank you erin!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's the best hotel I've stayed at!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ashrafa90
Reviews.Content: They have the best service Very very nice employes and the best clubs in SD club 207 and club float with the best VIPs and the best hosts

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mel0424
Reviews.Content: the staff at the Hard Rock San Diego is freaking AWESOME!! so helpful, polite, and accomodating!!! plus it's a GREAT location in the Gas Lamp! so close to shopping, bars, food; or just stay in the hotel and eat & party! they have a couple clubs that were lots of fun and the food is really good too! oh and you can get room service at any time, even in the middle of the night!!! which is pretty awesome when you come back to your room from the club and realize you are starving! and it only took like 15 min to get the food!!! loved this hotel!!! if you stay anywhere in downtown SD...YOU ARE CRAZY NOT TO STAY AT THE HARD ROCK! ITS THE BEE'S KNEES! :) P.S. if you're miltary (like me) they have fantastic government rates!!! paid $203 for a suite on the top floor w/ a living room & balcony that overlooked downtown SD! anywhere else that room would have cost at least $400-$750 especially on a weekend!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne1789
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel from the moment we arrived. Staff was welcoming and pleasant. The room was fabulous -- with a great view as well. The location is excellent....walking distance to many great restaurants as well as Seaport Village. we enjoyed the entire weekend experience.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch, customer service doesnt return emails since their phone reps give out false information”
Reviews.Author: Umailop
Reviews.Content: This place looks nice, but keep in mind a $17+ Resort fee for things other properties in san diego would give you for free. Really Hard rock, i dont need the latest issue of rolling stone. Hotel bait and switched me and countless others and then had the nerve to not try and mend the problem. Contacted the tripadvisor review guy (Mdufor) after hotel asked me to do so, but he didnt help me at all, then I replied to him with the information necessary for him to help as the hard rock stated he would but that email wound up being bounced back to my inbox the next day? Maybe he blocked my address rather than try to help me. Always had wanted to stay here thus my reservation. I will stick to the great 4 star properties located nearby that DO NOT have resort fees and have great customer service! As for the room, quite small and there were HAIRS in the shower! Come on hard rock, i dont need some other guests hairs. Obviously I expect a response from tripadvisor guy now, but what good is it unless i was to return. There was potential to return given a ridiculous rate/offer, but hard rock messed that up too, that is a whole other story, that i will refrain from mentioning here on tripadvisor, you can look up their twitter account regarding their "black friday promotion" and see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Night!”
Reviews.Author: Quentin R
Reviews.Content: Went to a Dinner at this hotel...what a blast - food -service and atmosphere was total high energy. left the hotel and went bar hopping after the party and then came back and went to Float the bar on the roof top - what a great location and great experience...Fun Fun Fun!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Rest Your Head”
Reviews.Author: Volcanogrrl82
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here on a trip down for my birthday. I was going to see a show and she was visiting friends. The hotel is well located downtown for easy access to awesomeness such as the USS Midway. You can walk there in 15 minutes! The stadium was right out our window! This place is party central! If you're looking for an awesome room and a place to party this is the place for you! I can't attest to the party aspect as I was there for one purpose only, but I could tell from the pool people were having a blast! Service was great! The girl who checked us in was fast and efficient and super friendly. Turned out we were going to the same show, and she tried to hook me up with a ride. It didn't pan out but it was nice to have someone local try and help me out! The room was gorgeous and uber comfortable! My mom never sleeps while on vacation and she snored every night we were there! I had no trouble falling asleep and the room was pretty quiet. There was some noise from the hallway occasionally, but not being on the main hallway helped big time. The toiletries in the room were very nice, the towels and robes were awesome, and the room itself was gorgeous! The price was great too! All in all, I enjoyed myself very much, the room was very nice and I would definitely go back to this hotel next time I am in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Just a blast...”
Reviews.Author: footballtrvlr
Reviews.Content: Location- Fantastic Room - Fantastic Staff - Fantastic Just a blast... Oh, and food - Fantastic (and $$)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: susan c
Reviews.Content: I rely heavily on trip advisor reviews and was prepared for the potential for noise issues, unruly guests and the much maligned "resort fee" of ten dollars per day. I was advised upon check in that all calls place from the landline in my room to anywhere in the U.S. were included in the resort fee. I utilized this aspect of the service as my phone was in roaming mode my entire stay, so was nice to call home and check in over the course of my stay. Noise was not an issue although I was on the ninth floor well away from night club and fourth floor pool lounge. All staff encounters over the phone and in person were nothing less than outstanding, housekeeping services kept to high standards and Nobu dining experience wonderful. Also utilized business center complimentary use to print boarding pass. Only caveat was free wifi would have been appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay - Hard Rock delivers”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTraveller111
Reviews.Content: Visited San Diego in October this year and stayed at the Hard Rock. I had read the reviews here so knew the Hotel was a party place and so would be a bit noisy on the weekend but really it was not a problem. Amazing rooms - very cool atmosphere, location can't be beat and to top it all off the staff are awesome. Liked the business centre and various restaurants. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, staff, and room!”
Reviews.Author: Nick G
Reviews.Content: I was at the Hard Rock Hotel for four days at a business conference. My wife and I had spent our honeymoon in San Diego, so I saw a great opportunity for us to make double use of the time. She was to join me on the second night of my stay. Wanting to surprise her, I asked the hotel staff for some assistance in making it special - they knocked it out of the park! Personalized touches and a phenomenal view of downtown made for a memorable time at a great hotel! Did I mention the view?! Room 1059.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, rocking hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jmodaff52
Reviews.Content: What a great location in San Diego, this Hard Rock personifies the name by being hip, trendy, fun, and overall a great time. If you want a quiet get away this place is not for you but if you like action and nightlife this place is #1.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic hospitality worth returning to enjoy again!”
Reviews.Author: S M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel SD on a recent business trip. Was quite impressed with the service, accomodations, food and the cool vibe. Beautiful, spotless, very large, room with comfortable bed, a slick bar set-up and space to entertain or simply chill. Bathroom had fine finishes, dual sink vanity, excellent lighting and enough space for a couple to comfortably get ready for an evening out. Staff was gracious, warm and genuinely interested in taking good care. Could tell in every interation that they really wanted and knew how to be involved. Restaurants were great. Nobu's was spot-on in terms of outstanding quality of food and attention to detail in service. Sushi and sashmi was super fresh, nicely portioned and expertly presented. The Black Cod with Miso was cooked to perfection and absolutely melted in the mouth. My favorite was the Brick Oven prepared 30 oz. Bone-in Prime Ribeye. The slow roasting in the brick oven seemed to concentrate the flavor and accentuate the tenderness of the beef. The steak didn't need, but certainly worked incredibly well with the accompanying sauces. A quick breakfast in Mary Jane's included an attentive server with keen awareness of my need for coffee as well as a no fuss approach to my request for a breakfast not on the menu. Scrambled eggs were fresh, fluffy and piping hot. Couldn't have asked for a better launch to my day. Hard Rock Hotel San Diego was great for my quick business trip. I'd go back for again for business or a fun get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, just don't stay on a weekend!”
Reviews.Author: rubyrat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 4 nights from Friday - Tuesday here in June 2011. I was excited about staying in a cool hotel and I was excited to see the pool and have drinks and hang out on the roof top pool side! We arrived on Friday at around 3pm, and the whole hotel was basically a nightclub! It looked really swanky, the room was modern and cool, but the blaring music from the all day pool party ($$ to get in to the pool) and drunk wild young things stomping around the hotel took away from the experience for me...would have been awesome though if you were into dance music and wanted to PARTY! Seriously, everyone was having a brilliant time! We were kept up till 5am with a party next door and people shouting from their balconies. We certainly felt like old foggies! Saturday night was a bit better, but still the same type of clientele, young drunk hipsters. We tried to go to the pool but it was more of a pool that you don't swim in and wear expensive jewelry to sit around looking good, so we didn't venture out in our Speedo's. Sunday-Tuesday was like a different hotel!! The staff were courteous from day one, and I got to rent a Gibson guitar for free and we enjoyed eating at the diner in the hotel. We got great sleeps as the place was deserted of party goers, and it became just a better place to hang out! I did really like the hotel, it looked cool and the staff were really nice! I would probably prefer somewhere with a better pool scene and less chaotic weekends, but overall, IT WAS AN EXPERIENCE!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: RacheAnne
Reviews.Content: Big bucks but it does make you feel like a rock star.

Reviews.Title: “A VERY PLEASANT STAY.”
Reviews.Author: Lita D
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a first class hotel, this one will meet your expectations. It is fun, clean, and attendants are friendly, always assisting with a smile! It maybe a little pricey, but it is worth it. I vote this as #1 in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: madrich36
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights and its a very nice hotel. as others mentioned its a hip and fun style hotel. rooms were very modern (not a lot of these in San Diego) and clean. check in/out was quick. The only 2 big negatives that i have ,( hence the 3 star review ) A. the noise from the train, our room was located furthest from the train tracks and the loud horn from the train was very loud and annoying , i can only imagine how bad it is for the rooms closer to it B. we needed the concierge to help plan our day and when we went to the desk at around 6.30pm he/she already left for the day (all other hotels i stayed at had the concierge untill late at night). we were told at the front desk that he will be in the next morning at 9.30. we come down at 10.30 in the morning and still no sign of him, now we were told that he wont be in until 11.30. what hotel has no concierge?? anyway we just went across the street to the Omni and the concierge (Robert) was more than helpful will i stay here again? maybe if i bring along air plugs and have no need for a concierge "-)

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, excellent location, good service”
Reviews.Author: mattcubed
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice in the last 3 months with my girlfriend. If you are looking for a fun/hip hotel in San Diego, this is an excellent option. Sort of like what the W is like in other cities. I'd definitely stay again. PROS: - location is right in gaslamp. can't really do better if you want to be i gaslamp. - pool / lounge area is well designed and fun to hang out in, day or night - good scene on the weekend if you want to hang out in the hotel bars - rooms are nice, if not exceptional - servie is generally very nice; good attitude CONS: - the hotel isn't super lux / fancy, so keep your expectations reasonable - room service is so/so, they never refilled shower gel or mini-bar. The room sometime smelled of harsh cleaners NOTES: - You can't avoid that it's a bit of a party hotel, so be OK with noise and the occasional partier in the elevator

Reviews.Title: “Rockstar experience!”
Reviews.Author: Boltsssss
Reviews.Content: Both Eli and Derrick were great ambassadors for the HR Hotel! It was an awesome b-day experience.

Reviews.Title: “Never coming back!”
Reviews.Author: MadeInCali
Reviews.Content: Stood here because our Marine Corps Ball was here. I will say that the staff was friendly and the hotel itself is pretty cool with all the memorabilia. However, we stayed on the 9th floor and the music blaring from the club downstairs was loud. Our rooms, had no coffee maker or cups for water. If you wanted water, there were these insanely expensive Voxx waters. To make matters worse, the bed was as hard as a rock (very fitting). The pillows were also pitiful. Not to mention the trolley noises, cargo train (stopping then going in reverse)and the people on the street sounding like they were literally outside our window. During our travels we've stayed at some off the beaten path no-name motels that were more comfortable than the Hard Rock (an payed substantially less). For the price we paid, it was not worth it at all. We will never return to this place for an overnight stay. If we ever need or want to go to the Gaslamp District, we'll stay at the Hilton or Hyatt. At least we'll know for sure that we'll have a restful stay that's worth the money we pay. Hey Hard Rock, would it hurt to invest in dual pane windows, decent mattresses and pillows? You spent so much on awesome decor; how about spending it on some comfort items too?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, incredible experience.”
Reviews.Author: SurviveBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Hard Rock in October during a short business trip and it was amazing. From arrival to departure and everywhere in between, they remembered my name, made me feel like a VIP. Adam in Mary Jane's was exceptional. Jeremy, one of the managers, went above and beyond to get my suit pressed in time for a meeting. Nobu was rediculously incredible, the jalapeño sashimi is to die for - the crowd and the vibe in 207 was perfect, not what I'd expect in San Diego. My room was spotless and comfortable. I even had someone help get me a cab at 5am, which the valet made seem easy (I knew it wasn't). I can't wait to come back, this is the ONLY hotel in SD I would ever stay at or recommend. These dudes get it right, very impressed - like a Four Seasons but way more approachable and relentlessly cool.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly employees!!”
Reviews.Author: Petesdawter
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the friendliness of the entire staff. Anytime I approached an employee I was always given a smile and a warm greeting! The valets were amazing and very helpful. I was on a business trip and they made me feel as though I was really just on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome in Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn A
Reviews.Content: Basically the Hotel was Awesome in Every Way! Even though it was raining the whole weekend, the hotel was still happening. The clubs were great. The service was great!!!! I am definitely going back soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great property, great location and the best service”
Reviews.Author: Tommy_D2012
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a weekend getaway and chose to go down to San Diego from Orange County. With all the hotels in the gaslamp, we decided to stay at the Hard Rock because of all the great reviews. They truly lived up to their reputation. At check in, Eli in the VIP reception, took great care of us, offered us a beverage (adult beverage) and even customized our music in our room to our favorite tunes! Our room was amazing, overlooking the gaslamp and dinner in Nobu was fantastic! We will definitely come back again the next we come to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Place to Party”
Reviews.Author: Reddon14
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, right at the entrance to the Gaslamp District which has a tonne of shopping, eating, and partying spots. It's also right across the street from a trolley car stop which will get you around town easy without renting a car. The hotel itself was very nice. Rooms were clean and trendy, bed was supper comfy and the bathroom shower with two rain shower heads was great..... The two clubs within the hotel were also good. Super busy on Friday and Saturday nights if thats what you are in to. The club on the main level causes the hotel lobby to get extremely loud. This didn't seem to affect us at all as we were on the 6th floor. The club guests also have to cut across the lobby to get to the washrooms, so later at night theres lots of drunk people stumbling thru the lobby. Not the place to take the family, but a great stay for a guys, girls or young couples weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location except the train horns will wake you up”
Reviews.Author: bryan g
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the famous gas lamp district. Very cool resturaunts and bars surround the hotel. I don;t suggest staying in the hotel to enjoy a drink. The float bar had a private party going and even when we came back after the party was supposed to be over it was still going and we were treated like party crashers instead of hotel guests. Expect to be awakened by the trains that pass in front of the hotel. Very loud horns at the railroad crossing.

Reviews.Title: “"The Best Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Mike E
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stay at this place every year! It has such nice rooms with a great vibe! The staff members are so friendly and can answer any question you have. Service is fast there and the food is just great. Beds are comfy and TV is great! Hotel is In a great location for walking around to shop. Clubs there are awesome and as a guest you can give your friends passes to the clubs and front line entrance so you can party the night away!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for this past weekend to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. We were treated to a terrific stay. We stayed in a Rock Star Silver Suite and it is worth the extra money for a larger room with balcony. We received complimentary champagne during our stay (two bottles!) and were treated like rock stars. Food ay Mary Jane's is great and the staff knows how to cater to guests. I heard about noise issues in the hotel but found there to be no problems. The hotel was very secure and we felt safe the entire stay. Gaslamp location is great -many bars with happy hour/late night happy hour deals - try the fish tacos at Las Hadas! We will definitely stay here again. Great hotel - great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Such a cool hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dede8475
Reviews.Content: This was a great, cool hotel with fantastic night life and restaurants nearby! Definitely coming back...

Reviews.Title: “The only place i will stay in SD”
Reviews.Author: Kelley J
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler that spends more than half of my nights in hotel rooms, i will not stay anywhere but the Hard Rock Hotel when in San Diego. The rooms are spacious and well equipped for me to work in not to mention very comfortable. But it is really the staff that make the experience over the top. They are all so friendly from valet to check in and even the coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia M
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice however not having a bath and only a shower was a bit of a disappointment. The pool and spa is very small for the size of property.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality rooms, excellent location and facilities”
Reviews.Author: oscar888_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good hotel with good quality rooms, excellent location and facilities, the reception area I found a bit non appealing but everything else appears to be very much under control to give us guest good quality service. Good size flat TV screen with good choice of movies.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...Great Location to Gaslamp!”
Reviews.Author: Wilma58
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right by Petco Park, Gaslamp, and everything in San Diego you might want to do in the downtown location. Walk outside the door and you are in Gaslamp. The hotel itself, as one other reviewer mentioned, is like a casino without any machines or gambling. The lobby is bright, flashing lights, strange front desk comprised of 4 individual stations. In spite of the annoying lobby, the check in and out process is very efficient. They take your cell number if your room is not ready, entering on the computer screen, twist the screen around so you can verify your cell number. Checking out, they simply spin the screen (if you've prepaid) and verify your e-mail to send you a receipt. Now, for the rooms....very modern, stark. The rooms have everything you need, except instructions on how to operate the shower, where the plug in is by the sink....(p.s. you pull out the drawer by the sink and it is to the right behind the door face). Very strange. Apparently they are all individually privately owned. This hotel is nice for a convention attendee, you can walk around safely. There are a million places to eat and little shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Plesently suprised.”
Reviews.Author: Jaflorida
Reviews.Content: I Travel a lot. Almost every week. I am in my sixties and thought that I will not enjoy staying at the Hard Rock. I had a wonderful time wonderful rooms, great service. From now on that my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock -- Always a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary L
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Hard Rock and both times we had great experience. The staff is attentive and knowledgable and the hotel is in walking distance of lots of great San Diego attractions. The rooms are comfortable, we have stayed in the regular King room and the King Suite. The shower is AMAZING and beds are super comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Mind Blowing - fun, views, and food”
Reviews.Author: darrello
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock from 08-12JUL2011 for a conference at the convention centre. I was having a major birthday during that time and the concierge was kind enough to upgrade my room to a suite (not a rock & roll suite, but very nice!) upon checkin. The room is generally great, though some things look stunning but don't work quite well - just try not to get water pouring out onto the bathroom floor when showering. The in-room amenities are good, the music is excellent. The hotel itself is definitely getting the hip crowds that they want. Watching the paddy wagons arrive after the Sunday afternoon Intervention party is humourous. I suppose someone needs to fund the hotel's bars. The lobby and restaurants are excellent, with a particular "world best" for Nobu. The happy hour at Nobu is very pleasant. Great prices and exquisite food. Definitely an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock rocked our conference!!”
Reviews.Author: LeadershipRetreat
Reviews.Content: Our leadership retreat was planned for this location and boy did it ever rock the event. Every staff member I encountered was filled with service and a positive attitude from the minute we stepped out of our car, to checking in and even riding up the elevator with some facilities people. The lunch they served was delicious. Our staff felt they were treated like a "rock star" and so our retreat was the best we have ever had. Amazing job everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock does Rock”
Reviews.Author: edebaby
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock October 16-19. The room (mine was on the 8th floor) was awesome. Lots of space. Top notch shower; probably the nicest I've experienced. Great flat panel TV. Great view of the pool area. Wonderful view of the San Diego skyline. We attended a conference a the hotel too. The conference areas were very nice. Catering was excellent. Staff was friendly. Atmosphere excellent. They'll even let you have a Gibson guitar to play with during your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staycation”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey B
Reviews.Content: I loved the Hard Rock. I live in San Diego and wanted to get away for my birthday. I decided to visit downtown for the weekend and stay at the Hard Rock. It was amazing!!!! The decor was chiq and rock and roll all at the same time. My room overlooked downtown as well as the pool. It was fun to people watch from my window. The service was amazing and the bellman even offered to bring extra pillows and blankets. When getting ready, my friend realized she forgot shaving cream, we called front desk and they brought some right up! Service was impeccable. We also got VIP passes to the nightclubs at the hotel. This was great and they even gave us a couple extra in case we had friends come visit us. Overall a great hotel, great service, and a fun place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Rock on!”
Reviews.Author: Heather S
Reviews.Content: I recently drove down to San Diego from Los Angeles for a business conference which was being held at the Hard Rock. Leave it to the company holding the conference to always pick the coolest places, this was definitely up there! You walk in and immediately go "WOW!". There's music memorabilia everywhere from random quotes to fashion and instruments. I felt like such a groupie, as you feel like you just stepped into Rock and Roll Paradise. The staff was attentive, friendly and when needed, helpful. The rooms are your typical swanky hotel room with an added extra that when you get there your tv is on a "unique" music channel created just for you (at random). Talk about cool. My music ranged from Hard Rock to Country, Jazz, R&B peppered with some mainstream Pop. They had a plethora of conference rooms that were all different sizes to accommodate however large/small of a group. Food was good, everyone was satisfied. They have a cool bar right off the entrance of the hotel. We were there when a band was playing, got our names on the list and got in. It's got a great throw-back vibe with leather U-shaped booths, monitors playing funky designs that dance to the beat of music or your typical sports game. I'm not a bar fly, so to me this was very cool. All in all, it's affordable and in a spectacular part of town. It's great walking distance to many venues and restaurants and a close drive to the Zoo, Sea World, etc. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Heather C
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hard Rock in SD. The rooms are great: spacious, clean, funky, and the beds (especially the pillows) are so comfortable! The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. I will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to go stay at !”
Reviews.Author: Cshea18
Reviews.Content: It's an exciting place to go . The mangers will take care of you. With my exspericne I had !

Reviews.Title: “Wine Tasting at the Hard Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roger T
Reviews.Content: Could it have been any better and not be a dream? I am on the road way too much and have been for many many years. This was a pleasant surprise. The staff was very attentive and made it a memorable experience. I look forward to a repeat visit soon. Can’t get too much of a good thing!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I'd expected.”
Reviews.Author: AmberLDM
Reviews.Content: The rooms are comfortable but the lighting in the bathroom is kind of dim. The water will suddenly just get cold in the middle of a shower. Room service is rather spendy ($34 for a salad). Ice machine is only on 5th floor. Elevators need room key to go to the different floors which I didn't realize and ended up riding it until someone got on and told me how. Overall it was an alright stay but I've stayed at much friendlier and easier to navigate hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Reinman001
Reviews.Content: Eli in VIP check in is a tremendous asset to the HARD ROCK. My Favorite place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Style, Hip, Great Location, the works...”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: From the time we hit the curb climbing out of the taxi, we were greeted by amazing service. It didn't seem to matter where I turned, there was a Hard Rock staff member to ask me if I need anything. I don't know how you qualify for their Rock Royalty treatment, but you need to find out. On my last visit I experienced the front desk, and they were amazing. But there is something about going into a private room and getting that little extra treatment. We had a private event on the roof, there Elevation patio. And the staff there was on the ball. I heard one guest ask for RedBull. Well, we didn't arranged ahead of time to have RedBull at the event. But within 5 minutes she was back with a cold RedBull in hand. The Float bar in the evening was great. This is Southern California, but normally we do everything indoors. At Float, you are enjoying the SoCal air while drinking, dancing, and having a great time. If you have been to the Hard Rock but didn't Float, make sure you do on your next visit. There are tons of hotels to stay at while visiting San Diego. I had such a great time on my past visit, I have already booked my room at the Hard Rock for my next trip to San Diego this December.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: joe g
Reviews.Content: The staff at the HR go above and beyond. My room was so quiet and spacious. Request room on backside as it is off the front street noise. Pool and jacuzzi kick. Great location with secure garage parking immediately across the street. The property was so clean and appeared new. Within walking distance to convention center and all the great restaurants. The director of rooms was so responsive after I filled out post stay survey that I just had to spread the word about how GREAT this place is. My new go to place in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: biztraveler31
Reviews.Content: Close to the convention center and entertainment district. Lobby and bars get very noisy and crowded in the evening but I didn't hear it on the 3rd floor. Room was well appointed and the bed was comfy. Took awhile to figure out the shower!

Reviews.Title: “Headache hotel more like”
Reviews.Author: john r
Reviews.Content: A very noisy hotel due to so called music blaring from the ground floor bar, trains tooting their horns at all hours,traffic in the street and revellers shouting in the street below. Certain members of the reception staff came across as being very rude. The room was clean and comfortable with an excellent double head shower, but we just didn't like this hotel at all. Very unfortunate as I really looked forward to this hotel as part of our tour of the US. Out of 8 hotels and a cruise on our tour, Hardrock is rated as coming in 10th. To add insult to injury I got my visa bill when I returned home to find a charge of over $76 when I inquired about this Hardrock said when I prepaid I didn't pay this one. Apparently it was for access to the business centre,the fitness suite,daily news paper,internet access and phone calls (we didn't use any of these) so be aware of this unexpected bill

Reviews.Title: “Had a GREAT stay @ Hard Rock!!”
Reviews.Author: SeeMinnieTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel of San Diego the weekend of OCtober 15th. My very good friend had arranged a block of rooms here for her wedding day at the Skybox Tower (also incredible, BTW). The room was exceptionally well appointed with linens that made me want to stay an extra day just to hang out in bed. The room service was timely and my breakfast was delicious - clearly very fresh! The staff were friendly, polite and accommodating with great tips on how to take advantage of their great location downtown. Also, convenient to the airport for my trip back to Baltimore the next day with reasonably priced shuttle provided within 30 seconds of inquiring about it outside the hotel entrance. Would HIGHLY recommend to anyone local to SD, or making the trip there!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, great showers and very clean”
Reviews.Author: jennyanvari
Reviews.Content: Nice location, close to great restaurants and bars. The double showers heads make the shower experience very special. We strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Pool!”
Reviews.Author: CarteBlancWine
Reviews.Content: If you haven't stayed at the Hard rock San Diego and you like to have a good time then your missing out. The hotel is located in the Gas Lamp district and is a short walk or pedi-cab to 100's of restaurants and bars. The hotel itself has a great rooftop poolside bar/lounge as well a nightclub downstairs within the hotel. There is also a great sushi restaurant and breakfast restaurant located within the building. The location is right next to the surfliner(Amtrack) and metro station as well as a short walk to the convention center. There is always something going on in this hotel and you will never be dissapointed. The rooms are ultra modern and are very well kept. I have never had a dirty room in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Father/Daughter Overnight”
Reviews.Author: MarkfromMaine1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a layover for an international flight. It was one of the most enjoyable hotel stays I have had. The crew there really goes the extra step to make you feel welcome. Cool rooms, complimentary Fender guitar on request for your room, with headphones and well set up mini amp. It looked like some neat places to eat in there also but it was fun to explore Historic Gaslight alley resturants out the back door.

Reviews.Title: “Rocking Awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: Charm_City_Mum
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a convention and I must say I preferred to spend time in the hotel over the conference! Breakfast at Maryjane's each morning was a great way to begin the day. Listen to Rich's recommendations--the TIJUANA Bennys and Johnny Hash and pancakes were super yum! The bell guys that brought up the luggage were friendly and Alex helped me make sense of all the electronics in the room. My only nit was that there is no coffee/tea in the hotel room. At 545am, I wasn't keen to schlep down to the lobby to get coffee--especially when the Blue Angel's Navel Air team was meeting in the lobby at the same time. For a businesswoman travelling alone this was an awesome experience and each person I interacted with was helpful and nice. I didn't use the bar or have time to enjoy the spa but if work or pleasure takes me back to San Diego, this hotel is on the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Wicked fun!”
Reviews.Author: kfindlay1979
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock hotel is lives up to its name. It's an impressive building with an awe inspiring lobby. The hotel rooms are some of the best I've stayed in. The restaurants are excellent and the bars are fun and exciting. Float was is a great bar as it is on their outdoor patio next to the pool. I recommend that if you want a good sleep ask for a room that does not face the pool and bar area, it is a lot quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel San Diego - October 2011”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference the first week of October. Upon checkin they had overbooked their studios so I was upgraded to a suite. The room was amazing!!! The staff that assisted were all very nice and talkative. I ate at Maryjane's for breakfast almost every day and the eggs benedict, traditional style, were to die for! If you don't get the eggs benedict you must try the hash browns though! I would definitely go back, but next time take my wife!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasOki
Reviews.Content: Had the chance of staying at this property for a couple of nights in October 2011... and let me tell you... This is truly a great hotel. Clean, in fact very clean, modern rooms and delicious beds. Sure, it is a party hotel... But even if you are on business... Its really worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It's the tops!”
Reviews.Author: BVostmyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference at the San Diego Convention Center and loved, loved, loved it! I only gave it 4 stars because the gal who finally checked me in to my room gave me attitude and there was no coffee maker in the room. The rest of the hotel and staff were wonderful. The room was very large for this area of town and luxurious. The room had a large sitting area with a television, A large bedroom area with a curtain that could be pulled to separate it from the living room area. The small fridge came in handy for leftovers from dinners out. The coffee counter in Mary's restaurant had a better latte than the Starbucks in the convention center and much less of a line. And Mary's was a great place to grab a light lunch or dinner. The server there were always pleasant and happy to please.

Reviews.Title: “Nebraska girl”
Reviews.Author: jobrummond
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Felt welcome from check in to check out by all staff. Concierge directed us to all the great sites that the city and surrounding areas had to offer. Our rooms were clean, comfortable, and well kept. I don't know what it would have been like in the rooms closest to the clubs, but we were out of ear distance to anything so a peaceful relaxing trip.

Reviews.Title: “October 6-10, 2011”
Reviews.Author: MissouriJean
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for a conference. The hotel was lovely, the rooms were clean, and well appointed. The hotel had several resturants to choose from for meals. The food was very good but a bit pricey. The location of the hotel was in the middle of many resturants,bars, night clubs and lovely shops and art galleries all within walking distance. The area was clean and I felt safe out and about day or night with friends. It is right on the bay, you can take a tour of a retired aircraft carrier, or just stroll around the bay. The weather couldn't have been better sunny everyday high in the middle to upper 70's and the nights were 50's or 60's. Very short drive to the airport less than $20 cab or shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Even Rock Stars Get Tired and Old”
Reviews.Author: ddbennett
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times before and had a great time. I stayed here in a Woodstock Suite with my wife for a fun getaway weekend in San Diego. I was very disappointed from the beginning. First they had only two staff checking in and checking out guests. Unfortunately there were several people doing both which resulted in a less than pleasant wait. Secondly, I did not see a single bellman available to help us with our luggage. As for the hotel it is in need of some serious care. Going up to our room I noted a room sign which was taped on the wall by the room with Blue Tape. Our room showed additional signs of old age ranging from a rug with snags and serious wear to poorly mended tear in our curtains. The room also showed scuff marks on the walls throughout and just a sense of age. As for the pool area and outside bar it showed similar signs including gapping holes in the deck furniture, weather worn decks, and tables as well as worn finishes on the concrete. All of this was disappointing and well below the standards that the Hard Rock has set and maintains at it's other properties. Also the I found it a big turnoff to return to my room on several occasions to see the same room service trays in the hall that where there some 12 plus hours ago. I can live with the noise and parties that are typical for the SD Hard Rock but at least make me feel like I am staying at a true 4 Diamond AAA hotel and not some worn out resort south of the border. I am torn about returning since there are so many other great hotels in SD to stay at that are just as cool. I hope you guys get your act together and can get the old rockstar to check into rehab before next year.

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are wedding photographers and travel quite a bit. But our favorite place to stay is the Hard Rock. The location is perfect. The rooms are amazing and the staff go above and beyond to exceed your expectations everyday! Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “We visited the Bar”
Reviews.Author: An_eatter
Reviews.Content: We did not stay the night but did go into the bar for drinks. It was awesome. It's high enough up that there's a breeze. It's outside so you can enjoy the San Diego weather, however there's beautiful fire pits to keep you warm if you should get chilly. It was beautiful! We were in town for our anniversary and this was nice way to top off our evening with yummy drinks, a nice crowd and a great enviroment. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrific!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy S
Reviews.Content: Everything was great! Rooms, service, location were all fun! Definitely a perfect hotel for a young couple with the location in the Gaslamp district and the on-site restaurants and clubs. Also, perfect for attending conferences at the Convention Center - close by and no issues with getting enough sleep during the week.

Reviews.Title: “A week at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: kissntellall
Reviews.Content: A excellent stay serviced by an outstanding staff. The location was centrally in the middle of most site seeing locations and transportation. The room was outstanding so much that I took a picture and posted on my facebook. Look forward to an excellent time if planning a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock, Rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: Rick Z
Reviews.Content: Everything was awesome !!! Great Service,Great location,Great fun. 100% top rate, first class

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: steven g
Reviews.Content: terrible place...no coffee maker in room, no desk or decent lighting, ugly furnishings, room service for waffle, bacon coffee and oj was $44. bed and a/c was ok. unless you are in need of a cheap hip-like hotel, stal away!

Reviews.Title: “Great lounge...Float!!!”
Reviews.Author: happytotravel788
Reviews.Content: I had a great time @ Float, this place has a comfortable vibe, great staff, and can't forget great music. The bartenders were great and everyone from the lobby to the bathroom attendent was extremly friendly. Great place to go and have drinks and sit by the fire pits. I will totally return my next trip to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “From the Ky. Wanders”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyWanders
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Diego for my convention. The location was in walking distance of the convention center. The room was clean and neat. The shower was very nice. The only thing we needed was a microwave. The refrigerator was stocked with liquor and we could not put to much into it. We were on the side with the view of the parking garage and the San Diego baseball stadium. There was more noise on Friday night due to the baseball game and the regulars out and about. The parties in the court yard were loud but did not last all night. Enjoyed the surroundings of shops and restaurants. We were able to walk to see the USS Midway and take a tour. We also took the train to a bus to the San Diego Zoo. Over all a great place to stay and go sightseeing. Very lively place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly for the younger generation.”
Reviews.Author: vinceplano
Reviews.Content: I must admit that is the most convenient hotel if you going to a convention. Also it is a block from Petco Park. But if your over 40 get a room away from the pool area and the noise at night. Also Maryanns serves a great breakfast with pitchers of Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hard Rock SD!”
Reviews.Author: Morgan T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Los Angeles and went down to San Diego for a night away and the Chargers game. We absolutely loved the Hard Rock San Diego, the location could not be better!! Right in the heart of the gaslamp district, you are close to the trolley, restaurants, bars, and shopping! Upon arrival, we were greeted right away as we pulled up to Valet and escorted to Check In. Our beautiful suite was ready upon our arrival and the room was perfect! We were given VIP passes to their 2 lounges and we went for drinks at Float on Saturday night. It was a great vibe and cool lounge area near the pool - loved the fire pits and the martinis! They had so great artists working and selling their pieces too! Upon checkout, the bell man was most helpful with getting our cars, bags, and directions to the game. We will most definately stay at the Hard Rock San Diego again!

Reviews.Title: “Not for those looking for quiet....”
Reviews.Author: MzShowStoppa
Reviews.Content: The staff was super friendly and the checkout process was quick and painless. Got there on a Friday and it was super busy. The "nightclub" and pool were packed and the noise could definitely be heard from the room. Since we went out, we didn't really mind, but those that aren't doing the whole "nightclub" thing should definitely be aware. HRH is RIGHT across the street from the SD Convention Center, so it was the most convenient we could have gotten (since we were there for a conference). Overall, no complaints (besides the noise that could have been an issue if we stayed in), but probably not the best place for couples looking to relax or those with children (if you want them to sleep before 2 am).

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock truely "ROCKS"!”
Reviews.Author: eelanim
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock for business last month for a conference across the street. The front desk was extremely helpful and guided me to a few places to shop and hang out during my free time. They asked what type of music I enjoy and when i walked into my room, the tv was on with music playing. Very awesome feature!! I tried the food at Nobu and both the service and cuisine were exceptional. Great bargain having all night happy hour for Wednesday nights!!! I worked with the catering team and they were satisfying every single last minute requests that my colleagues had. Superb team to work with even though it was only for a day. I would come back to stay at this hotel even if it wasn't for work. It's at a great location and easily accessible to the airport and downtown area, did I mention that it's a block away from Petco Stadium?? Like my title, this hotel definitely ROCKED my first time experience at a Hard Rock Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “HRHsd Always Delivers Excellence!!”
Reviews.Author: jeffrey m
Reviews.Content: My stay was excellent as always. Valet and Bellmen were prompt and friendly, Front Desk was very busy (busiest i've ever seen it) but they handled it in a fast, organized and polite manner; GREAT JOB to them. The girl that checked me in even remembered me from previous stays, made me feel pretty cool!! Erik D @ the pool is always pleasant and accommodating. I stayed for 2 nights: partied one, relaxed in the room the next, you can do it all here! Good location too. Only downfall of my trip was the MN Vikings lost :(

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, great atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Annagabriella
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Hard Rock San Diego. I continue to be pleased with the excellent customer service provided at this hotel. The atmosphere of the hotel is great, the location is worth every penny, within walking distance to great restaurants and nightlife. Used valet both times and happy with their service. Room was clean, bed was very comfortable, bathroom had a great shower. Will definitely continue to stay at this hotel when I return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: KeithHagan
Reviews.Content: I was recently in San Diego for a few days on business and I have to stay that after staying at the Hard Rock there, I can't think of another hotel I'd rather stay in when visiting the area. The staff were top notch and the hotel was a great place to hang. I shall return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: mark s
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock is the place to be in San Diego!! In the heart of the Gas Lamp district. Staff was over accomodating!! They did their best to make our stay PERFECT! Lots to do and see and the location, restuaraunts in the holel, and service were all top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Big let down for me....”
Reviews.Author: DCJim1
Reviews.Content: This place didn't do too much for me.....valet parkers tried to rip me off to park here for $20 a day and when I asked if there was public parking they said no....WHEN THERE IS PUBLIC PARKING FOR $8 A DAY RIGHT NEXT TO THE PLACE. Found the girls at the front desk to be sort of stuck up and rude, they don't even look at you when you check in, just the screen, oh....if you want to call it a front desk....more like a front cube...no space to do your check in work at. No coffee in the room but they tell you it's free in the lobby but everytime I went to get some...empty. They also want an extra $20 a night that they call "a resort fee". I you want internet....you have to get that. I took my laptop across the street to the Hilton and used their's for free....and they told me to come back any time to do so because they know about the problem at the Hard Rock....Hilton folks were really nice. That is where I'll stay next time. Oh...forget about checking out a day early if you have a death in the family or something....you will be charged for your full stay.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary well-spent at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: KatieBullShaw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at the Hard Rock Hotel to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. Though I had been to the Hard Rock as a club-goer, I had never actually stayed there as a guest. Amanda, the Rock Royalty Manager, was so accommodating and made us feel truly at home. Not only was there music to welcome us as we entered our room, the Rock Royalty crew had champagne sent up to our suite as an anniversary gift. Our room was sexy, beautifully designed, and had a killer view of downtown. We even made it down to Mary Jane's later that night for dessert, where I devoured the best brownie a la mode I have ever had! Overall, we had such a fantastic time at the Hard Rock Hotel and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a superior hotel experience. Hard Rock truly makes you feel like a rock star, which is why we definitely plan to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Ariel K
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a hand full of times now and am always satisfied. I've stayed while in town for a Charges game and for Halloween (the Hard Rock Halloween Party is great) and most recently stayed at The Hard Rock while attending a convention across the street. The location is perfect for convention because you can walk across the street! The amenities are great and the staff is ALWAYS friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Why choose anything but the Hard Rock Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: LCSD92111
Reviews.Content: OK, so, it doesn't have the fanciest pool, and the gym was a little sparse on equipment. Those are our only "complaints" about our stay. Service was impeccable, the staff was uber accommodating, and even though the pool itself is small, the atmosphere and party vibe were superior. What a great place to people watch! We had a fantastic time, and can't imagine staying anywhere else, or recommending any other hotel to anyone looking for a phenomenal experience. We're actually San Diego locals, and just wanted a different experience for a birthday party. We certainly got different---and better---and marvelous. Don't shop around---you can't beat what they have to offer. We're definitely going back,

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Tinakina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the beginning of the Gas Lamp District. It was in the perfect spot and the room was clean and very comfortable. The view was of the parking garage and the stadium, so not the best. Had a great bar in the room with snacks and other things to make your stay, but they were ridiculously over priced. $4.00 for a snickers. Lol. And you could get one downstairs for 99 cents. Was disappointed that we couldn't use the pool or even see it because they use it as a club. But overall enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: rdpecha
Reviews.Content: My sister in law and I stayed here for the Rock N Roll marathon. It was so convenient to the convention center and everything we needed was within walking distance. We were in the popular GasLamp District so we had plenty of restaurants and bars to choose from. We walked 2 blocks to the PetCo field and caught a baseball game one night. The light rail was 1 block away. The hotel had a cafe which was perfect for hot chocolate after the game. And of course, the accomodations were terrific. Although we didn't use the pool, it looked very comfy with the day beds. The only complaint, and this was our fault, as it is the Hard Rock... loud music into the night when we were trying to rest before our run the next morning. Oh well, we were too nervous to sleep anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Petco Park hotel - lots of good, but concierge issue soured trip”
Reviews.Author: ysuindy
Reviews.Content: My 16 year-old son and I stayed three nights at the Hard Rock Hotel in late July. The primary purpose of our trip was to attend a couple of Padres games. We found a good rate on one of the hotel consolidator websites - and called the hotel to ask a question about the rate. I was told the hotel would match the rate - it was nice dealing with the hotel on the reservation and not through a third party. I had e-mailed the hotel before our trip to ask for a quiet room. We were assigned room 1228 and this room, on the top floor, clearly met our needs. Our room had a view of Petco Park - which was great considering our trip was a baseball trip. We did stay Wednesday through Friday nights - we had no noise issues at all. The hotel was generally quiet on Wednesday and Thursday nights - Friday night had a lot going on but it was still quiet in our room. The beds were comfortable, the pillows were soft. The flat screen TV set to music when we first entered - a nice touch. The room was not large, but not especially cramped. The air conditioning worked fine - although San Diego was very temperate when we visited. The bathroom was larger than many hotel bathrroms, although counter space was limited. The sink was large, the shower had excellent water pressure. The towels were plush and the toiletries were good. A few things could have been better: The desk area was very small and the snacks and alcohol for sale took up much of the room that was available. There were only two drawers for clothes along with an armoire attached to the wall. We had luggage for 12 nights - it was somewhat crowded in our room. We had numerous wi-fi issues. The hotels home page was taking 80 seconds to load. We visited the concierge to ask what could be done better and her answer was to "visit the coffee shop across the street." At $17 per night for the "in-charge" fee this answer was totally unacceptable. We eventually e-mailed the assistant manager of the hotel in an attempt to get a resolution. We were advised that there was a problem with the router on our floor, that their tech group had fixed it and that the $17 per night charge would be reversed from our bill. The internet was much faster but still hesitated. We were grateful for the response for the manager, but the flippant answer from the concierge led us not to use it again. The hotel coffee shop was similar to many of the restaurants we found in the Gaslamp Quarter - very expensive. We never did eat there as they did not serve lunch early enough for our daily schedule and were closed by the time we returned in the evening. The hotel was only two blocks from Petco Park - very convenient. The trolley stops outside the front door of the hotel - again very convenient. Would I stay here again if I returned to San Diego? Yes, but I would also price shop - there are many hotels nearby. We really looked forward to visiting this hotel more than any of the other five on our trip. Maybe we built it up too much before we arrived - it was very good - but it clearly wasn't the best or our favorite (Omni San Francisco far exceeded the Hard Rock).

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: crikkle
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an awesome vibe, and the staff is excellent. They went out of their way to make the guests feel welcome from the first moment we arrived. This hospitality was carried through during my entire stay, and especially when we experienced something quite out of the ordinary-- a massive power outage for all of San Diego and surrounding areas. The staff remained calm and did everything within their power to keeps guests comfortable in a rather chaotic time (setting up food stations in the lobby, escorting guests to the stairwells with flashlights, etc). THANK YOU for a great experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “So much fun...this hotel ROCKS!!!”
Reviews.Author: asison
Reviews.Content: I came to the Hard Rock Hotel (which I have never stayed in any of their locations before) for my Bachelorette Party weekend. The Hotel is perfectly located in the heart of the Gaslamp district of San Diego which is very cool with lots to do, but I must say we barely even left the hotel grounds since there was so much to do at the Hard Rock. We ate, slept, and partied there. The rooms are very nice and clean, beds are super comfy. We had 3 rooms full of girls and they made sure we were all next to eachother. The service was excellent and made our stay so easy and relaxed. I am already trying to plan my next trip back with my new husband for New Years!

Reviews.Title: “Baby Boomer, Rock fan paradise!”
Reviews.Author: MrKite58
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Hard Rock, and I can honestly say, it is one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in. Hip atmosphere, decor and rooms. May possibly be the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept on. There is rock memorabilia everywhere, including the handwritten lyrics to "While My Guitar Gently Weeps", in Mal Evans handwriting and notations wriiten in by George Harrison. For this Beatles fan, it was practically Holy Ground! The customer service was outstanding - everyone we came in contact with was friendly, helpful and totally guest focused. And one of the coolest amenities I've ever received at a hotel, the use of a Fender TeleCaster at no charge! The location couldn't be better, right at the entrance to the Gaslamp District and one block from Petco Park. Just a 5 minute walk and your in the stadium. Dozens of restaurants within a few minutes walk of the hotel, although the hotel has restaurants for all tastes. I especially liked sitting at the poolside bar enjoying a cocktail, a plate of pita and hummus and the beautiful weather. I will say, over the weekend we seemed to have a run of loud, obnoxious drunks yelling in the hallways until the wee hours, but that may have been an unusual occurence for all I know. However, it was such a minor annoyance, it probably wasn't worth mentioning, but be aware...:) Overall, a terriffic experience, and I would go out of my way to stay at a another Hard Rock Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: ScottEP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock San Diego with our two teenage girls. Hotel staff were awesome; very friendly and helpful. They were very accommodating with our request for a high floor away from the pool & lounge noise. Room was surprisingly quiet based on our expectations. We had a Hard Rock Suite, with plenty of room. The only problems: difficulty in regulating the temperature in the room, and the beds seemed smaller than the advertised queens. Excellent fitness room. Didn't use hotel parking, we used cabs when we needed to, and walked around the gaslamp quarter, which worked out fine. Trolley stop was right actross the street; but we didn't have any noise problems from it. Plenty of restaurants and shopping all around. Had a good (somewhat pricey) breakfast at Mary Jane's. Went to a Padres game, and hotel is basically one block away from Petco Park. Hotel resort fee includes fitness room, newspaper, internet, and business center. Overall, a great stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “nice bed, hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveGGGG
Reviews.Content: The price for the room and location are good. The bed is very comfortable. Because it's downtown in the Gaslamp district it's difficult to park there on a weekend and the garage around the corner charges more when the Padres are playing. I noticed the parking was much more available on a Monday vs. the weekend. On Sat night we did hear some noises after midnight, not near our room, but apparently from clubs and partying going on. You have to expect this - it is the Hard rock hotel after all!

Reviews.Title: “Best Party Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: blake w
Reviews.Content: We woke up so hungover it was not even funny!!! We totally blacked out and didn't remember what the last 6 pictures were taken of on our disposable camera, we lived the true "Hangover". Thankfully she was the one that took dirty pics... none the less, definetly one of the best vacations of my life!

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience Ever.”
Reviews.Author: apavl464
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hard Rock in San Diego was one of the best I've ever had. It was our first time to California and we were amazed and the friendliness of the staff and the amazing location of the hotel. The concierge took care of multiple dinner reservations, fedex-ing a package, and giving advice on where to shop and how to get there. The Hard Rock employees really cared, and after only a couple of nights, we were always remembered and greeted by name. Valet service was very efficient, staff was knowledgeable about the surrounding areas, and room service was good. We also went to the intervention pool party on Sunday, which had quite the eclectic group of people and high energy. My only complaint about the pool party was the overpriced drinks. Overall, I will definitely be back to this hotel, San Diego goes to the top of my list as the best vacation to date.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hard Rock experience!”
Reviews.Author: Robin B
Reviews.Content: My husband won a weekend at the Hard Rock at our daughters' school auction. I have to admit, it probably wasn't somewhere we'd normally go as we're not what you'd call hip and cool. But you know what? The staff at HRH made us feel like we belonged and provided exceptional service. My husband especially loved getting to borrow a guitar for the weekend! We received great recommendations on shopping and escaping to a quiet bar in the Gaslamp Quarter (check out Wine Steals). And we had some incredible breakfasts at MaryJane's. Needless to say, we look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Rocking time...we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Jim L
Reviews.Content: Scouted hotel to serve as corporate location during upcoming convention. The HR exceeded my expectations and I had a rocking time. Since then, I've contracted for 500+ room nights over the duration of our stay and have placed all my faith that our guest will also feel like Rock Royalty. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeleahy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice with excellent decor throughout. Valet parking is expensive and the room rates are expensive enough (but not overly so). I wouldnt stay here again and the reason is simple. This is not a hotel for couples or families, it is only a hotel for young single, heavy drinking people. The noise around the floors at the weekend was unbearable, constant drunks banging on doors and trying to get into rooms they had no keys for. How did they get past the lift without a room key? Where was security and / or management ? If a hotel like this only caters for young drunks then they are catering for the wrong kind of people as these people dont spend money in the real things that make a hotel money e.g. spa , restuarants etc. We did get a free bottle of champagne on arrival to celebrate our engagement but i wouldnt return as its too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at the entrance of the Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: MelReb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hard rock because I wanted a mixture of business and pleasure. The location was perfect for me because the hotel is across the street from the convention center and at the entrance of the gaslamp district. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating...actually exceeded my expectations. I stayed on the 9th floor overlooking the city and pool area. The music from their Sunday pool party was definitely loud but was done by 7pm so I did not mind it...the train was a bit loud throughout the night but that isn't the hotels fault. I definitely recommend breakfast at maryjanes...the hash browns are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great vibe, fun staff, all around great experience!"”
Reviews.Author: Michelle S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time at the Hard Rock! Unfortunately we didn't get to enjoy any of the great restaurants or lounges as we already had dinner plans, but loved the property! Our room was very comfortable, with a fun, convenient layout for both business and pleasure. Everyone we encountered was really fun and upbeat- not it the forced "fake" way you sometimes see, but all genuinely seemed to be happy to be there. We will definitely go back, and want to check out Nobu, Float and 207 for sure next time- they all looked great!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: My wife had a conference in San Diego so we stayed at the Hard Rock, which actually cheaper than several of the hotels that the conference suggested. For the conference the location is perfect, just a very short walk across the street. The room is a very nice size and we enjoyed the furnishings, very contemporary. My wife would have enjoyed a bathtub but the shower was very cool. Only problem with it is the entire floor of the shower gets wet/slippery. I was surprised how quiet the room was considering the atmosphere/nightlife that goes on at the hotel, I was a little worried at first. We ate at Mary Jane's, service was a little slow, decent food. Overall we had a pleasant stay and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great except for the size of the room”
Reviews.Author: worldVIAJERO3000
Reviews.Content: It was a great room. Nice decor and ambiance, true to the Hard rock experience. Size of the room was small to what I had expected. We were placed on top floor overlooking the coronado bridge and san diego bay, it was a beautiful view. Loved the 2 head shower, very spacious bathroom. Bed was comfy. Traveled with my wife who did complain about the party noise, it was 3am and we still could hear the party noise. I expected this since it is after all a Hard Rock hotel. The only drawback to our experience was a pool party that was held on Sunday afternoon, a couple of people were thrown off the curve while we were waiting for our car (valet) and it seemed as the hotel security wasn't on top of the situation. Overall I recommend to those Hard Rock fans. Would try another Hard Rock hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was very nice.”
Reviews.Author: sharbearCalif
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hard Rock San Diego were great. It was a small Hotel but nice. The rooms were beautiful and very clean. Mary Jane's had great food. I did visit the lounge up by the pool, it was nice and the staff were very nice. I Wasn't impressed with the pool. it's tiny and there are no lounge chairs. There were beds and couches only and half of them said reserved already. Not many people can fit around the pool area. It was too confined and closed in. I liked the fact that there was a fitness room in the Hotel and Wi-Fi in your room and it didn't cost extra.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: greenpony
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old son and I visitied San Diego as our annual summer baseball trip. He was very excited about staying at the Hard Rock and I had no concerns bout the noisy party image of the hotel - we were prepared for that. The good: The staff was awesome (front desk, valet, shops); location at the edge of the Gaslamp was perfect - we were a block from Petco Park and lots of good restaurants. The party aspect of the hotel was really a non-issue, we never found it disruptive at all. I liked the choices available in the in-room mBar and the prices were in line with my expectations. I was happy with the food choices at the hotel, no need to leave for a good meal. The less good: The Hard Rock did not live up to my quality expectations, it was fairly average and not really what I expected. I was never able to reliably use wifi despite the efforts of both the Help; Desk and the Front Desk. I found the room fairly bland and lacking in some basics. There is very little space to unpack clothes,just the closet and a couple desk drawers. I found a similar lack of storage space in the bathroom which also had no fan and would badly fog up after showers. Would I stay at a Hard Rock Hotel in the future? Probably not. I didn't feel the value was in line with the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined the last days of our honeymoon - poor service and lack of care for customers”
Reviews.Author: critchg
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a $399 a night float studio, described on the website as on the pool deck with a private terrace. The room was small and the carpet was "crunchy" as if it had been wet and dried an number of times. The private terrace was 8ft by 6 ft wi wicker sofas over looking a large blank concrete space with cheap astroturf on it. The sofas were full of cigarette holes and each morning were hosed down with a strong bleach solution, is meant the cushions were wet all day and couldn't be used and at the terrace smelt like a public toilet. Each day we have to replace the cushions and reset the terrace ourselves - the cleaning teams didn't return to do is. When we did use our "private" terrace for the first few days we watched engineers and members of staff from the hotel setting up tables, bars for an event just at the end of our terrace - not very private. On the last day of our honeymoon from 8 am there were people outside our terrace setting up an event - we were blessed with listening to the staff shouting to each other and we caught to catch up on all their personal gossip as they chatted away - again not very private. At 3 pm the event started and 200-300 people in party mode appeared at the end of our private terrace (which had a rope place across the end - not sure if this was to keep us in or them out). They had a great time firing t-shirts out of air canons drinking and eating. My wife got upset when guest continually approached us to ask if they could join us on our terrace - some didn't bother asking we found one guy happily sat on the terrace chatting on his mobile phone. So overall really poor. We don't have a problem with the hotel hosting great event but we booked our room 12 months in advance and they knew we were on honeymoon - it wouldn't have taken a genius to work out the two things are not compatible and to have offered us a different room - even a downgrade would've been better! We spoke to the hotel on the friday and at checkout ultimately they just offered platitudes and seemed to think it was our job to offer them a solution to our dissatisfaction. The guy I spoke to was nice enough but he was more interested in getting a complaining customer out of his lobby than really dealing with the problem. In the end they waived the resort fee and gave us $130 off the bill - but they just didn't get the fact that was inadequate - this was our honeymoon - ultimately they didn't care. We had various other service issues with unreturned concierge calls and it was a disappointing end to our honeymoon. I would not stay here, the location is good but use the Hilton or omni - they are in the same place and have proper hotel service standards. Don't get a suite and don't believe the descriptions of the rooms and facilities on the website.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay when in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: crix1968
Reviews.Content: I really can't say enough great things about the service we received at the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego. Traveling alone with my six year old son isn't always the easiest thing to pull off (ask any parent), but the staff at the Hard Rock made my trip. After long days at Lego Land, Sea World, and the San Diego Zoo, coming home to the hotel was truly a pleasure. They know how to treat their guests and they do it with pride. The atmosphere is electric, the accommodations are amazing, and the staff is superb! What more can I say.....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: claudia6422
Reviews.Content: Loved it. We got a room up high. If u stay on third floor expect to hear load music all night. Great atmosphere!! The valet was great. Not much waiting

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: Momo F
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here with friends several times for the sole purpose of partying and had an excellent time. I've stayed in the standard rooms and a couple of suites. Thought the beds were super comfy because I like softer beds. Although the rooms are on the smaller side, they are very clean and I love the design of the room. The customer service is great. They're super friendly and were more than happy to brings things up that we randomly requested (ex. USB cords, high heels in my car). Of course we tipped them well. They are located right in the middle of Gaslamp and right across them street from the convention center. Excellent location for food and nightlife. The bars and club in the hotel are ok to me, not my favorite for Gaslamp, but it really just depends on your personal preference. Highly recommended for staying with friends looking for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “You guys Rock!!”
Reviews.Author: Lulusummer
Reviews.Content: I must share with you all everyone at this hotel was so polite n willing to help. I truly enjoy my stay and coming back in the future. Yasi was the best!!

Reviews.Title: “The only place I'll stay in San DIego.”
Reviews.Author: Rob Z
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego since it's opening a few years back. It's proximity to San Diego's airport, the San Diego Convention Center and it's location within San Diego's "Gaslamp Quarter" make it ultra convenient. The rooms are spacious and modern and the service is impeccable. I will say that the place has a tendency to get loud on the weekends, but I take it with a grain of salt... I mean, it is the Hard Rock Hotel after all.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Diego, trust me.”
Reviews.Author: moefried
Reviews.Content: The hotel was much better then I expected. Great service, clean rooms, fresh smell, great pool deck. Very modernized. They even upgraded me to a suite at no charge. My room had a view straight into Petco park. The hotel is much bigger and nicer then it looks in the pictures you'll see online. The hotel is right in the gaslamp area, lots of action at night.

Reviews.Title: “Got my Rock on at the Hard Rock Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: chrissy_gal
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is absolutely amazing and completely exceeded my expectations in every cateogory. We stayed here 5 days from from August 13 to August 18. My boy friend now fiancee proposed to me in our rock star suite on the first night!! FLIGHT: We flew from Toronto via Air Canada. Everything was on time. No in flight meal included but they sell sandwiches on board and snacks and offer free beverages. I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich it was decent. ARRIVAL: San diego airport wasn't as busy as I expected and nothing spectacular. We needed a taxi to the hotel so when you head out follow the signs and theres a booth with a person dispatching taxis on a first come first serve basis. So no need to haul down or call ahead they do all the work for you and there is a slew of taxis outside waiting for customers. CHECK IN: As we pulled up the vallets welcomed us and helped us take out our luggage from the taxi and portered it to the check in desk. As we entered the hotel was pretty busy with others checking in and they were playing rock music in the background. The concerige lady was really nice but we were early so the room wasn't ready yet. Check in wasnt until 4pm and we were there at 1pm. She took our cell number and said she would call us when the room was ready if we wanted to go out have a bite to eat or explore around. Across the street was a fish taco restaurant called Tin Fish so we just headed over there. The concerige tagged our suitcases and kept it behind the desk for us. When we returned from lunch the concerige called us over to let us know our room was ready and the porter brought our suitcases up shortly after.
