On Sunday, our conference registration coincided with the Sunday Intervention party. Because of this, the hotel was full of security staff. All of the security people I encountered were very polite and some were downright entertaining. All staff I talked to were polite and professional. The downside of the Sunday Intervention? The clientele. Large group of attractive, young, inebriated, loud, foul-mouthed young adults. One of my coworkers described it as Jersey Shore West. To the hotel’s credit, they kept the revelers away from our conference area, although you could hear the music and loud people everywhere on the lower floors. Overall, a flawless place for a conference. Just stay away on Sunday afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with rockin' service!”
Reviews.Author: NEBowen
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great ambiance and staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly. Always willing to lend a helping hand. We ate at Maryjanes for breakfast every moring, and every morning the staff went above and beyond, by making our 17 month old daughter special pancakes with mouse ears! After checking in we walked to Petco park and caught a baseball game! This was our 2nd time staying at the Hard Rock and it will be the ONLY place we stay when we come to San Diego!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel next to Gaslamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ndsmith
Reviews.Content: Definitely a themed hotel, which I found to be mostly a neutral feature (neither an advantage nor a disadvantage, though the music always playing in the public spaces would be a problem for those who prefer classical or Muzak). On the other hand, the room was really nice and everything was spotless, and the service impeccable always. Nobu, the restaurant, seems to me to be the best in the district. I was in San Diego on business, and would probably have liked to have a proper desk in the room, but I made do near the minibar and really liked the layout of the room otherwise. I would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: sborenstein
Reviews.Content: We brought our 15 mo baby nervously but the room and hotel,mid week, was quiet, clean, and safe. The staff was helpful and very friendly. We stayed in a king suite and had plenty of room. to avoid charges we brought our own pack n play and microwave. But they can provide them on request. strongly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLP1989
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights April 25 to 29, 2011. The hotel is located in great location, close to everything. San Diego is so easy to get around. I would highly recommend renting a vehicle. The hotel has a big name to live up to. The room was a nice size, but awkwardly set up. The bed was really comfortable. The room lacked amenities like enough towels, no bathrobes, no dresser to unpack my clothes. The valet parking was $35 a night, which is a little outrageous. However, the service was good and our car was always brought to us quickly when we needed it.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: MalibuDep
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Woodstock suite. Beautiful room with a great balcony overlooking both the pool and Gaslamp Quarter. Service was impeccable. Ate 3 times at Maryjanes. Food is terrific. The rooms are very comfortable and spotless. This is one of my top 3 favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin' Property, for the young and young at heart”
Reviews.Author: Tootie84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying here one night for a week long business trip. The valet staff was very friendly and accommodating, but did feel a tad bit rushed once we arrived because it was very busy and a small area to drop your car off. The hotel had a very cool large video screen behind the check in counters with videos of helicopters playing (there was a helicopter's conference going on there), and great music playing. I could tell this was going to be a very "modernized" chill hotel. We stayed in the Hard Rock Suite , and the view was phenomenal of Petco Park. We even had a small balcony we could go out and enjoy the sun. It would have been even better if we were one room over as they had a much larger balcony with chairs and a table. But we were so happy with our view it didn't matter too much. The room was very modernized with large glass frosted doors, one for the bathroom and one for the shower. Plenty of space with a great relaxing area in the room. The only downfall was the candy was tempting us, but it $4.00 per bar! It was in a great location in San Diego with just steps away from the famous Gaslamp Quarter, and the diner that was hooked on to the hotel had fantastic food. Would highly recommend you eat there for at least breakfast. My husband said that it was the best biscuits and gravy he has ever had. Overall, highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: flygirl35838
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for business and I have to say that this hotel rates as one of the best overall experiences I have ever had. Every staff person I had any contact with was wonderful - courteous, helpful and went out of their way to make my stay perfect. My room was immaculate and beautifully appointed. A perfect location - within walking distance to numerous outstanding restaurants, parks, shopping, etc. etc. No need to have a car. I can't say enough about my stay - I love music and this hotel with it's emphasis on all music genre -- was, well, just fun!

Reviews.Title: “This place "Rocks"...”
Reviews.Author: Jesse-Dena
Reviews.Content: Perfect location right in the mix of all the Gaslamp District has to offer. Early check-in was a breeze. It literally took about 90 seconds. I think it took longer for us to decide what kind of music we wanted playing when we walked into our room. (They program the music from the front desk - nice touch). The hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly/helpful - especially the concierge crew. They were able to give us several discount coupons for the area attractions and made some great recommendations for things to do. Mary Jane's (one of the restaurants onsite) has killer breakfast. No complaints about Hard Rock at all. We'll definately be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: lindag1023
Reviews.Content: We had amazing service during our entire stay. We met 4 exceptional staff members - Juan, Katie, Fish & Mike - these folks were personable, professional & added to our overall experience. My husband & I loved our room - we have never slept so good on vacation! And the shower set-up was awesome. We woke up every morning and used the fitness equipment , beautiful state-of-the art machines! The entire facility is immaculate and well maintained, obviously well managed!

Reviews.Title: “this place rocks!”
Reviews.Author: woody4buzz
Reviews.Content: Check out this place no matter whether you are on business trip or holiday in San Diego! We recently stayed at the Hard Rock for 3 nights. We chose the hotel after reading the good reviews at TripAdvisor. This turned out to be an excellent decision! There are so many highlights about the Hard Rock including friendly and helpful staff, fantastic location (right at the center of the gaslamp quarter), excellent facilities (clubs, restaurants) and beautiful rooms (ours is the king suite). As a regular business traveler, this is definitely one of the best hotels I have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: michaelh6580
Reviews.Content: If you're staying in San Diego, this is THE place to stay. The rooms are beautiful - we stayed in a king suite. We were on the top floor with a full balcony that overlooked the Gaslamp District and PETCO Park. Our room was incredibly clean, comfortable, and spacious. They even had our favorite music playing as we entered. Our intent was to explore the Gaslamp District, but we ended up never leaving the hotel. Stop by Float for a beautiful rooftop experience and look for Fish - he's the guy that sounds like Tone Loc (need I say more?). Nobu was incredible for sushi and has an excellent happy hour. 207 is a great place for drinks and if you need a late night snack, be sure to check out Maryjane - the burgers are AWESOME. We would definitely stay here again. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful - they made us feel like rock stars. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “The right place if you are young and energetic”
Reviews.Author: ukjingai
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king suit for three nights during an event in the convention center. We were three guys but our friends came and in total we were like 10 people partying. The room was equipped with amp and sound system, and the front lent an electric guitar. Guess what? We went crazy drinking singing and laughing ever nighr. I think our neighbors were drunk and cool too. Some of them just nocked on the door and joined us. Overall, I loved the place. The neihborhood was great and there were a lot of restaurants and bars around. The hotel itself had a night club but we didnt go in there as we had our own in our room. Cannot recommend it if you are a business traveller looking for a quiet place to rest, or and old couple seeking a quiet and relax stay though. Otherwise don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “This is well done well”
Reviews.Author: dbowen4559
Reviews.Content: The staff, from valet to valet, was excellent. The kind of 'you are special' and 'can do' attitude exhibited by all staff should be a study case for other hotels. For some reason, a regular room, mid-week, was nearly $300. Rooms at the Vegas counterpart, I believe, are quite a bit less. All-in-all, keep up the good job. P.S. The rockin' guitar setup by Gibson in the room was a blast--beats TV and almost everything else. db

Reviews.Title: “Nice but lacking hospitality”
Reviews.Author: md20FortWorth_Texas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hard Rock when we travelled to San Diego for the American College of Physicians convention. As expected, the hotel is very modern with a strong musical theme. We didn't expect old world elegance, and we were fairly pleased with the decor. We were not pleased with the hospitality, or lack there of. On our first night, there was a halloween in april themed party in the club on the first floor. The party was a disappointment. Overpriced drinks, no energy, etc. We left after a short time. When we approached the elevator to go to our room, we were stopped by an attendant. My wife produced her hotel key and the attendant stared at it with a blank look. The key was not the standard key but a specialty key produced for the ACP convention. The attendant asked several questions about the key in a tone suggesting he didn't believe us. He finally relented and allowed us to return to our room. On another occasion, my wife had a drink in a plastic cup that the bartender said she could take to her room if she wished. The same attendant again stopped her and told her she couldn't take the drink to her room. Upon her insistence, he allowed her to pass. Another night, we returned to the hotel after a late dinner. The entrance was roped off and a burly bouncer as manning the entrance. He turned away a person just ahead of us. He then turned his attention to a co-worker who he appeared to be chatting with. After waiting for almost a minute, we stepped over the rope. When he turned his attention back to us, I showed him my room key. Instead of apologizing for inconveniencing a hotel guest, he said to me "next time, please wait for me to open the ropes". Both my wife and I felt that was very rude and inappropriate. I understand that , because the nightclubs are open to the public, a certain level of scrutiny is important. But, that necessity does not excuse poor treatment of hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “What a blast. Wish I had stayed longer.”
Reviews.Author: G-M0ney65
Reviews.Content: We went to San Deigo for a weekend getaway with friends, and had even more fun than we expected. The city has everything: great restaurants, great nightlife, perfect weather, lot's to do. We parked our car and never had to use it again. Tons to do within easy walking distance. And with all there was to do at the hotel, we could have easily spent the entire weekend there. Both evenings we were there, we watched the sunset from the Float bar, which provided the perfect start to our evenings. The rooms were very chic, and the staff were great (several of them even learned our names and checked on us throughout our stay). We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “First time in downtown San Diego, Awesome”
Reviews.Author: jlowe26
Reviews.Content: THis was our first time in downtown San Diego and the Hard Rock is the place to be. Hotel was electric with professional courteous staff that make sure your stay is special. The Hotel is located right at the beginning of the Gas Lamp District, lots to see within short walking distance. Tram is also right across the street so longer distances are easy too. Great experience

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: talkshowsonmute
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was nothing short of amazing! We stayed in one of the Hard Rock Suites which was very comfortable, almost like a home away from home. A large tv in the living room and bedroom! Service was fantastic especially when we were asked what type of music would we like playing when we enter our room! The Hard Rock hotel is in a perfect location right in the Gaslamp District which is always filled with a friendly and fun atmosphere with plenty of bars and restaurants. The only downside to the Hard Rock is be prepared to be awoken by parties above or below you room! Apart from that it was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Professional Management Response”
Reviews.Author: docontheroad
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel is stylish, comfortable, and located adjacent to the Convention Center which was a real convenience for me as I was there to attend a meeting. The amenities are first rate and the double faucet shower was fantastic. Unfortunately, during my stay at the hotel my sleep was interrupted one night by a disruptive/drunk guest knocking on my door. Security responded promptly and both Derrick Mukina (the Guest Services Manager) and Luke Burger (Director of Guest Services) were professional, responsive, and gracious at addressing this issue with me in the days that followed. I really appreciate the level of customer service that I received and would strongly recommend the hotel to a colleague. Disruptive guests must be the nightmare of all hotels, but the way that the management decides to address the issue and the disruption to other guests can be very variable; I am thankful for Derrick and Luke's help.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: jessicapirch
Reviews.Content: i liked it a lot everyone was nice and i felt safe because their were securely, the bed was amazing, and i mean amazing, it took me 2 sec. to fall asleep

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: sew320
Reviews.Content: We have all of our girls trips at the Hard Rock Hotel San Diego. The service is amazing and they treat us like rock stars!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and quality service.”
Reviews.Author: Nzayerz
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Hard Rock hotel. I was very pleased with the quality and cleanliness of the rooms. The location of the hotel was awesome as well. It was right next to the ball park and also right in the gaslamp so it was convenient for is to watch the game,get dressed and go out dancing right after the game. The only downfall I had was the expensive valet parking they had buy all I did was park in the parking structure next to the hotel which was literally right next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and outstanding service, hotel was fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: darbymc
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice - great atmosphere. Rooms are clean and well decorated. Beds and linens are very comfortable. Shower is awesome with double shower head. Food is also really good. Location is prime - near lots of shopping, bars, food, ball park and the harbor. But the most outstanding thing about this hotel is the service. From the moment you arrive and are greeted by an army of bellhops and attendants you are taken care of. Everything from the front desk to security is outstanding - particularly one security employee Kenny who went out of his way to help me find a lost item. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: rissakip
Reviews.Content: Pro We loved our stay at the Hotel, it is a great location we were there for St Patricks last year and had a great time Con The toilets were so uncomfortable i couldn't believe it. I think they were trying to be stylish but they failed! I felt like i was going to fall in, they sit so high so i felt like i needed to stand on something to support my legs. To make it worse i was pregnant and needed to use it several times a day. I actually had to finish my business outside the hotel because i couldnt stand them. Also the toilets are encassed in a glass wall, you can definately see someone in there doing their business. I tested it with my friend and i could clearly tell the colour of her underwear. After the first night we stopped using the toilets when people were in the room. Shower was the same you can see the outline of the person taking a shower, just too wierd for me. I would only go there with immidiate family but won't be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: edwards5228
Reviews.Content: My Daughter and planned a trip to the San Diego Zoo and prior to leaving our house 2hrs away i pulled my back out. Needless to say by the time we were done with the zoo i was not able to make the trip home so we decided to stay the night. I chose the Hardrock knowing it was an upscale hotel and I would get a good nights sleep. Upon checking in I was greated by a friendly clerk who was more than accomodating. I informed her that we were not prepared to stay the night and needed simple amentities such as toothbrushes and toothpaste and asked if she could direct me to the nearest drug store. I was pleasantly surprised when she said not to worry just let me know what you need and we will have it sent up to your room. A few minutes later sure enough there was a knock at the door and everything we needed. The rooms were very clean and very comfortable. i loved that they had our style of music playing when we got up there. The shower was awesome with the double shower heads. Overall our experience was great and I would totally stay there again. As a matter of fact my 15 yr old keep asking to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel that made our stay in San Diego enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: nichole71
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great and I would recommend it to anyone. They staff was very pleaseant and helpful. The rooms were clean, stylish, and FUN! The Hard Rock Hotel was very classy, and it is definetely worth staying in. It is located in Downtown San Diego close to the stadium, the convention center, shops, and plenty of dining establishments. If you go to San Diego then you want to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, unique, modern hotel with an edge.....and great location!”
Reviews.Author: AmyEBooth
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel San Diego offers a new, fun experience....clean, modern rooms....excellent restaurant options, and a great location. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Rocks Every Time”
Reviews.Author: davanwag
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hard Rock San Diego a few times in the past. It is my first choice when traveling to San Diego. The service is always fantastic and the rooms are always spotless. This property is not just a nights stay. It is an experience. I highly recommend the Hard Rock for anyone traveling to San Diego and wanting to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “GET TREATED LIKE A ROCK STAR AT THE HARD ROCK SAN DIEGO!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mfranco636
Reviews.Content: The staff truly made our stay at the Hard Rock a great one. I have stayed at the Hard Rock in Las Vegas, Tampa, and Orlando and this experience was by far the best. Our room was awesome with fantastic views. The whole staff was very friendly and accommodating and definitely made us say we want to plan another trip to the Hard Rock. I also wanted to recognize your Concierge Robbie, he gave us great advice.

Reviews.Title: “Too loud and too noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Bmarycool
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to many activities and restaurants; however, if you have a room facing the train tracks expect to be awakened by the train at around 2 am. In addition cars playing loud music can be heard from the lower floor rooms as they pass by.

Reviews.Title: “A MEETING PLANNER'S DREAM! GREAT STAFF, GREAT FOOD, GREAT PROPERTY!”
Reviews.Author: Raybugger
Reviews.Content: After a fair amount of hesitation, I booked the Hard Rock Hotel for a corporate event. I wasn't sure that the Hard Rock was an appropriate location for a business conference (especially not one that spanned several days), and I was concerned that perhaps the staff would be a bit young and inexperienced. But it was in a great location, with excellent contract terms so I took the plunge. I am SO GLAD that I did! The service was outstanding and we had absolutely NO problems whatsoever. The food was amazing (they use a lot of local produce, etc. and the food was fresh, healthy and, most importantly, tasty), the A/V team was all over our every request and I found every single member of the Hard Rock team to be 100% professional and experienced. They were creative in their ideas for making our program outstanding and I got nothing but positive reviews from our attendees. The entire event went flawlessly with everyone from the bellmen to the General Manager taking an interest in making it a success. I'm a (little) bit older and very conservative. The staff did a great job of making me feel welcome and not at all out of place in such a trendy environment. If you are a meeting planner, I highly recommend that you take a serious look at the Hard Rock Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie604
Reviews.Content: This place is truly one of a kind. They provide excellent service with amazing rooms. I would highly recommend this Hard Rock Hotel to anyone who is looking for not only a great place to stay, but also have an amazing time doing it. At the Hard Rock, they truly treat you like a rock star!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel rocks!”
Reviews.Author: egoizueta
Reviews.Content: Not being a huge fan of Hard Rock Cafes this was my first time staying at a Hard Rock Hotel. This one in San Diego has it all. Great deco, fantastic amenities, spot on location and absolutely superb staff. My experience started as soon as I arrived where Chelsea checked me in. If you ever have the chance to stay, make sure you look for Chelsea. Such a nice person has to be met!

Reviews.Title: “taste of Vegas Hard Rock in the Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: SDsurferdude
Reviews.Content: stayed with my GF one night at the HRH since we were flying out of SAN the next morning. I upgraded to a suite and was given a Woodstock suite. Great room, and good folks at the front desk. We did not party in the hotel much but did eat at Mary Janes. Great vibe in here. A lot of flash but some San Diego chill. I will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Hip spot for a party, but not so much for business”
Reviews.Author: gilkesjm
Reviews.Content: Overall not a bad place to stay. If you are looking for a party you won't have far to go. The little things in the room make you feel well pampered. However the room is undersized in comparison to other "lux" hotels. It's just enough space for a weekend party, not much more. The mBar is priced as expected (triple markup on items). Would replace the mBar with a fridge and in room coffee (like a k-cup). Agree with previous comments - room cleaning was inconsistent. Some days you get everything refreshed, some days you don't (ie, soaps and consumables). The TV system is SLOW and sometimes doesn't respond at all. Not very impressed with the channel selection (specifically HD). As a business traveler, you should be aware that hotel events and functions have priority over general guests. This is obvious by the speaker systems used for these events. BTW, the pool deck could use some power washing and general cleansing. Again, if you are looking for a night in Gaslamp San Diego, or a party weekend this is a great spot. Otherwise, I have another venue in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Number One for service”
Reviews.Author: Carsonheli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock San Diego during Mardi Gras and found that the hotel and rooms were great, clean & nice. What you would expect with a nice hotel. The best part of the hotel was the people. Most hotels you can't even get the workers to look you in the eye as you pass them in the hall, I guess they don't want you to ask for something. At the Hard Rock, every staff member we saw smiled and either said "Good Morning" or "How is your stay going?" or something positive. The staff was the best part and that is saying a lot as the Hotel itself was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “The Service was AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: heartstravel1211
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock because we got a great rate. It was in the best area if you are a foodie. Tons of restaurants and famous chefs everywhere. The service at the Hard Rock is really what gets my "best place to stay" vote though. There was not a single employee there that wasn't trying to make us happy. Even running around mad to find a pair of perscription sunglasses my hubby had left behind. They were fast and efficient with cars and luggage. Check-in and Check-out were hassle free. Garrison, one of their employees went way beyond what a bell help should have to do. It was awesome. I will def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and service Even if a bit loud”
Reviews.Author: WasabiSam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early march 2011. The hotel has a wonderful vibe without the "you're-not-cool-enough" vibe I get at W's. The staff was incredible, from Check-in, to concierge, to housekeeping. Gym is average but the bar at the pool (Float) was great. Nobu, which is in the lobby was wonderful as well. The room gets a little loud at night if you overlook the pool bar and the trolley dings periodically at night. Nevertheless, this hotel turned me on to te Hard Rock brand. We will definitely be back and the next time we're in SD, we know where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another AWESOME expierience at the Hard Rock SD”
Reviews.Author: rico242a
Reviews.Content: Was treated wonderful and was upgraded to a HUGE suite after more of my friends came into town to celebrate my Birthday. looking forward to visiting again soon. Always a great time at the Hard Rock SD

Reviews.Title: “NOT a business hotel!”
Reviews.Author: h2002
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business meeting being held at the hotel. I honestly don't know what the organizers were thinking. There was no chance of getting any sleep. This is truly a party hotel like no other I've seen. Instead of a coffee maker in the room there was a TON of alcohol, a variety of snacks and condoms. People were drunk and partying past 2 am . They were yelling in the hallways and I had to be at meetings at 8 am in the morning. The food was good, but pricey. The restaurant staff was polite as were the valet guys out front. The hostesses were somewhat snotty. There was no option for a shuttle to the airport or even an offer to arrange one when I stated I did not want to take a taxi. Overall I'd say this hotel is geared to people in their 20's that haven't gotten the all night partying out of their system. For everyone else, stay at the Hyatt or the Marriott across the street. When I am paying that much for a room I expect to be able to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock is truely AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: garyocampo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thought we would take a weekend out at the Gaslamp and give the Hard Rock a try this time. We have stayed at other hotels in the Gaslamp area but never enjoyed any other hotels as much as the Hard Rock. The quality of service was absolutley terrific from the time we pulled up to the valet to when we checked out. Everyone from the valet, reception, concierge, and even a waitress seemed to want to make sure we had everything we needed and even suggested places to go and things to do while we were staying at the Gaslamp. The room was outstanding! 12th floor with a balcony. Great view and very clean and modern. I could have spent a full day walking the hallways just looking at all the music memorabilia. We are already planning our future trips to San Diego and they all involve the Hard Rock, It is a truely AWESOME EXPERIENCE.

Reviews.Title: “Great vibe, excellent service, and all about solutions, not problems”
Reviews.Author: fatmagic
Reviews.Content: The great service started from the time i parked my car with Valet, getting the best service and actually being remembered from my past visit which was more than 6 months ago, made me feel like i came back home. Amanda is an excellent valet employee at hard rock, Bentley also known as Evan did more than his job entailed, Willie also great with handling my bags to my room, and actually calling in to move me rooms elevator noise. To be honest i will pay the price just because Hard Rock employees are excellent and different from all other hotel employees, very natural, energetic, positive, and enjoy working, so makes the guests enjoy being there. Hard Rock is my home in San Diego not my hotel. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “I cannot wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: carrersm
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few hotels I have stayed at that exceeded my expectations! From the moment I pulled up the the Valet, to the moment I left, everything and everyone was perfect; friendly, helpful, professional and sincere. My room was comfortable and clean with an awesome view. The hotel was in short walking distance to everything, great food, fun night life, and really good ice cream around the corner! Like I said, I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, look forward to going back!”
Reviews.Author: KhristinaLynn
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely helpful and very courteous! The room was beautiful and very comfortable. The view was amazing. I will definately be back as often as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Not for families”
Reviews.Author: gklongo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Feb. while my husband attended a conference. We Booked the hotel thinking it would just be the two of us but at the last minute decided to bring our 5 year old daughter. I believe we were the only family in the hotel. For singles and couples would be much more appropriate. One big drawback. The bathroom sits between the bed and living area. Very open and with glass doors for the toilet and shower so very little to no privacy. Thank goodness we didn't bring our teenage daughter as well. Did not utilize many of the hotel services. Did have a charge from the diner downstairs Mary Jane's for someone's late night dinner which was not ours. Still have not had it removed from the bill. Very difficult to get the person on the phone who should remove it. Still working on it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Diego! Great Staff with phenomenal accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: KL2011
Reviews.Content: I frequent San Diego for business, the Hard Rock Hotel is a great place to stay & dine. The staff is fantastic and very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, personalized service.”
Reviews.Author: LPMIII
Reviews.Content: My only knock on the HR San Diego was a bit of party noise from the street level that woke me up one night. However, I would (and will) stay there again very soon. The HR chain must have beefed up their dedication to personalized service, because I was impressed! I typically stay at W's or St. Regis, but the HR in this case was more conveniently located, and I was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel stay ever”
Reviews.Author: fordboy1994
Reviews.Content: would recommend Hard Rock San Diego to anyone traveling down or staying in the gas lamp quarter of San Diego. Pricing was phenomenal and the room OMG when I walked in was floored. For the price I paid it was perfect feather top mattress, feather pillows, flat screens the views will be my place to stay anytime I go to San Diego anytime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does rock and so does the spa.”
Reviews.Author: mlh1997
Reviews.Content: The spa and roof top pool are very nice. I will definitely return to the hotel and the spa. I was impressed with the rooms, the service, and the food. I also found the gym to be well equiped for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You never have to leave Hard Rock to have a rockin' San Diego time!”
Reviews.Author: Molee42
Reviews.Content: Me and 9 friends stayed in 3 rooms at the Hard Rock for a Bachelorette Party. The Hard Rock is an awesome place to stay. The rooms are cool, cozy, and roomy. We had one suite with two queen beds and two other rooms with double queens. The suite room had stylish couch and bar seats w/ balcony. The TVs in the rooms are awesome! When I checked in they asked what kind of music I wanted playing when I got to the room. That is so cool and I wish all hotels were like that. It was definitely nice to stay at a hotel that involves music in your stay. We checked out their club 207 and they had awesome music. As a hotel guest, we got free VIP entry in to the club. Now why would you want to stay anywhere else? I will definitely consider Hard Rock for any city I visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Theme, Great Service in the Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: joecooper19
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock has one of the simplest, most thorough themes of most boutique hotels. You feel like you're a celebrity, from the great interior design, to the friendliness of the staff, which goes beyond "warm" into the "cool" category, as the hotel employees many young, trendy staff members. The club 207 functions as a great lobby bar and is ideal for mid-week, after-work cocktails. Mary Jane's has delicious upscale diner food, and Nobu's reputation speaks for itself. Had a great time and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Rocks”
Reviews.Author: scubadr1977
Reviews.Content: I will admit I am a Hard Rock fan so predisposed to like the hotel but it truly lived up to my anticipation. Great room, comfortable quiet with modern feel. All the staff we met were friendly and helpful. Wonderful location with great access to convention center and gaslamp district. Will make you feel a little like a Rock star!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: tgreer40
Reviews.Content: I booked several nights here for a conference I was attending across the street. This hotel is great! I felt so comfortable here and I am very picky and germaphobic. My bed was best I have slept in at a hotel, ever! The staff was young but met my every need with a smile. This was impressive alone as I have been wondering lately if anyone teaches the 20 set any customer service. Whatever they do, they have it down. Anything you could ever want was granted and already there. I really liked when I walked into my room that my style of music could be heard. The hotel sits right at the opening of the Gaslamp quarter and you couldn't be at a better place for restaurants, night life, and shopping. The light rail will pick you up and drop you off right outside the front door. You couldn't get any closer to the convention center. Did I mention the Gibsons and Les Pauls you can try out for free? If you want a great time and somewhere you can feel special, please, by all means, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, great location and fun”
Reviews.Author: Golf363636
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock San Diego is a great place to stay for business and pleasure. The location is close to everything around the gas lamp district and the amenities are all you need if you don't want to leave. I have held business functions there and the staff does a great job to make sure everything is perfect and all have a good time. There is allot of choices on room types and they are all fun, clean and fully stocked. Its a great place and very different than the normal hotel chain. A must visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock San Diego Definitely ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: skripbr
Reviews.Content: I was just at the Hard Rock San Diego for a two day conference followed by another day of meetings. I loved everything about the hotel. From the moment you walked in you felt you were a rock star, and they hotel carried that theme throughout everything. The check-in kiosk was cool from the huge LED wall that was playing music videos down to the guitar pick shaped check-in desks (as a Van Halen fan I also notice the Eddie Van Halen themed Fire Extinguisher cabinets). My room very hip with the right amount of space and extremely cool furniture/design features. We had great meals and service the entire time we were in our conference which included very non-elevator music on breaks. It was cool to hear Led Zeppelin and Jimi Hendrix on while networking or grabbing a cup of coffee. Be sure to by stop by Mary Jane’s for a meal. At breakfast you have to get either the sticky buns or the most amazing hash browns every. If you need a dessert, trust the website and get the pot brownie (make it ala mode while you’re there). Lastly, I would be sure to swing by the roof top pool. I was only there for business, but it was fun to meet up with colleagues there and grab a drink outside where we could enjoy the great beautiful San Diego weather. The hotel location was perfect too, right in the Gaslamp District allowed us to walk anywhere we need to grab dinner after we were done for the day. If you’re a baseball fan it was right next to the Padres stadium too. Not sure when I will be in Sand Diego next but I will definitely plan to saty there, and will be sure to look up a Hard Rock Hotel wherever I travel to next.

Reviews.Title: “Great for fun, decent for work”
Reviews.Author: ChristianErickson
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. I almost gave it a 4 because it did not have a good work area for my laptop and work stuff. Since I was here on business (the conference was at the hotel) I needed to get things done. The people are great and worked to make sure my stay was good. I certainly recommend this hotel. If you want to see my room visit me on YouTube (ChristianEricksonMBA) or this link: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tjiOw581vA0

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: chuckybucks
Reviews.Content: We had several choices as to where to go for our romantic weekend but the Hard Rock kept popping up in our choices (Hard Rock Las Vegas came in a very close second!) even though we live in the same city. We stayed there for Valentines Day weekend and had a fantastic time. This was not our first time staying at the Hard Rock. My wife and I go there once a year to get away from the kids and relax. They never disappoint at the Hard Rock. The service is always top notch and they seem to take pride in their jobs, which I feel is seriously lacking at most hotels. On top of the excellent service provided your walking distance to everything downtown San Diego, if you so chose to venture out. We prefer being pampered and hanging in the hotel, probably because we are from San Diego after all. But I recommend a trip here at least once if you are visiting San Diego, and if you're from SD it is a great stay-cation!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service for Business”
Reviews.Author: saragirl5515
Reviews.Content: Our company hosted a conference at the Hard Rock in San Diego and from the very beginning, the service was great! From planning the venue, to recieving the final bill everyone was fantastic! This is such a change to some other hotel brands we have worked with in the past. They made us feel like the success of our conference was important to them. The hotel was in a great location, the rooms were nice, and overall just a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SYNTST
Reviews.Content: If you are attending a convention it is ideal to the Convention center, and walking distance to the entire Gaslamp district. Best roof top pool, bar and night life in town.

Reviews.Title: “A++”
Reviews.Author: sushimaan
Reviews.Content: The strategic location is next to the Gaslamp Quarter and just across the street from the convention center. I arrived to a well staffed crew at the front door and easily and swiftly checked in with a friendly and helpful front desk attendant. The lobby, room and all facilities were very clean and contemporary. I ate at Nobu and MaryJanes. I attended parties at 207 and at Float. The food at Nobu rocked. Maryjanes service was very good but my breakfast was unimaginative and plain. The parties rocked also. Noise in the evening was a non-issue. I slept like a baby on the comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rocks completely ROCKS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ScooterUnit
Reviews.Content: The hotel far exceeded my expectations. Besides feeling like Frank Sinatra may stroll through the room at any moment (kinda creepy since he's dead, and I was a female in the room alone), but I think you get the idea of the room just being beyond cool! The staff also was exceptional -- from check-in to check-out, the level of customer service was outstanding! My husband has an upcoming conference in November, 2011. I've told him to seriously consider the Hard Rock instead of the "sponsor" hotel, just because my own experience was so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: spp4466
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Rocks! This is my second stay at a Hard Rock and they keep out doing themselves. Its a very cool, comfortable hotel in the heart of San Diego central to EVERYTHING. Try MaryJanes for breakfast best Cheese Blintz's I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Rock On Hard Rock Hotel SD!”
Reviews.Author: racmania
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock in San Diego, and must say I loved the hotel's ambience and service! There were little things like at reception, they ask what type of rock you like and when entering the room, it'll play your type of music! The TV when you turn it on also welcomes you by name (little thing but still neat). The rooms are very comfy and stylish. The beds are comfy. The area is good, but a mix of the very poor with the trendy class (restaurants, bars, etc). Mary Jane's offered great and LARGE breakfasts to satisfy any needs. During the weekend, the room I was booked in near the train/convention centre view was quite loud at night (bar on the main floor was pounding music till the wee hours). The next day I asked for a room switch and the woman with wavy/curly blonde hair at the front desk (also known as "Ground Control") deserves commendation. She was very understanding, explained the situation, and moved me into a larger suite higher up and on the other side of the building without charge. The suite was awesome, with a patio to enjoy the evenings to boot! Anyways, I forgot her name, but you rock! Thanks Hard Rock SD!

Reviews.Title: “The place to be..hottest place in SD.”
Reviews.Author: PVjohn77
Reviews.Content: First stay at Hard Rock SD was back in March 2010 and was a blast. I went to Nobu, great sushi, spent time at Float (the pool) . The hotel is central to many things in Downtown San Diego. Beyond that I stayed at a W hotel which was horrible compared to Hard Rock, since then I went back in December and will always stay at Hard Rock when visiting SD in teh future.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Stylish Hotel in the Heart of the Action”
Reviews.Author: Paco1paco
Reviews.Content: Very new hotel (3 years old apparently) that is right at the entrance to the gaslamp district. The hotel was overall an amazing experience. Stayed for 4 days during a conference and had a blast. Experience has definitely changed my perspective on Hard Rock hotels and will now be looking for them to stay at in other cities. Amazing modern hotel, very clean, very fun party atmosphere. We had the most basic room you could get and were still very pleased. Overall give it high marks with the exception of sleep quality. The reason I rated sleep quality very low is due to the proximity to the train tracks (brutally close to passenger and freight trains who blow their horn regularly throughout the evening) and our room was right above bar 207 in the hotel which turns into a night club. Base was so loud that it would shake the room until 2 am. That being said you get what you pay for as we got a great deal on the hotel so cannot complain. Would definitely recommend to others seeking a cool hotel in a great location. Gaslamp district is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Zeus27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 week. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The room was clean and very nice. Shower was excellent! The bed was very comfortable, bedsheets were soft and pillows were very comfortable. A lot of nice extras; pillowcase had embroidered guitar on it; toilet paper has a guitar sticker. It made you feel special! MaryJane's restaurant was excellent; lots of nice people serving. Food was very good. THe computer room was aweseome it was clean and no loitering. I felt very safe and lots of fun trivia on the walls along with pictures. I rate it as one of the best places to stay. It really left a good impression on me. I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a fun, clean, comfortable and memorable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock San Diego really rocks!”
Reviews.Author: hthompson94
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the world in my job, and was recently in San Diego for a trade show. My stay at the Hard Rock was as good an experience as I've had, in 4 and 5 star hotels. The hotel staff was very friendly, incredibly responsive, and the atmosphere, location, and food were outstanding. The rooms are exceptional, as is the overall presentation of the hotel. Hard to beat the location, too, right at the edge of the SD Gaslamp District. I would highly recommend this hotel to any occasional or experienced travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for businesspeople that also like to have fun”
Reviews.Author: 1SRV
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for business meetings. I have stayed at a lot of hotels around it, but I guess because I associated the Hard Rock Hotel with the one in Vegas, I dismissed this one for business. Boy was I wrong. As a business traveler, the two things I liked most about my stay is 1) convenience of everything, and 2) efficiency. The wifi was reliable and fast. It was SUPER easy to plug in all of my gizmos and gadgets. No breaking a lamp or my back by moving a huge bed! That, I'll admit, was the thing I was most excited about. The radio stations were great and allowed me not to watch the same Sportscenter highlight 6X in one day. The room service came in 15 minutes. 207, their main bar, had great service. A lot friendlier than I expected for being such a hipster joint. The service overall was excellent. It is located at the beginning of gaslamp, which has everything at your disposal, but you're not in thick of it - which can get really loud, especially if there is a huge convention or during the summer. There was some usualy street noise, but that's because I had my window open. I'll definitely by staying at this hotel next time I'm in town. The only bad thing about the hotel is the beer selection. San Diego is one of the best beer towns in the world (yes, I said it) and they don't have one handle or bottle from San Diego. That has to change!

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Perfection”
Reviews.Author: glaslipper
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Hard Rock Hotel expecting a cookie cutter, trendy, impersonal hotel. Boy was I wrong! I've traveled all over the world staying in upscale boutique hotels and spas. I'm a very picky traveler. I expect great service, clean upscale rooms and great food. Hard Rock San Diego exceeded my expectations. The service was impeccable. Thank you Eli and the staff for taking good care of us. Never have I had such good service. Other hotels should send their staff to see how a hotel should run. I loved the room. The attention to the design is terrific; even down to the Swiss type shower heads. The room service breakfast was heavenly and I could not believe how quickly the food came. I look forward to coming back to San Diego to be pampered again at the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “The location is amazing, the hotel is fantastic and Nobu offers sushi!”
Reviews.Author: SpokanePamS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right at the entrance to the Gaslamp District and directly across the street from the convention center. They have a patio on the fourth floor that overlooks the hotels and restaurants on that street. It is a great place. Really fun!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: cheryl_posthuma
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego for a convention in January 2011. I took my 19 year old daughter with me so she could enjoy the city. The hotel that was blocked for the convention was full so they referred me to the Hard Rock. Although I thought it was going to be above my budget, I gave them a call. The Hard Rock was affordable so I happily booked the room. I liked the fact that Hard Rock sent me info about San Diego. Also suggested I book their restaurants ahead of time to make sure I get in since they are so popular. Well, it was my niece's birthday and not knowing what she wanted to eat or where, the Hard Rock was right, they were booked. So the concierge really helped by calling another restaurant, having us put on their list so we received priority seating when we arrived. That was the first time I've had that kind of service. My daughter enjoyed the city while I was at the convention. Will totally recommend the Hard Rock and return as a customer. They will be my first choice when I travel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to hang out in or go into the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: peter1sarge
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference that was perfectly managed. Great restaurants on site (Nobu, MaryJane's, 207) and great location in GasLamp zone.

Reviews.Title: “The stay at the Hard Rock was awesome, I didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: wayjayfpe
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and the staff was very friendly. Out of all the guest, I have no idea how they remembered my name. I loved the room, the TV and the shower were kickin. The room was very quiet and private. It Hard Rock is located right in mix of the Gaslamp Quarter. I didn't need a car to go anywhere and it's located in a spot very close to the train. The dining service at the Mary Jane was excellent. I loved all the memorabilia and the music in the elevator lobby. And, the Float, forget about it; it was the bomb! The thing I liked least is I didn't see any Rock Stars, bad timing on my part! LOL!

Reviews.Title: “My stay rocked, thanks hard rock”
Reviews.Author: HardrockRocks
Reviews.Content: It was birthday weekend so I wanted tio have a memorable night, and the hard rock definitely took care of that, the hard rock rocks

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: okld4ever
Reviews.Content: Service was very friendly and accomodating, the room was amazing and the all of the venues were very nice. My and friends and I went out to party and we all had a great time! Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock is a fun hotel that is also appropriate for business travel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler77546
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock San Diego was one of the best hotel experiences I have had. The service was good, the rooms were kept very tidy, and the location is in the heart of the Gaslamp district. The only problem is that if you happen to stay on certain floors, I imagine you would be able to hear the bars/clubs within the club itself, however, this wasn't much of an issue for me. My room did happen to be by an elevator though and all excited young people were loud when leaving their rooms. Perhaps a better policy asking guests to keep their noise level down especially when partying would help in regards to that but overall, after folks passed by, I got excellent sleep in a beautiful room overlooking the bay. It was a great experience and I highly recommend it to anyone who attends a conference at the San Diego convention center or to any tourists just there to have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Just live it up”
Reviews.Author: leidown
Reviews.Content: A great hotel from the beginning to the end. The staff throughout the hotel go out of their way to provide an amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Hotel makes it easy to feel like a rock star”
Reviews.Author: kboostrom
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best service, room and rock memorabilia I've ever encountered. Located in the heart of the Gas Lamp district in San Diego, the Hard Rock in the perfect location. Situated on the San Diego Bay, the views were stunning and the food and drink - well it was just great.

Reviews.Title: “It's where the Dolls and I have fun!!!”
Reviews.Author: VegasEd
Reviews.Content: I enjoy coming down to San Diego and the Hard Rock makes it an even better visit. I come down to see a group of lovely ladies and we hit the town. What's nice is the location of the Rock and the fact they have Nobu and 207 right in the building! Let's not forget Mary Jane's after a night of drinking. haha The rooms are excellent and the beds are great to catch some sleep in. I'll always stay at the Rock when I visit SD!

Reviews.Title: “room with a view”
Reviews.Author: robbiegirl4
Reviews.Content: went just for an overnight getaway with friends and had a great time. everyone was super friendly from the bell guy to the front desk to the super helpful concierge. all were very pleasant and made sure we had a great experience. the hotel is sleek and modern. the room was awesome with a great view and even a plug for an ipod on the tv. we enjoyed relaxing in the jacuzzi and happy hour drinks at nobu. after. after a night around downtown we enjoyed a late night snack at mary janes. great overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect night on the town”
Reviews.Author: davidperloff
Reviews.Content: Steps to everything in downtown, with lots of reasons not to leave the hotel. Great food, fun vibe, friendly staff...dark window coverings in the suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: jabadi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Hard Rock Suite. It had a small "lounge" area and a balcony, the room was great, and the location is amazing! room was very clean and price is very competitive!

Reviews.Title: “It rocked!”
Reviews.Author: miamigirl_9
Reviews.Content: Excellent service; chic, comfortable rooms; and the perfect location for walking to the convention center, Petco, and Gaslamp District. Mary Jane's and Nobu are in the hotel if you don't feel like leaving and Nobu was so good we went two nights in a row.

Reviews.Title: “Too clever by half”
Reviews.Author: Poisonwells
Reviews.Content: You'll go potty with delight if you like your exposed glass encased toilet and shower in the middle of your suite so that you can share the pleasures of every bodily function, sound and smell with your partner and anyone else who is visiting your suite for a glass of champagne. The end corners of the beds have been padded to stop you drawing blood from your shins as you inadvertently trip over the sharp end, cleverly camouflaged as part of the carpet. Some of the padding is getting a little worn from use. Perhaps it's a good idea that the pads are brown. It conceals the blod stains?o It might be a little crass to call the hotel the Hard Knock Hotel but the interior designer has certainly left plenty of hard edges and sharp corners built into the design of the rooms. The lifts to the resident floors are operated by room key card but are situated some way from the reception area. From experience there it would seem as though lack of security or obvious monitoring could pose a danger to hotel guests from rowdy non resident elements entering the lifts and wanting to get off 'at the same floor ' . The concepts involved in this hotel might be clever but the reality succeeds only in rivalling an airport hotel. Pictures of pop stars on the walls should not delude the occasionally present receptionist to act as a prima donna. Trays of Kit Kat, Altoids and M&Ms in the room only serve to remind one that there is probably a motel chain near the convention centre where one can find the same snack in a equivalent surrounding and probably with cheaper Wi Fi as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel-made the trip amazing!”
Reviews.Author: megan028
Reviews.Content: The hard rock hotel in san diego is one of if not the best hotels I have stayed at,and I stay at hotels often for business.This hotel has it all-great atmosphere,nightlife,restaurants,great gym and spa,and a friendly staff.And it literally is on one of the best streets in san diego!Right in the middle of the Gaslamp District with plenty of shopping,restaurants,and bars.I definitly recommend this hotel anyone staying in san diego,it is beyond worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hard Rock Hotel San Diego”
Reviews.Author: MicheleCjazz
Reviews.Content: If you are seeking a stylish hotel in downtown San Diego for business or pleasure I highly recommend the Hard Rock Hotel. This service oriented property goes the extra mile for its guests. Each time I stay I am pleasantly surprised at how well I am treated by the Hard Rock staff, and I appreciate the creative touches like personalized music in the rooms. The hotel has a fun, upbeat vibe which puts you in a great mood. This property has outstanding amenities, a roof top pool & jacuzzi, well equipt gym, cocktail lounges, 2 terrific restaurants including Nobu Sushi which is so delicious and fun, why go anywhere else?! I have found my experience at this property to be one of the best yet to enjoy for personal or business.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grifter21
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hard Rock. Incredible staff and ultra-hip venues. Plush rooms with all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Unruly guests”
Reviews.Author: cgr
Reviews.Content: The rooms are excellent, well laid out, clean and highly functional for the business traveller. Though wireless is paid, not free, I found that it worked well. Amenities are good. Pool is small, and outdoor, but heated; there are no changing rooms on the pool deck. The gym is also small but functional with quality equipment. The only negative feedback I'd share is that the when I came to check in, the noise in the lobby from ambient music was so loud I had to shout to be heard. Similarly, there were many unruly guests who apparently felt the need to continue their parties in the hotel corridors, leading to a repeatedly interrupted sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Service”
Reviews.Author: SuperMANNxxD
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the absolute best place I've stayed at in years!!! The service, the room, the location, the club, EVERYTHING!! I am going to stay here a much as possible. Also, the hotel is filled with photos and items from many our the world's biggest music artist. Just walking around the hotel and looking at it all was an adventure. LOVE YOU HARD ROCK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Suite was a great birthday treat!”
Reviews.Author: NDAshley
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my birthday, me and my girlfriends headed down to San Diego to enjoy some partying at the Gaslamp. I booked the Queen Hard Rock Suite on travelocity for a great price of $185 (the room usually retails for $319 or so on Saturday nights!) We bypassed the insane $35 valet charge at the hotel and parked for $17 across the street (literally about 20 second from the hotel and half the price!) The desk agent was super sweet and helpful and we recieved great customer service from everyone at the hotel-- it's so different than the Hard Rock in vegas, where everyone that works there thinks they're better than you. The San Diego staff was great! Our Queen Suite was smaller than I expected but still nice. (However, if I had paid over $300 for it I would have been sick! Totally worth $185, totally NOT worth $300-$350!) The good: Super comfy beds, unique shower that was separate from the toliet, a GREAT view from our huge balcony and a nice lounge area that we used to get ready to go out in. Despite it being smaller than expected, it was still big enough for 4 girls to stay in without being cramped. We loved MaryJane's inside the hotel...what's better at 3 am than veggie chili fries?! Yum! The bad: The suite had no fridge....seriously? You get a fridge in your room at the Days Inn! For the price of the suite, they could have stuck a mini fridge somewhere in there! There's really no sink area or bathroom area to speak of in this suite so there's nowhere to get ready. We used the cocktail bar. Also, it's a little noisy because you're literally over the main street of Downtown, but who comes to Hard Rock to sleep?! Overall, great hotel with a great atmosphere and staff! I'd be back if I could find a discounted rate again!

Reviews.Title: “Rockstar staff”
Reviews.Author: Drcasio
Reviews.Content: I had the fortunate experience of having to stay in San Diego for 7 days for a conference. I opted for the Hard Rock as I travel a bit and I wanted something different from the normal corporate hotels and I can safely say the Hard Rock offered this. From the friendly check in staff to the excellent waiting staff in Mary Janes everyone during my week stay was amazing and couldn't do enough, which really enhanced my stay, especially since I was travelling on business alone and from the UK. I think I did everything that the hotel had to offer from eating at Nobu (excellent) to partying at the 207 and Float. I had room 1218 which had amazing views of the bay and convention centre, the only slight issue I had was with the aircon, which didn't seem to cool the room down, but being terribly english I didn't mind as I put it down to the amount of glass and the sun on the extensive windows plus I was out all the time ;) My floor also had a massive picture of the sex pistols in the lift area which I loved as it reminded me of home. The pool area was very modern, very clean and the pool itself was a refreshing respite when the sun did pop out. All is all I would stay in the Hard Rock again and this hotel with it's top location, variety of excellent eating at reasonable prices, ultra amazing staff and laid back vibe is up in my top 5 hotels in the world. All in all I would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeslieStarr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel San Diego for my 30th birthday. The service was amazing, they really did make us feel like celebrities. My husband worked closely with the concierge to plan some surprises for me. The concierge really did go out of her way to do everything possible to make our stay perfect. They even sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne to our room for my birthday. We stayed in the King suite and it was beautiful and incredibly comfortable. Although we live in San Diego we would not hesitate to stay here the next time we want to celebrate something.

Reviews.Title: “Rock On....”
Reviews.Author: powderruns
Reviews.Content: Fourth time staying at the Hard Rock San Diego, right in the heart of Gaslamp, walking distance to great restaurants, nightlife and shopping, easy to get around the city from the hotel...rooms are modern and clean , all staff are friendly and supportive, and Mary Janes cafe on the ground floor has fantastic inexpensive meals. I'll always come back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: LaurieVH
Reviews.Content: My friends and I actually live in San Diego but we wanted a cool, fun place to stay on a night out celebrating our graduation. The Hard Rock was the PERFECT place to stay. The moment we stepped into the hotel lobby it was like we were on instant vacation. The suite we had was hip and cool and also comfortable and relaxed. We thoroughly enjoyed every moment of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unique vibe in a fun and accessible area in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kt206
Reviews.Content: For any big music fan and/or avid Rolling Stone reader, this hotel is much more fun in theme and spirit than your typical chain. My two-night stay was short and I was unable to take advantage of the outdoor pool and bar area, but it looked awesome. Would definitely love to return there for a party in the near future. The location is great, and the service was wonderful. Any help we needed with the area, any questions we had, random requests were all met with great enthusiasm. Everything was very easy. The gym was also well equipped and clean, good size during peak hours. The room was great, we actually hung out in our room for quite awhile before going out. Internet was completely reliable, everything was in full working order. When you check in you get a card sleeve that provides a code to download 1 of 3 Hard Rock playlists on iTunes. I thought that was fun and innovative, and it was actually good music rather than poor selections they were trying to force on you for some sponsorship deal or something. Overall, great stay and I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cool Hotel, Excellent Staff, Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: IITK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel San Diego during Christmas week and enjoyed each and every minute of our stay. It was great value for the money we spent and the location could not be any better (almost all San Diego attractions are within 5 to 10 miles or so). I was a bit concerned about the noise level in the hotel reading all the reviews and so I reached out to the hotel staff regarding this issue before the visit and they were kind enough to put us on a higher floor away from the noise. Also after two days we were upgraded to a Suite and that was good but not that great esp I feel the suites here do not offer that much more. Good dining options, Maryjane's is good for breakfast etc and Nobu is great esp during happy hours. Parking is expensive but there is a parking garage right next door which is quite economical. Overall two thumbs up for the hotel and its staff, do not be worried by the negative reviews, if you have a concern e.g. noise level etc then let it be known before the trip and I am sure the staff will address it effectively.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel really Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: dpmo97
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Hard Rock for New Years, and would stay again. The Gas Lamp Quarter has everything we wanted and more. The Hard Rock was confortable and fun, we have told our friends how great the parties were on New Years, and that we want them all to come back with us next year. The room was trendy and confortable, quiet inside, but walk out the door for all the shopping and nightlife you want. Great views, and love the juliet balconies. Thanks for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the vibe!”
Reviews.Author: SD_RchoCuc
Reviews.Content: This is truly a cool place to stay if you're into music. A totally different feel and look, not like any hotel I've seen. The staff is friendly and helpful but not overly peppy. The room was well done and the media center had everything we needed. Valet parking only which is to be expected in any downtown area, but it's not cheap. Overall, I would have to say we spent our money wisely with the Hard Rock. If you've never been and you love music, check it out ;) And try the 207 if you dare. Great drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for everything in the Gaslamp for a young hip couple/group”
Reviews.Author: RobinM_skibum
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for a younger couple or individual or even a young family with kids. Great location very centrally located to everything in the Gaslamp and also the waterfront in San Diego. The rooms were nicely decorated and very modern. The shower was AMAZING! My favorite part of our room. Pluses: 1. Location, location, location! 2. Happening disco/bar downstairs 3. Great rooms 4. Amazing shower 5. Great breakfast restaurant right in the hotel. Minuses: 1. Parking. Only had valet service outside which was VERY expensive, or you had to search for a parking structure. 2. Pretty loud at night when the disco was going on, but if you like a hip place not a negative. 3. No coffee first thing in the morning on the weekend. The staff all seemed to stay up late and not ready to go until 10am which was very weird, but it appears that this was their standard...at least on the entire weekend we were there. Overall service as pretty good except the fact that the mornings seemed to start very late for them. We are morning people so that part was odd for us at a hotel, but we just walked to a fabulous restaurant in the gaslmap for breakfast and had our coffee there.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious fun-- bring something cute to wear at night”
Reviews.Author: yoadriennec
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock San Diego is a wonderful place to stay. The staff very kindly anticipate your needs (when I checked in I had a cake with me. They asked if they could store it for me and if there was a particular temperature that I'd prefer). Housekeeping went above and beyond when I had requests. The concierge was the best I've ever come across. There are great options within the hotel a night club, casual dining, and fine dining. Even the ppv movies were exceptional. The Hard Rock is located in a great part of town, amid hundreds of great restaurants and fun shopping. I'll be staying there again for a convention next summer (ComicCon). It's a great place to hang out, not just for coming and going. The rate per night was very low and reasonable given the high quality of the hotel. I stayed through Christmas and was surprised to get such a good rate. The only negative was the $17/day in-charge fees, which kind of add up. However, with the fee comes free wi-fi and phone calls. The charge won't hold me back from returning. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel rocks!”
Reviews.Author: jcarringtonhall
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen by my 17 year old daughter, but we all had a great time. We loved that we could each select the music for our rooms. Every employee that we encountered was friendly and helpful. Lisa, the manicurist in the RockSpa, was a delight and full of local information. Our package included a $50 daily credit per room, so we breakfast each day in MaryJane's. Rich was our waiter both times. He has a great memory for each customer's wants and has a great story to tell of attending the Hard Rock Festival in London. The in-house music channels were fun to watch, especially while working out in the gym. We plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: SDRivergirl
Reviews.Content: I am from San Diego and have stayed in this hotel a couple of times. The last time was for a weekend of fun and boy did we have a great time! It is a hip place and there is always something fun going on. If you are from San Diego and looking for a place to stay and have fun Downtown, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staycation!!!”
Reviews.Author: tksmith2
Reviews.Content: We had a awesome time at the Hard Rock Hotel San Diego last Monday! We decided to take a little 24 hour getaway between xmas and new year, realizing we did not have much time we decided to take full advantage what the Hard Rock had to offer. We arrived early and were very pleased they had our room ready to go. We headed down for lunch at Marryjane's (had the veggie nachos...soooo good). After that we spent some time in the gaslamp district and horton plaza which is all within walking distance. When we got back to our room we enjoyed the awesome rain shower in the very stylish bathroom and then headed downstairs to Nobu for dinner. Our server and her team at Nobu provided probably the best service we have ever had at a restaurant, it was perfect, not too much and everything was always filled, cleaned or addressed, just incredible! You have to try the Pina Martini...yummmmy! After dinner we walked across the lobby to 207 for a night cap (we had Ruby Tuesday Martini...very good and fresh) and to relax a bit then back up to the room where we slept like babies! The next morning we went down again to Marryjane's for breakfast (which is my favorite place to have breakfast anywhere) and they did not disappoint the 3 egg omlett and their special potatoes are to die for (I am getting hungry just writting about it :o) Overall Awesome experience and we will be back for sure!!! Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Needed.”
Reviews.Author: mblovsks
Reviews.Content: In a situation where we needed just the right atmosphere for our family at that time. It was perfect. The service was excellent. The valet was especially good, we've stayed downtown before, and had to wait forever for the valet to bring our vehicle. Thank you Hard Rock Hotel San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Getaway from it All”
Reviews.Author: SWS316
Reviews.Content: Had a great overnighter with hubby for his birthday. This place is so fun and hip and an escape from the reality of life. Very comfortable bed and bath in the standard room. Love that they ask you your music preference and the spa products in the bathroom. Very good service. We like breakfast at MaryJane's too.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Service to beat during Xmas”
Reviews.Author: Debblues
Reviews.Content: My mom and I traveled to SD to spend the Xmas holiday with extended family who live locally. Our last trip to an SD hotel was horrific (Andaz aka The Ivy) so finding a hotel my mother would feel very comfortable in, was challenging to say the least. I suggested several hotels (Hard Rock being one, as my company held a large event and have previous booke many rooms here during Comic-Con) she settled on The Hard Rock. I decided to surprise my mom with a suite upgrade and massage gift card at arrival and the staff whom I spoke with (Janelle) were fantastic and very attentive. Service in the VIP area (Chris & "E") when my mom arrived was awesome and she treated amazingly. One damper When she got to her suite it had not been cleaned completely. Which is a big no no. When she called house keeping they came immediately and when she complained to the front desk they were mortified and personally made sure the room was spotless. Tho, the living room area (Rm#1260)had a faint smell of mildew/mold near the shower. Which I didn't bring up, as I didn't want to be the pain in the butt guests. Upon my arrival everyone was very friendly and VERY service oriented and that attitude continued during my drama of losing my iPhone (between valet and the room my) Everyone from the bells, valet, VIP, security and the front desk staff was awesome in helping me to hopefully locate my phone, which never turned up. The staff went above and beyond in searching for it and stayed very patient when still the next day we continued asking the staff about phone. VIP continued to be extremely nice and hit home the type of service my mother is used to and expects. Room: The beds and pillows were beyond comfortable. Overall we were very comfortable and very happy with the service and we would 100% stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving nightmare”
Reviews.Author: DaSpazz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in on Thanksgiving day, Nov,.25 2010. First off, valet costs $35 (there is no self-parking at the hotel)! I asked if I could pay cash for the room since I had just spent two weeks in Hawaii and did not want to run up the credit card so I left a cash deposit at check-in. I also then discovered that they charge a $17 resort fee for use of the internet, gym and pool. Even though I told them we were not going to use these services I was told we had to pay it. I stopped in at their restaurant, Mary Jane's and stood at the bar to get a drink for the room. I sat at the bar for 20 minutes and no one helped me so I went to the room to join my wife. I got to our king suite and was suprised by how small the room. Online, the room was described as a three room suite but it was much smaller. I turned on both TVs and one was working and on the other was nothing but static. I wanted to check out the halo lights behind the bed but they did not work so I called the front desk to report the tv and the halo lights they said they would have the engineer fix the problem. I went downstairs to go back to Mary Jane's and noted that there was strong odor of vomit near the elevators (my wife smelled it as well). We smelled it every time we went out. I again tried to get a drink.at Mary Jane's and this time after 10 minutes a waiter told the bar was not serving even though two people were there having a drink. My wife walked in the bar at that time so we walked over to the Omni hotel for a drink in their bar. Later that night when we got back to the hotel after a great Thanksgiving dinner at McCormick & Schmick's at the Omni Hotel we went to our room. The TV was still fuzzy but the bed halo lights were on with a note saying it had been fixed. Now it was late and time for bed and guess what? The extremely bright halo lights now would not turnoff behind the bed! After trying to sleep without success we called the front desk at 2:30 a.m. They said an engineer would be ip to fix the light. He never showed. My wife and I got no sleep that night. Upon checkout they told us we had a credit balance due to us. Then the front desk said they do not give cash refunds and they need my credit card to put on the money due to me. The front desk said nothing of this upon check in. I have contacted the manager directly to report my disappointment with our stay. All I received back was an e-mail stating he was sorry the experience was less than stellar and to let us know if we were ever back in the hotel again. He knows we are from the San Diego area and made no effort to make an offer for us to come back or anything. I would expect this response from a one-star hotel, but not a four-star hotel like the Hard Rock. My wife and I are gonig back to downtown San Diego soon and will be staying at the Omni where I am a platinum member and have had great service. The sign of a four-star hotel is what they do when something goes wrong not when all is good. This hotel fell short in every way. Stay here if you want a dirty, horrible hotel that is poorly managed. We were very disappointed by the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Rocked my stay”
Reviews.Author: Devithm
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock was awesome! I have stayed at many hotels for business but this hotel in downtown San Diego made my trip pleasureable. From the time I entered my room they had Heavy metal playing for me. (My favorite kind of music, they have your taste of music playing befoe you get to your room). I never wanted to leave the shower, i loved the rain shower heads. They had everythnig I needed in the roomand more. The beds were soft and the down comforter made me feel like I was at home.
