I can’t say anything about weekend stays as we weren’t there.

Reviews.Title: “Grungy”
Reviews.Author: nerdlywed
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at this hotel while attending an event at the convention center, with some friends who stayed longer. The day we arrived, the rooms were not cleaned. After two complaints to the front desk, someone was sent to clean- in our room they made the beds and lined up the minibar items. In the other room they didn't even bother to make the beds! The mouthwash provided had been previously used... The hotel seemed to be banking on a name and a nice lobby rather than good service- the diner was slow and brought out the wrong items (we hadn't received the correct food by the end of the meal, just had it taken off the bill in the end), the valet parking was beyond slow, even though they seemed to have plenty of glowering staff standing about at all times. Had to call down multiple times for bag service when we left. At a lower price, who would care about the little things, but this wasn't a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great vibe”
Reviews.Author: Groce
Reviews.Content: Let me preface by stating that this was my first trip to San Diego (w/ wife - both in our 30s/no kids) and stayed for a week. It's hard to separate the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego from the neighborhood it is in: Gaslamp. The hotel basically anchors the entrance to the Gaslamp District (comprised of hotels, restaurants, bars and shops too numerous to mention) and reflects the general atmosphere. On the weekends, HRH is a party place - period. It is loud, crowded and energentic. During the week, it is laidback and has a lot of contemporary charm. My wife and I used the weekends to let loose and the weekdays to move about the city for some sightseeing; it worked perfectly at the HRH. Being a registered guest at the hotel gets you on a pseudo-VIP list to the hotel's clubs on Friday/Saturday and to the Sunday Invervention pool party on Sunday afternoon. These events are very pretentious but fun (probably more so with a group of friends). For sightseeing, the location at the "foot" of the Gaslamp District is perfect. Not only is Petco Park right next door, 2 very user-friendly city MTS trolleys are within walking distance. Knowing what I know now, I could easily get to every major sightseeing destination in San Diego using the trolley system and the 2 major sightseeing transportation companies (one is a trolley/other is a double-decker bus) without a car. As for general hotel service/amenities, HRH follows the general trend I felt in the city itself: a) service is average and nobody really puts forth much extra effort and b) prices are on the expensive side. We did appreciate our housekeeping crew - their customer service was the best of any we received in San Diego (including all restaurants, bars, tours, etc...). The room itself was a bit odd though. We had a King Suite (with a great balcony). However, the layout of the room is not very practical and the fact that the bathroom had sort of an "open air" concept will be off-putting to some. Finally, valet parking in too high at $30 per day but seems to be competitive with the area. I would definitely stay at HRH again and would suggest it to friends. However, it is not for everyone. The place is, again, full of energy (i.e. noisy, young crowd) and not concerned about making you feel at home (on purpose, I would assume) as some hotels do. I think if people understand what the place is about before going, the experience will be a positive one.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel - Excelelnt Hotel - With some down sides”
Reviews.Author: Woody_000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hard Rock for 2 nights after is was at a conference at another hotel for the week. On first entering the Hotel you are greeted with the very impressive, very modern lobby. The whole place just exudes "Cool and Trendy" Nothing about the hotel is mediocre in looks or appearance, the rooms are very nice indeed with large LCD's in the rooms and very nice entertainment and movie selection and some cool ports you plug you gadgets into buitl into the wall. The shower is very cool, it has a rain type shower from above and another that comes at you from the side. The pool is very nice with some cool cabana's that you can rent and some very nice seeting and some beds you can lie on and get some sun. The hotel is very busy and you have to book to get into the bars even if you are staying in the hotel but are guaranteed to get in if you book before 6pm at night with the concierge. The crowd around the bars can be a bit pretentious but if you don't care its a cool place to hangout and have some fun. We stayed on the first floor and we had an early flight but went to bed at 2am but it was still very noisy from the bar bellow until well after that. All in all its a very nice hotel and i would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Worste treatment ever at a hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpwaverider
Reviews.Content: Dear Hard Rock, On July 4th, we had a terrible stay. The only time that we weren’t treated poorly was the first fifteen minutes we were there. We went to our rooms, got changed, and went down to the pool. We get there and immediately start getting treated as if we were outsiders of the hotel. We get to the pool and there are very few places to sit but we got there early so we found a spot, we began to walk over to it, and the pool staff stop us and ask for our names and hotel number, etc. They didn’t believe us, we showed them our room key, but they wanted to check at the front desk. By the time they cleared that we were staying there, someone had gotten to the chairs and now we had no where to sit around the pool. So, we had to sit in a different section from the pool. Then, I asked one of the staff members if there were different sections of the pool because I was told there was, he responded “no just this section and there’s a lawn area by the pool” and just walked away as I was still talking to him.(which was very rude). The hotel wasn’t even really that busy or crowded for a fourth of July weekend which is odd, but there was no reason for such rude behavior and it was very unexplainable. Then all of the staff kept giving us attitude. We would tip our waitress and she just grabbed the money and walked away (I have never seen someone so unappreciative for a tip and this happened more than once with her). We tried to walk back to the pool and then they wouldn’t let us, without a wristband. (If we needed a wristband from the beginning, they should have given us one when they allowed us into the pool, and even after when they checked our names under the hotel. I was just so upset so I wanted to speak to a manager, and I went to ask the guy who walked away from me while I was still talking to him, what his name was. He told me his first name, Chris, and I asked for his last and he rudely responded “why?” I explained that I thought it was very rude for him to walk away while I was still talking…he said “I don’t know what you are talking about, you must be thinking of a different person.” I told him that I wasn’t the only one that witnessed it; my fiancé was right next to me. He said, “oh well I thought you were done talking.” (Now he knew we had the conversation where 30 seconds before he acted like I was mistaking him for some other rude staff member) So, I finally found the pool manager Oliver Kroll (the hotel manager said I had to go through the pool manager) and began telling him, how upset I was at how ALL of his staff were treating us. He apologized and offered us a bottle of champagne. I refused and told him that I didn’t want anything; I just wanted him to talk to his staff so the rest of the day would be somewhat enjoyable. He still insisted on a round of drink, I still said that I didn’t want anything more than him talking to his entire staff to change the rude attitudes. He sent a round of drinks anyway. 30 minutes later I laid down to suntan and closed my eyes, and a different rude staff member came by and tapped me and said “ you cant close your eyes.” I asked why and he rudely answered “you can’t close your eyes, it is a liability.” (I have never heard of that, but I listened and got up). Then I started tanning with my glasses on, and he came up to me twice to see if my eyes were open which they were). We had finally had enough and called it an early day and went back to the room. We had hoped that the rude staff ended at the pool area, but that was not the case. We went to try and see fireworks at around 8:45 in the pool area and my fiancé and I went in with shorts 5 minutes before my friend Derrick. When Derrick tried to walk to the pool, he was stopped by staff saying that he was not allowed to enter with shorts on. He said that his party just walked in with shorts, the guy began arguing with him telling him he wouldn’t be allowed to pass and called his staff members for them to help with situation. Then we had enough, we went to the hotel manager Steven Goldberg and he apologized offering us dinner and drinks, we said we didn’t want anything, we want to check out and want to be refunded. He told me to go on and do what I was going to do (we were going to dinner at a restaurant nearby) and he said he will talk to someone higher than him, and that he will call me and make sure I am taken care of. (He definitely did this so he would not have to deal with him face to face and he could just tell me over the phone) We called all the hotels we knew of and all of them were booked, we checked the directory for other hotels, and they were all booked for the night also. An hour later, I got a phone call from the manager Steven Goldberg and he said “there is nothing I can do, because the pool manager bought you guys drinks.” I told him that I would like to pay for the drinks. He said “sorry, there is nothing I can do, Okay...” then he hung up. I have never in my life been treated so poorly by so many people. When we went back to the hotel to sleep because we were told we couldn’t enter the hotel the way we exited it was roped off. We walked around, and then we were stopped by more rude staff and they asked for our room key. We began to explain that our friend wasn’t feeling well and left the restaurant early and took our key with him. The hotel staff member said very rudely, “well you better call him to come down here and give it to you. (Instead of trying to look for our names under the room, he wanted us to call our friend who we said wasn’t feeling well to come down and give us a key.) (keep in mind that you cannot go to your floor in the elevator without a room key, so we had to go to the front desk anyway to get a key, but we cant even get to the front desk because they are stopping us from the front of the hotel). We were so upset and had enough. We called a few more hotels, and settled with a night for Saturday because that was all they had. We went downstairs to the hotel check out and ask for a checkout for the next day and we didn’t want to be charged a cancellation fee. We were able to check out and checked into the Mission bay, Hilton. We were treated so well from the minute we arrived at their property. The San Diego Hard Rock Hotel is one of the worst experiences my friends and I have ever had and I definitely want to be reimbursed. Reema

Reviews.Title: “First time to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: PPowell6
Reviews.Content: Wow.....What a neat Hotel. Our first impression was great. The front desk staff could not have gone better, all the girls there went out of there way to be friendly and helpful. We went to the pool bar and things couldnt have gone any worse. The staff was rude, and basically ignore us as we watched others being waited on. Being in our 50s Im sure we were thought of not being "cool". After 20 minutes I walked up to the bar to order myself to some snobby little blonde girl. We had to ask for 4 different things ( Pina Colada, Apricot Stone Sour, and Strawberry Marquarita) which she said they didnt have the mix to do either, and no strawberrys to boot. Ten minutes after we ordered and sat down we watched her making things with strawberrys...hmmmmm We were mad as you know what and after our drinks were gone we left never to go back. I mentioned our problem with the front desk staff and she couldnt have been nicer and apolojized many times. After we came back from dinner later that night we came back to our room with a nice card and a bottle of wine from Debby the girl at the front desk. What a nice gesture for sure. We got room service a couple of times for breakfast and it was always good, little pricy but to be expected. Overall it was fun, but I would doubt if we will ever return.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Kimmberleigh
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the San Diego Hard Rock for Memorial Day weekend. It was a romantic get away weekend for us. We spent two (and too) pricey nights at the hotel. I don't mind pricey if I get good service. What we experienced was anything but good service. We arrived at the front of the hotel and the lobby was very modern looking and clean. Staffing was good and we were helped right away. We were given our room keys and up we went. As soon as the elevator doors opened, it was as if we had stepped into another hotel. The hallway was filthy. There was trash and dirt all over the carpet in the hallway. Perhaps the dark color of the carpeting showed off the dirt, but a good vacuuming was in order. When we entered the room, it appeared to be clean, at least cleaner than the hallway. Very modern looking. It took about 2 minutes for my shin to find the wood base of the bed that sticks out farther than the mattress on all sides. It wasn't the last bruise I got from the bed that weekend! We did like the bathroom decor. We thought the shower with two shower heads was great! I went to pull out the desk chair to sit down and there was a stain in the middle of the seat that looked disgusting. A call was placed to the desk to get housekeeping up to clean it. Some time during the evening, the chair was cleaned. A message was left on the phone and tv that the cleaning had been done. Sunday morning, the hallways were still dirty, in fact more trash was added to the floor. We left for a day of sailing and returned at 4:30 in the afternoon to a dirty room. They had not even made the bed, let alone do any other cleaning or straightening of the room. Another call had to be made to get the room clean. I also asked to speak with the manager. I thought I would tell him about the dirty hallway. Of course, right after I ask for the manager, I hear a vacuum in the hallway! That was short lived, only about 2 minutes of hallway vacuuming, so it was still dirty. I think maybe someone else complained so they vacuumed in front of one or two doors (we were not one of the chosen few). The manager never called. We eventually went out for the evening. The room had been cleaned by the time we returned. Sunday, check out time. Still filthy hallway on our floor. Maybe we should have checked out the other floors? I am not a neat freak but the floor was so obviously dirty it really was a disappointment, especially for the cost of staying here. Normally I hear Hard Rock and think of good things. The San Diego Hard Rock was truly a disappointment. After checking out we did inform the manager of all the problems. He just said they were short staffed in housekeeping. I'm sorry but for what they charge to stay their, and to keep their reputation, the manager should get to cleaning if need be. I won't be spending my hard earned money at Hard Rock hotels in the future. They lost me on this one.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel rocks!”
Reviews.Author: mad.nomad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention/congress. Very convenient. Great service, sometimes the rock theme goes over the top though. The bars are very busy on week ends and you have to book in advance if you want to get in even as a house guest. Don't go if you have a jealous girlfriend to this hotel! ;-) But I say it only jokingly. It is great even for throwing in a game of Padres too with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Mid 30s and I loved it”
Reviews.Author: avillebud
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to try this hotel after reading some of the reviews, but I really enjoyed the hotel. The staff were all very friendly to me and did not ostracize me for being ancient. I did find some of the uniforms the women were wearing to be a bit on the hooker side, but if you can over look the hooker boots the rooms are GREAT! The bed was very comfortable, the shower was perfect, the towels were plush, and the TV was nice... I really enjoyed the hotel. The cafe, Mary Janes, serves some great food for something quick and easy. I was at the hotel on business and the desk workspace was minimal, but it was functional. The gym was nice, had everything one would need while working out at a hotel for a few days. I would stay here more often, but the hotel does not have a loyalty program. I also thought I might hear the train as I was staying in a room that faced the train, I heard nothing. I loved the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Pretentious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PBLiving
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HR Hotel for one night just to check it out and be a tourist in my own town. The location of the hotel is great, right in the heart of the Gaslamp District and next to Petco Park. The rooms were modern and clean and we had a good view of San Diego Bay. There is music all around the hotel which is cool. My major complaint about the Hard Rock is the bars and the cost. The bars are trying to be "exclusive" by limiting people and creating fake lines to get in. If you are a hotel guest you can get on the list, but have to be in the bars by 10pm. I saw at least 5 different arguments between doormen and want to be patrons because they were not being let in and had to wait in a line even though the bars were not crowded. One lady was an owner of one of the units and was not let into the pool. She got the manager and was finally let in. The drinks are really expensive at $10 a piece, which is way above other area bars. A friend of our tried to get in but the doorman said he could not go to the bar unless he was willing to do table service, which costs at least $300. We were in the bar and there was no table service going on at that time. The people in the bars are wantabe posers, and like to act like they have money. Although I thought it was good for people watching. The pool area is really small but the bar by the pool has alot of plush seating and has a good vibe, even though most people are trying to pose. Get down there early to get a seat, otherwise there will not be any. Parking is $30 which is high, and you have everything is expensive in the hotel. We saw at least 5 different bachelor/bachelorette parties going on at the hotel. This place would be good for that. Overall, the rooms and common areas are nice and modern and have a hip vibe. It was fine for a night but I thought too expensive for more than that for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Too old to be young, too young to be a sad old rocker”
Reviews.Author: soulmates63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel, because my husband was going to a conference at the Hotel. As we walked in, the rock vibe resounded off every pillar and wall, ceiling and floor surface - it was going to be a noisy stay. The staff were very attentive, if a little too cool. The room was actually amazing. Really comfortable - it was all very new so was lovely and clean and fresh. The bed was very comfortable to lie in - but the corners of the base were keen to catch your shins and ankles and we ended up with very fashionable black and blue legs. The bathroom and loo were very spacious, but had glass doors, and although that can be quite seductive for the shower, a little more privacy for the toilet would have made it more comfortable. We had a living area and a bedroom area with two very large televisions. We had a nice balcony which meant we could easily have some fresh air as well as aircon. The only gripe really was the other guests - they seemed to party all night and didn't seem keen to close their bedroom doors, so the noise travelled! I began to sound like a very grouchy head teacher.

Reviews.Title: “It does smell like rotten eggs”
Reviews.Author: misledgeekboy
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other person, there is a smell of rotten eggs in some of the rooms. Another person that I know is staying here and said exactly the same thing, So if your lucky, you won't get one of the rooms with a ventilation problem, and if your unlucky like my friends and myself and can't change rooms, then you live with the bathroom a bit smelly...

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor and stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: JackJackSF
Reviews.Content: I recently went to this Hotel recently with a few buddies for a relaxing weekend in a suit overlooking the pool. I had stayed at the Hard Rock in Chicago and had a good experience with that property, so I though the San Diego property would be similar. At first blush, I liked the modern design of the hotel. But I can see how people would be turned off by the design. The valets and front desk clerks were great, but that's about the end of the positive comments. At night, getting back into the hotel was like getting into a prison. They set up a velvet rope at both entrances and make you display a key card to get into the lobby (even though you need a key card to get the elevators to work). I can see some safety logic to this, although the hotel is in a safe area. But the problem I had was the doorman refusing to accept my key card on multiple occasions. As others have noted, there is the Sweetwater Saloon on the ground floor, which might be popular at some time. During the weekend I was there, it was not busy. Regardless, the bouncers are incredibly rude to the hotel guests. We went to have a drink after dinner and were told that we couldn't go inside, even though we had put our names on the stupid guest list you have to use just to get a drink. The bar was less than half full and the bouncer let another group in while we were arguing. After I asked why the new group was allowed in, he told me that I had to leave the lobby or I would be arrested for trespassing. I'm not sure how I could be trespassing in a hotel that I had paid to stay in, but that was his threat. At the same time, I was soon surrounded by a bunch of bouncer-thugs who "insisted" that I leave the lobby. I went back to my room, but it seems like a weird way to treat your customers. The next night, we hung out on the bar by the pool. We met a few new people who had rented out a cabana and had purchased some bottles of vodka. Last call came and another bouncer stuck his nose in the cabana and told me I (and just me) had to leave. I showed him my key card and he accused me of having a fake card. He played with the card and talked on his walkie talkie. He eventually gave me my room key back, but then said that I "had a lot of balls" to be sitting in there. I don't think anyone should have to be insulted by the hotel's staff, especially in front of someone you just met. The whole thing left a bad taste in my mouth. What made it worse is that I've stayed at the Omni, which is basically across the street, and had a wonderful time. I would suggest anyone who is not wedded to the Hard Rock to stay at the Omni, unless you don't like being treated like a valued human being. Also, the rooms are fairly small and the tv remotes suck. There's no lock on either the toilet or the shower, and the both have frosted glass walls. Mary Janes' was pretty good for a diner. The location is great, but as I've said before, there are a ton of hotels nearby and the Hard Rock's location is not better than any other.

Reviews.Title: “uber-cool”
Reviews.Author: Robwash
Reviews.Content: Have stayed twice for the weekend for a quick getaway. We live in Los Angeles. Have stayed at several of the other hotels in the area, the Solamar and Hilton being the best of them. First, the negatives: $30 per day valet fee (ouch). They do warn you though and there is a lot between the hotel and the ballpark which is a lot cheaper. Can be noisy in the halls at night. Quite a few private parties with beautiful young and drunk people in some of the rooms. Rooms were clean but housekeeping was erratic. Still not sure if there was an actual turndown service. Phantom extra charges for reasons that weren't clear. I was afraid to even breathe around the mini-bar. And if you like uncomfortable modern furniture, you'll love this place. Wear ankle pads...trust me. The positives: THE best location. Great bars. Nobu right in the hotel. A buzz in the lobby and all around and within the hotel that lets you know this is the epicenter of the Gaslamp quarter. You will smile when you walk in. Super-friendly , young, attractive, and energetic staff. Exciting place to stay. The bottom line: The hotel offers an experience. If you feel like doing "trendy", this is your best bet. The Solamar is more refined with a somewhat more mature clientele. But it is also slightly less "hip". The "W" has a mediocre location for a short stay. If you want the great location without the pizazz, try the Hilton. Otherwise, the Hard Rock is a fun alternative. Gratuitous tips: book Nobu BEFORE you arrive. Lots of great steak houses. Donovan's is the best, the Palm the worst. There is a new Zagets guide for San Diego. Stay the heck on our side of the border. Check out the bleachers at PetCo field if their isn't a game. It's a park open to the public. Carry a little pop-up map. Have a Mojito at lunch; you will ahve a better time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place I have Stayed at in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Reddog5150
Reviews.Content: After our second stay, I feel safe saying that this is the place to stay in San Diego. I love the location and the rooms. This time we had a view of the city skyline and the pool. We had breakfast via room service and it was great and fast. The hotel is still getting up and running, but I think it already beats any other choice for a great hotel in San Diego. The location cannot be beat. We left the hotel a few times to take in the gaslamp district and we were always within a minute or two of our room. I am looking forward to the Summer pool scene and walking next door to Petco park. FYI, the trolley stops right outside the front door. This was perfect when we went to lunch in old town.

Reviews.Title: “Cool but LOUD”
Reviews.Author: travelsmith505
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was overall pretty cool, and in a great location. The shower was nice and the beds were comfortable, but the place was a zoo on a Saturday night, and not exactly what I wanted to deal with. If you want to be up clubbing all night then it's a cool place to stay. BUT, if you thought that maybe you could come home at 1am and get some sleep, think again. The club on the 4th floor roof pumps out music so loud that we felt like we were in the club from our 11th floor room. I assumed that the place would have a lot going on, but not THAT much. We also had to push our way past a bunch of people just to get to the front door, and then show the bouncers our room key just to get in the building. So I'm guessing this is supposed to make us feel cool that we got in? Not sure... I'm not at all insulting Hard Rock because they've got a great brand and they are doing a good job of keeping up their image. I just wanted to pass along the details in case someone else was interested in a relaxing vacation. FYI...The valet service is $30 for guests, and you have to pay a mandatory $15 a night for a bottle of water, some candy, phone calls and internet services (which should be optional in my opinion).

Reviews.Title: “Rock and Roll Hangover”
Reviews.Author: MonkeysGirl
Reviews.Content: It pains me to give as harsh of a criticism as I am about to give to such a beautifully designed hotel, but I can't in good conscience stay silent. To get a feel for the place imagine a 4 Seasons hotel that has been commercialized to be a cheap and annoying version of something like Applebee's. It is like Britney Spears wrote the customer service training manual and hired the staff just after John Lennon or Jim Morrison signed off on the establishment. The staff are young, hip, good looking people who seem to be more preoccupied with looking cool than running a hotel. Our very first taste of things to come began as we got out at the valet entrance of the hotel. The valets were clearly not interested in listening to what the customer needed as much as they wanted to herd you through the line like cattle. Not completely out of the ordinary, but it became a problem later when we got to the room and find our luggage missing some items that we told the baggage handler's to bring up in the first place. The lobby is very loud which makes it difficult to hear. The receptionist asked what music we wanted four times, A minor issue considering the larger ones I will discuss, but even after asking four different times through the noise in the lobby our music in the room was still wrong. When we got upstairs we were impressed by the room's beautiful design, view, and quality furnishings. Our room featured a massive wall mounted LCD flat screen television complete with interactive menu and internet connectivity provided by a remote control keypad. The minute we turned the TV on, the music was gone for good not to return because we couldn't figure out how to get it back. It should be noted that if you are not the most technically inclined of people the rooms multimedia gadgets are difficult to manuver. There was no ethernet cable available in the room as advertised, so we were unable to access the internet from our computer, forcing us to use the internet via the tv. The keypad remote used to surf the internet did not work very well and we were forced to abandoned our cause. Unfortunately, our television would not work after that and maintenance had to be called to fix the problem. The repairman was perplexed with what to do to fix the issue, and we waited with him for about 45 minutes in a small room thinking of what we should do with ourselves in the meantime. Once he figured it out we thanked him and decided it would be best not to use the internet again which was sad because we paid something like $15.99 for the service we could no longer use. As a personal opinion perhaps not shared by others, it has always bothered me for a really nice pricey hotel to charge for internet service. It feels like I am being nickeled and dimed. About the time we were saying goodbye to our repairman we realized that some of our bags were missing. This is when I discovered that the bellman did not listen when I said please bring all of mine and my wife's bags to the room. I immediately went down to see where the breakdown was stopping at the valet desk to discuss the problem. The valet apologized and said he would correct the problem. I waited to see what the results would be for about 15 minutes. When nothing happened I asked what the problem was. The valet began asking me about the color and make of my vehicle. He apologized and said that his staff couldn't find the car. Realizing of course, he could do nothing for me and perhaps wanting to dodge the bullet, turned me over to the manager who behaved as if I was bothering him. He was impatient and somewhat inconsiderate of my problem. He never even once apologized for what had happened. Instead he opted to have me go down with him to search for the vehicle. Once we found the vehicle he told me to stay put, he ran away to go and search for the keys leaving me down in a garage I had no idea how to get out of. I found the exit and the valet floor boss no sooner than the manager arrived to tell me his people lost the keys and that the Hard Rock would gladly be picking up the parking fees. About ten minutes later the manager found the keys and had the vehicle into the queue because he thought I needed it. I just needed the bags. The car waited in the valet queue upstairs in the rain for approximately 20 minutes without my knowledge before I asked what was taking so long to get my bags and looking around the corner to see if they had brought the car up instead of bringing the bags. Sadly I was right and the bags were in the car still waiting in the valet line. Once I saw this I told the valet to bring the remainder of the bags up now. I went upstairs and my wife asked why I didn't bring the bags up myself and I alluded that we could trust the valet's at the hotel to do that. I was wrong and after a 20 minute conversation with my wife I found myself going back downstairs to find the bags sitting unattended in the lobby. I had to find someone to get the bags and follow me upstairs. After we had all of our things upstairs it was time to use the shower. The shower in the bathroom is very beautifully designed featuring a duel shower head system ( the first of which I had ever seen). There was a lever in the shower to control hot and cold and another valve to control water temperature above 100 degrees Fahrenheit. The water temperature gage didn't work and for the most part we took lukewarm showers. We already complained enough that to do so would have just resulted in us having to tell the staff about it and that had already proven to just be an addition to our inconveniences. The room service offers very simple fare at exorbetant prices with all types of little costs here and there to expand the company's profit margin. The room service orders took forever and once they arrived my wife's of course was incorrect. We had previously explained that my wife was allergic to tomatoes, and the salad she had ordered was covered in them. We called down to have them correct the order. After two phone calls explaining what we needed, the guy finally arrived 45 minutes later. (What we wanted was just a replacement salad without tomatoes). Instead, he arrived with another sandwich (my order) and a replacement salad for my wife. Of course it was completely wrong again, instead of a the dinner salad she ordered it was a smaller side salad. The meal was comped at our suggestion and left in an incorrect status. The next morning we awoke to find our paper missing. All other doors had a paper in front of them except ours. When we asked the a local cleaning lady what the deal was, she said it happens all the time and told us to simply steal someone else's from there room. Very rock and roll! I don't really care for the whole novelty angle of modern American dining and hotel stay that has become so prevalent in that part of the market these days. I didn't like the whole "how may we rock your world" slogan everyone used whenever you called when they seemed to care so little about what it was that you needed in the first place. It may have been if they actually seemed to care about rocking our world. The check out of the hotel was interesting to say the least. The receptionist asked me how my stay was and I blurted out "terrible" Her jaw dropped as if I had no right to answer with anything other than an affirmative "terrific". She demanded I give her my phone number and tell me what went wrong so that she could pass it on to her manager. When the manager finally got around to calling me the next day she left a confused message saying that one of her staff left her a message telling her to call us. She was clearly not read in on the list of problems I left the receptionist nor was she calling to address those issues. She was merely calling to find out what I wanted. We didn't return her call and resolved that the entire staff at the hotel was simply incompetent. We stayed with friends in the other rooms who were equally unimpressed with their stays at the hotel. Our overall rating was terribly unimpressive and I was really glad we lucked out with a discounted rate prior to checking in the hotel. If you simply want a nice hotel with a polite staff that will do what you need done the first time at a reasonable price avoid the Hard Rock like the plague. If you are just going for the novelty, then bring along some patience for the incompetent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It To Yourself! I'd Rather A Stay at the Super 8”
Reviews.Author: jetsetera
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego for a trade show we were attending for work. I had originally booked a different hotel but my husband said his coworkers were staying at the Hard Rock and since it's new we should give it a try. So I changed our reservation. Talk about regret! We live just north of San Diego, so we drove to the hotel in our car. We drove up to the valet and were greeted with a "Valet is only for guests of the hotel or restaurants." My husband was immediately annoyed by the greeting and told the rude valet that we were in fact guests of the hotel and were valeting the car for our 3 day stay. $30/day, I would hope that they greeted guests with "How do you do! Welcome to the Hard Rock!" No one helped us with our bags so we brought our bags towards the front desk to check. The lobby was loud and full of try hards trying to look cool. We got up to our room and my husband went to a work event as soon we got to the room. I stayed in and ordered dinner from Mary Jane's. I wasn't expecting much since it's a glorified diner but I do have to say the meatloaf was decent. The best part about the hotel is the free internet (Don't use Firefox as your web browser, it's very spotty). The rooms are clean but I would hope so with a fairly brand new hotel. The room looks really good but you can tell the decor will look really horrible over time if not taken care of. The bathroom is decent but nothing to write home about. They fool you with 2 shower heads but it's no different than a regular shower. The water pressure is the same. Just a note: the bathroom has a sheer door so if you have to share a room with someone you're not that close to, it might be a bit awkward. We had a dinner at Nobu which I have to say was good but definitely not as smooth as my usual dining experiences at other Nobu locations or Matsuhisa in LA. Nicole our server was really nice. Everyone else seemed like they were hating life, especially the hostesses. Please don't stay on a weekend or during a convention week. There was a party at the Sweetwater Saloon and I could hear the lyrics of every song loud and clear from my 3rd story room. I was staying there because I was attending a convention and trying to sleep at 1:30am but how could I when all I could hear was Britney Spears saying "Give me! Give me! Give me more!" I wanted to slit my wrists it was so awful. I called down to the front desk and she said that the music turns off at 2am. Did they not think of sound proofing when they built this hotel? The following day my husband got a bad case of food poisoning (from dining at the Rock Bottom Brewery down the street). He skipped out on work because he was feeling so ill. I stepped out to the 7-11 to get him some Gatorade and other supplies before I went to a work dinner and cocktail party. When I got back to the hotel, the doormen didn't even want to let me in. After struggling with my grocery bags and purse, I finally found my key. I would think the bouncer would be able to tell that I, in my ratty sweats, messy ponytail and dirty sneakers was not going to the club. When I got back to the room, my husband was throwing up severely. He was trying to get a bucket of ice from room service. He had said many times that he was sick and that he needed ice. No one at mission control was smart enough to tell him that the wait for ice was going to be 1 hour and that he could have gone to an ice machine himself on the 5th floor. (Shouldn't there be a note in their little hotel binder about ice machines or something?). At around 2am, we both lay in bed listening to the drunken patrons of the hotel stream out onto the street. We said that we'll check out of the hotel first thing in the morning and not even shower or eat. We just wanted to get home, the hotel stay was so awful. Most hotels we stay at, we ask for late check outs. This hotel, we were dying to leave! In the morning I explained to "mission control" that my husband was sick and that I needed to have the car ready because I was going to take him to a doctor. The girl said sorry but the valet is busy, you'll have to come down and give him the ticket. So I went down to give them the ticket and waited in what I thought was a line up to check out. Somehow people just walked up in front of me. The check out person asked how my stay was and I told her terrible. When I got home I checked my bill and realized were were overcharged for valet. Check your bills thoroughly!! I called back later asking to speak to a manager. When you spend $300/night, I expect a bit of a better stay. At least if you stay at a Super 8, you know you're getting dog crap. But when I spend over $1500 at the hotel in 3 days, I would expect more than dog crap. I got a call a week later from a manager. Whomever I spoke to offered us to be upgraded in the future. That's funny because I would never stay there again, not if my life depended on it. Even if they enticed me with free stay or free food. Nothing in that place will ever get better. It's the kind of place that only cares about image and how cool they are. There are so many better places than the Hard Rock in San Diego. Don't stay here. Unless of course you're into horrible service and a cool scene full of try hards, wannabes and cokeheads.

Reviews.Title: “did not enjoy our stay”
Reviews.Author: SD_VRSCDX
Reviews.Content: My fiance and i liked the modern look of this new trendy hotel in san diego. Since we live downtown San Diego, we thought we would give it a shot one weekend to have some fun. We are late 20's/ early 30's and we love to party - but good god this was not good! Its a mad house trying to get in the door near the hotel bar sweetwater - even as a guest. The Front doors are roped off to the hotel. THe staff at the bar sucks! the GM at the bar is an [--] - enough about the sweetwater... The rooms are nice- we stayed in the woodstock suite. HOWEVER, we didnt realize it was going to sound like our college days of living in the frat house! Music playing all night long. Coked out people stumbling around the halls and elevators. The staff is non responsive (except for a very nice couple that is soon to be married). We called for a bell boy and never saw one. We carried our stuff down and the concierge person was playing solitaire on the computer. The people at the hotel think its a plush vegas hotel and try to treat the guests like they are on sunset - in other words- they treat people like crap. We are never going back. We'll stick w/ the Ivy for a fun trendy hotel in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, Unprofessional, and Condescending”
Reviews.Author: WorldSurfer11
Reviews.Content: This hotel stay ruined my vacation to San Diego. We made our reservations for our stay on the Hard Rock Hotel website and when we arrived the room provided to us was a far cheaper than we payed for. When we tried to explain this misunderstanding to the hotel staff we were promised a call from the hotel manager that we never received. When we went down to the front desk for the second time asking to speak to the manager directly he then continued to blame the error on us saying we selected the wrong option on the website and the option that we choose did not exist. When we showed him the website that proved him wrong he refused to give us a discounted rate or move us into the room we requested. The hotel also closes its only pool at 6 o clock and the area becomes a noisy night club. The hotel's staffs incompetences continued even after our stay calling us and accusing us of taking all the drinks in the mini bar and trying to add 232 dollars to our bill. Avoid this hotel, this was without a doubt the worst service I have ever received at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tijuana Rolex”
Reviews.Author: Holbywan
Reviews.Content: Well, why the name Tijuana Rolex? It sums up the Hard Rock San Diego experience perfectly. Upon first glance, the Hard Rock hotel is nothing short of spectacular. Flashy lights, impressive amounts of courteous staff and the rooms are new and modern although otherwise average. After you dig in a bit you find out just how unimpressive the hotel is. The staff couldn’t accommodate a large party of professionals largely due to the fact the bars and restaurants in the hotel are managed by someone other than the Hard Rock! Why? Good question but we were not even allowed into the bars after spending $500 per night on a room there. Go figure. The security staff makes you feel like you’re in a maximum security prison. So just that Rolex you bought south of the boarder and were so impressed with, as soon as you get it home you realize just how below average it really is. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Phantomdissenter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock for 2 nights on the 21st and 22nd of December. I got a room looking toward the Convention center. The room was super modern, with obviously no details overlooked. Everything from the ulta-modern lighting options, customized tunes on check-in, to the expensive bottle of tequila were top notch. The bathroom was elegant and inviting. The hotel itself has two great nightclubs, one on the ground floor and one on the pool deck. Both were packed with beautiful people. It's obviously the place to be in San Diego right now, and if I wasn't a hotel guest, I probably wouldn't have been able to get in. In fact, I had some local buddies trying to get in with us, and they were turned away from both clubs. Overall, it's a great hotel with an awesome vibe! It's definitely a great alternative to Vegas if you live in L.A. and want to go somewhere to party for the weekend. I'll be staying there again for sure.

HotelInfo.Name: Hard Rock Hotel San Diego
